jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.


You Benefit From


Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

jobs.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Search/Recommender Systems
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY


As a software engineer you will focus on developing Zalando’s in-house search engine service and recommender system into state-of-the-art microservices providing highly relevant personalize search results and recommendations for the customer. Your main task will be positioning this technology as a “software as a service” component which can be fully leveraged within the Zalando platform. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Java and Scala developers, and expert data scientists.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You have at least 3 years of experience, working as a Java or Scala Software Developer

  • You are experienced with Lucene-based technologies like Solr and Elasticsearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with data scientists to bring data centric 

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You know the most common design patterns and you know in which context to apply them

  • A background in applied machine learning is a plus

  • You love to optimize processes and code, and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving data-driven products at scale, which are real-time oriented

  • You have worked with current big data technology (e.g. Hadoop, Amazon Elastic MapReduce)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommendation and personalization engine in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world’s best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment 


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Krista Vanhala at krista.johanna.maria.vanhala@zalando.de

jobs.title: Jr. Android Developer
jobs.content:
About the Role


We’re looking for a talented Jr. Android Developer to join our growing Brooklyn-based mobile development agency. You’ll work with our Clients, Designers, Project Managers, and other Developers to create cutting-edge codebases for our clients’ diverse native mobile applications.


The people who thrive in this position can switch modes easily between solo efforts and team projects, and can overcome a wide array of coding challenges. They enjoy the rigor of producing high quality code that’s at the forefront of industry innovation. They’re thorough, detail-oriented, and take pride in their work. We are these things, too.


Working at App Partner


Fact is, the kind of people who work at App Partner could work just about anywhere. They’re smart. They’re creative. They’re fun. They’re engaged. And they take a ridiculous amount of pride in doing what needs to be done to make sure our clients get what they need, when they need it. So why do they choose to work at App Partner? Simple. Because we get it.


We get that most people want to work in a great office in a vibrant neighborhood like Brooklyn – not some office park in suburbia. We get that work needs to be fun, vibrant and exciting – but never distracting. We get that transparency, communication and opportunities for growth matter. A lot. And that free snacks don’t hurt, either. We get that work is a big part of your life, but it’s not your whole life. And we get that smart, creative people want to be around other smart, creative people. Think you have what it takes? Apply and let’s talk.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, modify, and test high-quality code

  • Work from specifications drawn up by our Sr. Developers or Head of Development

  • Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, developers, and strategists

  • Take ownership of the projects you’re assigned

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer- Leading Open Source Company
jobs.content:
Want to work for one of the fastest growing software companies in the World and love Open Source?


Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow our Cloud Site Reliability team. We're a part of the Elastic Cloud team with an operations background who aren’t afraid to get our hands dirty.  We are the first line of consumers for Elastic's products and our experience helps influence the direction of the product.   While most organizations may have a single or a handful of Elastic Stack deployments, here, you’ll be responsible for identifying, troubleshooting and reporting platform problems to developers in order to ensure that the thousands of Elasticsearch clusters that we manage are providing a stable and reliable service.  We’re looking for people who are just as excited about troubleshooting issues with distributed systems as they are to automate, code and collaborate to solve problems.


Responsibilities




  • Report and troubleshoot problems within the Elastic Cloud infrastructure services and collaborate on issues with developers




  • Handle day to day operations around the Elastic Cloud such as customer trouble tickets managing cloud provider infrastructure (maintenance/expansion), and software deployments




  • Develop and enhance tooling to deploy and manage the Elastic Cloud product and infrastructure




  • Demonstrate and promote best practices for teams using cloud platforms

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
SiteCompli is looking for a talented Backend Engineer who will have a key stake in building new products and features for our award winning, innovative software engineering company in the Commercial Real Estate business. Our product suite makes NYC real estate compliance easy to navigate for the largest building owners and property managers in the world.


We need someone who is passionate about engineering scalable, distributed solutions around deep technical challenges and complex datasets. You’ll work to create and mature complex data models, leveraging Amazon Web Services and test-driven design to shape & deploy critical new infrastructure and platforms. You’ll work with Python, Postgres and NGINX; the ability to develop clean, concise code is a must. You will need to know your way around a Linux box. You’ll even work on some NoSQL (MongoDB, RethinkDB), Message Queuing (RabbitMQ) and other exciting technology. You’ll bring new ideas to the table, champion new processes and technologies, learn new stuff and most importantly – have a great time doing it.


What we’re building:



  • APIs which glue our product offerings together

  • Methods to trend, analyze and correlate complex compliance data for our clients

  • Robust development and deployment practices for our engineering teams

  • A platform that will bring a new level of data insights and intelligence to the commercial real estate world


Day to Day:



  • Build out new functionality within our successful products, improving existing features and smashing the occasional bug.

  • Work on new, cutting edge tech for our demanding (and growing) client base.

  • Use technology practices and tools that you are passionate about to build great things.

  • Learn about new technology and practices that will help grow your career and improve our client experience.

jobs.title: Application Architect/Integration Lead
jobs.content:
ProSight is looking for experienced and motivated candidates who combine strategic thinking, creativity, and technical skills to drive results at a fast growing, dynamic company.  ProSight’s business model focuses on specific customer niches and delivers a competitive advantage through a deeper understanding of the customer and superior underwriting execution.


The Architect / Integration Lead will lead the development of application programming interface (API) in support of ProSight’s Digital Strategy.   The Architect will analyze the current eco system and will design solutions to expose core data to our digital channels. 


The Architect will work with the development resources to create application/integration frameworks, reusable components, or proof of concepts as needed.  The role will partner with the leader of Digital Products and business analysts to align on design decisions and implement the solution to meet the desired business outcomes.  This role reports to the leader of Architecture and Data Management.


The role has direct responsibility for leading code development and for effectively communicating solution concepts.  A candidate will need to have a firm understanding of object orientated analysis and design, design pattern usage and service orientation.  The design and development work for the role will be project related but will need to align with the enterprise architecture.  Design deliverables will go through a design and gate review.


 Responsibilities:









  • Responsible for technical analysis, estimates, and technical design of solutions

  • Lead the execution of proof of concepts when appropriate

  • Perform system analysis and designing of new integrations

  • Creation of Project documentation including High Level Design (HLD) and Detailed Design Documents and diagrams when appropriate

  • Design and govern the reusable service repository, design patterns and reusable technical components (e.g. Web Services, Rest and SOA components, ESB orchestrations, data transformations, error handling, auditing, logging etc.)

  • Collaborate with the infrastructure/operations team, DBAs, technical leads, developers and business analysts for design activities

  • Write technical designs according to standard templates; using use cases, UML diagrams and descriptive narratives in a clear, unambiguous, and concise manner

  • Manage changes to base lined design through effective application of change control processes and tools

  • Partner with Project Managers and Business Analysts to ensure API services are delivered in a timely

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
SiteCompli is looking for a talented Senior Backend Engineer who will have a key stake in building new products and features for our award winning, innovative software engineering company in the Commercial Real Estate business. Our product suite makes NYC real estate compliance easy to navigate for the largest building owners and property managers in the world.


We need someone who is passionate about engineering scalable, distributed solutions around deep technical challenges and complex datasets.  You’ll work to create and mature complex data models, leveraging Amazon Web Services and test-driven design to shape & deploy critical new infrastructure and platforms. You’ll work with Python, Postgres and NGINX; the ability to develop clean, concise code is a must.  You will need to know your way around a Linux box. You’ll even work on some NoSQL (MongoDB, RethinkDB), Message Queuing (RabbitMQ) and other exciting technology. You’ll bring new ideas to the table, champion new processes and technologies, learn new stuff and most importantly – have a great time doing it.


What we’re building:



  • APIs which glue our product offerings together

  • Methods to trend, analyze and correlate complex compliance data for our clients

  • Robust development and deployment practices for our engineering teams

Day to Day:



  • Architect, guide and build out new functionality within our successful products, improving existing features and smashing the occasional bug.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life


As a member of the Ruby Software Engineering team, you'll work closely with our receptionists and other team members to deliver WOW-worthy solutions for both our clients and partners.


We work in two-week sprints, iteratively advancing multiple company initiatives.  The work typically spans multiple technology platforms, including various .NET applications, on-premise and cloud-hosted web services, mobile applications, and multiple web sites.


We're looking for a strong cross-functional developer who can move between roles and technologies as needed – you might be coding a RESTful endpoint in the morning, and debugging a stored procedure in the afternoon.

jobs.title: Senior .Net
jobs.content:
Want a work culture where you are challenged every single day?  Want to work on new exciting, back-end applications and collaborate with a small team of elite developers who will expand your knowledge every single day?  Want to become the very best developer you can be by working in a very relaxed, but extremely high-throughput environment?


We are not an agency....and we don't work for anyone else.  We develop our cutting edge software solutions from scratch and offer these world class Software As A Service to thousands of customers all over the world.


We are TurnCommerce – a small group of elite developers working on next generation applications, such as building our own DNS platform handling more than 300 requests per second, building tools to mitigate from extremely large scale DDOS attacks, etc.  Our mantra is to develop almost everything from scratch and by doing this we are always learning.  If we are not all collectively learning together, what is the point??


Our core business is a domain name registrar housing more than 2.5 million domains.  We continue to push the boundaries and are actively building many other tools and services and achieving a very high rate of growth.


If you are looking for a developer-centric culture where you will be rewarded for your efforts and want to be part of an elite group, please contact us.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
The What and Why Now


We are looking for an experienced web developer to help us evolve our award winning, live receptionist service into a world class communication system for small business.


A Day in the Life


As a member of the Ruby Software Engineering team, you'll work closely with other team members, as well as our Product and UX departments, building WOW-worthy websites for both our clients and partners.


In particular, you’ll help us as we rebuild an existing ASP.NET website using the latest front-end technologies and SOA.  You’ll also help us iterate and improve other web properties, by improving Salesforce integration, working with our Marketing team to improve analytics and tracking, and in general, using your strong knowledge of front-end technologies to create fantastic user experiences.

So this is really you?


You're passionate about technology, are proud of the work you do, and want to work for a company that shares your values.


You’re also fun and collaborative, and you have a reputation for doing what you say you’ll do.  Others would point to you as someone they’d love to work with, and your brilliant mind and innovative solutions inspire us all to do great work.


We recognize you have choices.  You’ve got the experience and work ethos so many employers are looking for.  Call us crazy, but even in this competitive environment, we’re not going to compromise on our commitment to hiring only the best, brightest, and friendliest people in town.  And that is why we want YOU.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you wish you could live and breathe sports every day? We are looking for a software engineer who would love to create highly engaging products for sports teams and fans!


Who you are: You're a talented engineer and have an insatiable appetite for basketball, football, baseball, and/or soccer. You want to join a small team and work in a fast-paced, high-energy, results-oriented environment. You communicate complicated ideas simply. You embrace the freedom to make important decisions and be accountable for them. We believe in sharing the ball, and you, too, are a team player (to a fault).

jobs.title: iOS Developer- 3740
jobs.content: Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc., has opportunities for developers interested in building exceptional iOS applications. Developers at Asynchrony Labs are responsible for the development of applications to solve business, engineering, and scientific problems. Asynchrony Labs is a highly collaborative environment where developers work very closely with other team members and clients to solve problems.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content: Asynchrony Labs, has opportunities for developers interested in building exceptional iOS applications. Developers at Asynchrony Labs are responsible for the development of applications to solve business, engineering, and scientific problems. Asynchrony Labs is a highly collaborative environment where developers work very closely with other team members and clients to solve problems.

jobs.title: .Net Software Engineer
jobs.content: Asynchrony Labs has opportunities for a highly motivated .Net Software Engineer.  Candidates will be responsible for the analysis of business, engineering, and scientific problems, and the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures, and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions. Should have experience with hands-on .Net development. This includes detailed software design, developing code with unit tests to implement the design, correcting flaws based on requirements testing, and integrating the applications.­­

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job summary


Position is responsible for performing requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, verification and validation, and maintenance of enterprise custom desktop and web-based solutions for editing and reporting on geospatial databases with links to legacy systems. Responsible for developing software code to standards, meeting requirements on schedule and with minimal defects while also assisting in test development. This role involves working within a software support team in a collaborative environment.


Summary of essential job functions



  • Modify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performance.

  • Participate in full software lifecycle development, including requirements elicitation, design, development, testing, and verification, either entering a project at a certain stage or taking a project from beginning to end

  • All Skyline Software engineers are expected to be able to be customer facing; while this position is in our headquarters, meetings occasionally take place to review status and discuss future potential opportunities

  • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.

jobs.title: Quality Advocate- 3748
jobs.content:
The Quality Advocate works closely with other team members to build quality in, through the following responsibilities:



  • Keep the team and stakeholders informed of a holistic view of the product’s quality.

  • Elicit examples that act as or clarify acceptance criteria.

  • Encourage collaboration and discussion about doing better testing within the team.

  • Help developers plan and build automated checks at the right levels of the system in order to provide the optimal return of feedback to cost of ownership of the test suite.

  • Evaluate the product’s fitness for purpose by learning about it through exploratory testing and experimentation to complement automated checks.

  • Work with stakeholders to determine which features and defect fixes are critical to the end user and business.

  • Work with stakeholders to identify reasonable quality goals based on product needs.

  • Work with the team to improve processes to ensure that the team meets those quality goals.

  • Measure how closely the product meets the quality goals set forth by the stakeholders, including risk as it applies to the quality of the product.

  • Carry out root-cause analysis of defects when they occur.

  • Partner with everyone from the product owner to operations to help ensure that everyone is working towards the goal of delivering a quality working product into production.

  • Pair with developers to write clean and maintainable test code.

  • Ask questions and challenge others to consider the consequences of design decisions.

jobs.title: Junior Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Furniture and product design studio seeks to hire a well-rounded, adaptable junior designer who is not afraid to work in a variety of settings and get their hands dirty when necessary. This position also includes the opportunity to follow and learn about the industry within a furniture start-up partnered with the design studio. The studio is located in Pasadena, CA, though travel to various production facilities throughout LA may be required.
 
Responsibilities:
3D modeling and drafting
Product research and development
Research, select, and source materials
Conduct user testing reviews related to furniture start-up
Assist in operations of furniture start-up warehouse facility
Assist with production tasks throughout all design phases
Assist with graphics and visual design presentations
 
Skills:
Proficiency with Solidworks/Keyshot or similar applications
Proficiency with Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premier Pro)
Model shop experience
Knowledge of manufacturing processes and technologies
Excellent sketching/drawing skills
Technologically savvy
 
Qualities of an ideal candidate:
Bachelors in industrial design or related field
1-3 years design work experience
Strong graphic and visualization capability
Ability to communicate and understand concepts and ideas visually AND verbally
Strong sense of design and eye for detail
Comfortable working independently and proactively
Takes on new challenges with optimism and enthusiasm
Receptive to feedback and criticism

jobs.title: Sr Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you interested in pioneering the next generation of personalization that blends physical and virtual worlds seamlessly leveraging the richest map data in existence, all things digital, social networks, and real-time predictive analytics at scale (big data) to create an in-the-moment experience that enrich people’s lives? HERE is building mobile apps and services to help people solve daily challenges and enrich their lives. It is our goal to help people live delightful, safer, more economic, more sustainable lives while respecting their privacy by providing the right map and the right experience, for every moment. Built on more than 25 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 41 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit our official blog at http://360.here.com/ The product development team in Seattle is expanding to help realize this vision, and searching for engineers at all levels with expertise in mobile app, web services and big data. We are looking for candidates that are entrepreneurial, highly motivated with their own opinions who want to shape product and implement pioneering technology that matters to consumers. The ability to have fun turning great ideas into inspired products is a must. Main responsibilities



  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web services running on open source stacks (Linux, Java).

  • Develop products using agile methods and tools.

  • Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.

  • Extensively use test automation or Test Driven Development during development process.

  • Continually create and update domain expertise documentation for internal and external customers.

  • Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.

  • Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web services.

  • Drive design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.

  • Drive architecture and design efforts across multiple teams, across multiple HERE divisions.

  • Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

  • Mentor and assist other engineers in your areas of ownership and expertise.

jobs.title: C Software Engineer With SQL
jobs.content:
C++ Software Engineer with SQL - $45k


Are you one of top Software Engineers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $45,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Company Description

Devfactory provides enterprise software solutions that deliver business results, performance and scalability while dramatically reducing IT spending. Devfactory's patented solutions decrease IT expenditures by reducing hardware and associated maintenance, leveraging open source technology, and accelerating value delivery to business customers.


Devfactory is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description

At Devfactory you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.


Key responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Writing and debugging both unit and integration tests for enterprise applications

  • You will be expected to effectively execute the transition of current code to new technologies and update third party components

  • Proactively plan, implement, and maintain DB operational services, backup and recovery.

  • Take ownership of the process of identifying dependencies and performing code reviews, helping us to maintain our standard of excellence throughout the process.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
As a QA Engineer you will estimate, plan, and coordinate testing activities. You will also ensure that quality issues and defects are appropriately identified, documented, tracked, and resolved in our defect tracking system.


We are a consulting firm that combines technology, strategy, and human performance design to engineer performance support solutions for our client’s employees.


We are expanding and looking for a QA Engineer to join our ranks.


You will be working with the developer group to ensure unit tests are properly carried out at the developer level, integration tests are carried out at the repository level and that test plans and the ticket system are properly leveraged to ensure all of our products are delivered with utmost quality.


You will be designing and implementing testing processes for The Iona Group.


You will be working internally with our team members and externally with our clients. We place a premium on employees who can learn new things and who can communicate successfully.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Why is Front-End Engineering important to Thunder?


Thunder has built the very first Creative Management Platform. We often push the limits of what can be done in a browser. We have wowed some of our biggest clients with the technology that we have created. Thousands of users interact with our platform every day and we strive to make that interaction as seamless as possible. The face of our entire operation is built by our talented and dedicated Front-End Engineers.


What does a Front-End Engineer do?


Front-End Engineers are responsible for building cohesive design and UX components as well as shaping the future of what our product can do. Our stack is Angular, Backbone, and SASS but we think that the right engineer can use their experience with any MVC (MVVC, MVVM, etc…) type framework and translate it to success on our team. We are looking for Engineers that have expertise in building efficient, and scalable front-end applications that connect to public and internal APIs, using both pure JavaScript and frameworks. At Thunder you would be building the face of a platform with huge amounts of impact across the entire company.


What is something you might work on?


We have some pretty big projects in the pipeline. Some of them are internal and some are external. There are a couple we are very excited about.



  • Building an interface and experience for creating ads with custom, user-defined animations

  • Creating a real-time, collaborative process for editing ads


What are other important traits and focuses?



  • Writing testable and tested code

  • Enjoys code review

  • Continuous Learning and Teaching

  • Automating Everything

  • Strong opinions, weakly held

  • Promote best practices and coding standards

  • Strong focus on correctness, simplicity and maintainability

jobs.title: Senior .NET Engineer
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE


Cylance is one of the fastest growing companies in cyber security. By successfully applying artificial intelligence and machine learning to crack the DNA of malware, Cylance has redefined the endpoint protection market, garnered acclaim from industry analysts and won numerous awards including “Best Emerging Vendor” from SC Magazine. If you have the passion and desire to disrupt industries, protect the world from cyber attacks, and be at the forefront of a revolutionary new technology, we want you to join us!


THE POSITION


Cylance is seeking a Senior .NET Software Engineer to help contribute to the design, creation, and testing of our cutting-edge cyber security platform. You'll design architectures and interfaces, and write high-quality, secure code and unit tests. We want you to be passionate and enthusiastic about everything you do. Ready to make a difference?

jobs.title: Software Developer 1 - Microsoft Visual Studio .NET
jobs.company: Newport News Shipbuilding-A Division of Huntington Ingalls Industries
jobs.content:
We are looking for an entry level Microsoft Visual Studio .NET Developer (C#, ASP .NET, JavaScript) who is interested in designing and building information systems to support construction of some of the largest and most complex products in the world. We are the sole designer and builder of U.S. Navy Aircraft Carriers and one of two providers of U.S. Navy Submarines. We are an extremely diverse organization with a talented and dedicated team of programmers, engineers, architects and administrators working together to support our ever changing technical landscape.



As a Software Engineer you will build and maintain systems that process information across multiple disciplines: Materials Management, Planning and Provisioning, Human Resources, Finance, etc. You will interface with the most powerful systems in the world: SAP, Team Center, SharePoint, JDA Component Supplier Management System, Hyperion, etc. and work with the most advanced data base engines in the world: SQL Server and ORACLE. You will support engineering organizations of all disciplines (Mechanical, Metallurgical, Electrical, Radiological, Civil, etc.), craftsmen of all types (Electricians, Welders, Fitters, Fabricators, Machinists, etc.) and critical support organizations (Communications, Payroll, Clinic, Quality, Security, Supply Chain, etc.). The depth and breadth of Newport News Shipbuilding is vast and the opportunities for technical growth immense - join our team and jumpstart your career.


The Software Developer I will:



  • Research, design, develop, and/or modify enterprise-wide systems and/or applications software.

  • Be involved in planning of system and development deployment as well as responsible for meeting software compliance standards.

  • Evaluate interface between hardware and software, operational requirements, and characteristics of overall system.

  • Document testing and maintenance of system corrections.

jobs.title: Web Designer
jobs.content: U.S. News & World Report has an immediate opening for a Web Designer. This position requires an excellent eye for design, coupled with a keen ability to understand user needs, behaviors, and motiv...

jobs.title: Chief Architect
jobs.content:
Are you a guru of Test Automation? Are you 10x more productive than the typical test lead? Do you have expertise in multiple testing platform and can effectively make tradeoffs between them for a given scenario? Are you interested in earning $100K USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


What to Expect as a Test Automation Chief Architect at Crossover

Are you ready to redefine how the industry develops, executes and maintains functional tests? You will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, establishing and implementing automated testing strategies and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

jobs.title: Full Stack Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
The Digital Experience team is seeking an experienced Full Stack Ruby Developer to deliver cutting edge shopping experiences on MasterDynamic.com. This role offers an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing brand that is born in digital and rooted in technological innovation.


As the Lead Developer at Master & Dynamic, you will be responsible for back and front-end web development for all Master & Dynamic Shopify properties (.com, .co.uk, & .eu) and integration with 3rd party cloud services. You will also play a pivotal role as Master & Dynamic expands our international e-commerce presence into future markets. 


This position works closely with the management team and has an integral role in shaping Master & Dynamic's future. This role is based at our Midtown Manhattan headquarters.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Ceros platform empowers designers and marketers to create and publish beautiful, interactive content experiences without the need for developers.


Our users work collaboratively in real-time on a browser-based digital canvas to create pixel-perfect experiences with rich animations and interactivity. The experiences they publish work consistently across all browsers and devices, and all customer engagement is tracked with extensive analytics. All without writing code.


About the Product


Designing and building the Ceros platform is no easy task. We require the best-of-the-best web developers, designers, and QA testers, ready to bring the functionality of desktop software to the web, often pushing web browsers to the limits of what’s currently possible.


Our codebase is 95% JavaScript and the Ceros product is comprised of multiple single-page applications with a client-heavy focus. We use libraries like jQuery, Require, and Backbone. The Ceros Studio is architected around the HTML5 Canvas element.


We’re not language zealots. We believe in using the right tools for the job, and our current server-side infrastructure runs PHP, Node.js, Redis, MySQL, Chef, Grunt, etc. on the Amazon AWS cloud.


About the Team


As part of the Ceros product team, you’ll be working with a cross-functional group of the most talented people you’ve ever worked with. We hire only passionate and creative people with a proven and unquestionable ability to execute, and every member of the team is equally responsible for moving the product forward.


We have a dynamic company culture that collaborates daily. We care deeply about the user experience, and we debate passionately about our ideas. When you work at Ceros, you check your ego at the door, and you aren’t afraid to be honest, especially to yourself. We take our jobs seriously but ourselves not so much -- whether it’s cracking jokes in the chat room or poking fun at the CEO’s atrocious spelling.


About the Job


Working completely from home, you’ll be communicating often through chat rooms, email, and video conferencing. We offer flexible working hours and an extremely flexible vacation policy. And we provide excellent gear (15” Macbook Pro, iPad, external monitor, etc.). We’re looking for a seasoned engineer who is comfortable writing product code and has a passion for devops. You understand the pros and cons of various infrastructure technologies and are excited to scale the infrastructure of a rapidly growing startup.


As a DevOps focused developer, your typical day-to-day involves:



  • Evaluating, testing and building new infrastructure tools and technology

  • Writing maintainable code (probably goes without saying)

  • Carrying out and being on the receiving end of intense code review sessions from your peers who hold your work (and their own) to the highest of standards

  • Working closely with the rest of the team to deploy new releases and data migrations without hiccup

  • And finally, ensuring the availability of the Ceros platform


Next Steps


If you’re interested in being part of the Ceros team, please send your resume and a cover letter to us. We’re a company of passionate, honest, and sometimes silly people, so don’t be afraid to express yourself.

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
Web Application Developer (IT)
Arizona State University
Journalism & Mass Communication
Campus: Downtown Phoenix
Requisition Id# 24165BR


Salary Range:  
Depends on experience


Close Date:  
04-August-2016


Job Description:  
The Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication, a national leader in journalism education, is seeking a Technologist in Residence for Cronkite News, a multi-platform daily news organization and innovation hub based in Phoenix.

This newsroom-based position requires deep technical skills with an eye toward innovative storytelling. The successful candidate will be able to build and administer web applications and work with our award-winning student journalists to tell stories in a variety of formats. We are looking for someone with technical expertise who loves working with cross-platform teams and has the people skills to meld with our team.  This is a year-round position that includes working in Cronkite News during the spring and fall semesters and in Carnegie-Knight News21 during the summers.
 
The News21 program brings together the nation’s best journalism students each year to report and produce an investigative multimedia reporting project on a topic of national import. Cronkite News is the news division of Arizona PBS and is comprised of more than a dozen full-time, award-winning professional editors and more than 100 journalism students each semester. Students produce rich multimedia content – both daily and enterprise – under the guidance of top professionals in an immersive learning environment. The content is delivered on CronkiteNews.azpbs.org. Cronkite News also is designed to be a test bed for innovation, serving as a model for the news industry to try new forms of storytelling, audience engagement, digital interactivity, data visualization, audience analytics and revenue models.

Days and Schedule:  8:00 AM-5:00 PM, to include some nights and weekends.


Essential Duties:  
•     Build and maintain web applications related to the Cronkite News digital site, cronkitenews.azpgs.org, which is built on WordPress, as well as News21 project sites.
•    Work with student teams to develop innovative web, mobile, data and mapping applications.
•    Code innovative digital media products, such as native smartphone and web applications.
•    Develop and maintain back-end databases for digital media products.
•    Work with Cronkite IT department to configure server space to house products developed by Cronkite News.
•    Remain abreast of technology directions, initiatives and trends within scope of expertise to provide ideas, guidance and recommendations to Cronkite News and Cronkite leadership.

jobs.title: Back-end Web Developer
jobs.content:
TradeKing Group, Inc. (www.tradeking.com) consists of companies that provide online brokerage services, education and social collaboration channels for investors, and more. Its subsidiary, TradeKing Securities, LLC, is a nationally licensed online broker/dealer dedicated to empowering the independent, self- directed investor. TradeKing Advisors, Inc. is an SEC registered investment advisor. Brokerage accounts are serviced and securities offered through TradeKing Securities, LLC, member FINRA and SIPC.


Position Description


You aren't satisfied with simply knowing that things work. You want to know the how and why and its impact on security, performance, and maintainability. You are excited about the latest language features and frameworks but you have the maturity to know when to introduce them into a project. You love having the freedom to innovate and take responsibility but you value doing that in the context of a team. The more you learn the more you realize you don't know and you need others and they need you. You test everything and let the data drive your decisions. You love what you do!


Job Responsibilities


You will be an integral part of a small cross-functional Scrum team (2-4 Developers, 1-2 QA, 1 Product Owner). The team analyzes requirements, makes design recommendations, designs the architecture, develops the code, creates the documentation, develops automated tests, performs manual testing, and ultimately deploys the code. Through all of this you are considering the impact your decisions have on security, performance, and maintainability. You design and implement the best solution given the constraints, and identify technical debt to be addressed.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Content Platform for Hulu!
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The ingestion, review, management and syndication of content is core to Hulu’s business and success. The Content Platform technology team is responsible for the end-to-end technology needs to acquire content from over 500 partners and deliver the highest quality video to tens of millions of users. We’re looking for sharp, motivated individuals to help build the technology backbone of Hulu.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Content ingestion systems and APIs

  • Content publishing tools and workflows

  • Caption editing format manipulation to support every platform

  • A state-of-the-art Content Partner portal

  • Scaling our CDN distribution technologies

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Who we are


ATTN: is a news and media company focused on empowering a generation to make social impact. We do so by creating engaging experiences around original content.


As an engineering team: 



  • We have a passion for helping people

  • We are fans, consumers, and contributors to open source software

  • We believe in code quality and testing

  • We encourage creativity and exploration


The role


We are looking to bring on an experienced SRE to help us mature infrastructure and tooling here at ATTN:. As a site reliability engineer, you will be responsible for the overall reliability of our infrastructure, internal tools, and public-facing products. You will lead the design and implementation of tools for automating, managing, and monitoring our systems.
 
A Site Reliability Engineer will:



  • Work with engineers to design and implement distributed systems at scale

  • Standardize core infrastructure components with best practices in mind

  • Design a process for on-call engineers to respond to infrastructure issues

  • Help bring new ideas into production rapidly

  • Automate and improve existing systems in production

jobs.title: Software Developer - Encoding Video For Hulu
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The Video Encoding team is responsible for having the best looking video on the Internet with the least amount of bits and takes ownership for the different renditions of video- everything from mobile to TV. The team is responsible for the packaging of content, both DRM and protocol delivery formats. Delivering video to an iOS device is much different then delivering video to a XBOX One. The team is responsible for end-to-end UX for video delivery. It is a small big data problem. Our players collect information about user’s playback experience, these key metrics are aggregated near real time and use them to make decisions on how we route traffic to clients.We are looking for a talented Software Developer to help us build the most sophisticated powerful video transcoding engine in the industry. Hulu is all about high quality video content, and that begins with reliable, efficient, and high-quality transcoding.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Drive the digital video transcoding and delivery pipeline for the world’s premium online video service

  • Improve storage efficiency of a multi Petabyte distributed file system

  • Design tools to perform automated analysis of videos

  • Sweat every millisecond of latency

  • Dream of the next big thing in video streaming

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability. 


Ansira’s development focuses on development and support of various marketing solutions using Microsoft technologies as applied to a multitude of business environments. Flexibility and a positive attitude in an ever-changing environment are important attributes for this position.


Due to client growth, we are seeking a .NET Developer to join our awesome team of developers.  This position will be responsible for development, implementation and support of various proprietary applications utilized by both external and internal clients.


Selected candidate will interface with clients, account management, application development, QA and IM teams. This is an exciting position demanding a strong aptitude for application development and Software Development Life Cycles.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Build and support applications in production, pre-production environments and coordinate QA and UAT cycles

  • Managing production support, stability and maintenance

  • Identifying, troubleshooting and debugging defects

  • Design, development and deployment of UI and functional features for web applications

  • Perform database and application operations

  • Provide application support to internal and external clients

  • Identify, analyze and articulate problem areas and work with others to devise solutions focusing on stability, performance and scalability

  • Working with a fair degree of independence on concurrent implementations

  • Follow internal processes for project management, change management and defect management

jobs.title: Sr Architect -
jobs.content:
HERE is the leading global provider of maps, and location-based services. We are developing technology that will make personalized navigation, autonomous driving and augmented reality part of everyday life.


HERE is looking for a solutions architect to help design and build the next generation of the HERE Platform. Essential requirements include a proven track record of the development, deployment and the support of large scale distributed services.


Key Responsibilities



  • As part of the Architecture Team, within Platform Operations & IT (POIT) organisation you shape the future of the HERE platforms as well as Production and Corporate IT services

  • Enable product teams to develop, launch and operate high-quality services in a fast-paced environment

  • Interface with the extended architecture community within HERE to develop standard solutions to common requirements

  • Rapid prototyping of new technologies in areas all the way from datacenter infrastructure to development tooling and the business intelligence area

  • Support senior management with reliable and consise analysis of a broad spectrum of technology areas

  • Continuous alignment of the POIT offering to the needs of the internal customer-base

  • Provide architecture support and expertise to Software Engineers and Systems Engineers to ensure infrastructure and software standards and security standards are met for new and existing applications, products and Infrastructure

  • Lead programs to build solutions across many departments within HERE while ensuring the progress and stakeholder satisfaction

  • Lead cross-disciplinary teams to dig into the hardest, most impactful problems and solve them

  • Plan and carry out POC (Proofs of Concept) for POIT services


Skills Required


Excellent background in Systems and Software Architecture and Engineering, understanding of the components of infrastructure as code, public Cloud (AWS), distributed systems theory and design, and big data concepts and systems, but also feel at home in strategy discussions, budget planning, project management as well as software development. 



  • Prior experience with deep knowledge in software development/engineering and managing large-scale server cloud infrastructure

  • Big Data analysis and machine learning experience are a plus

  • Experience with systems management platforms at scale

  • Automation and CI/CD systems experience required

  • Good understanding of networking and storage technologies and concepts.

  • Solid understanding and experience with Cloud technologies and public Cloud services (particularly AWS)

  • Excellent organisational, analytical, problem-solving and presentation skills

  • Communication of technical issues to a wide and varied audience, from engineers to executives

  • Working with remote teams and across time zones globally

  • Desire and capability to continuously learn new things in all areas (technology, communication, business, culture, …)


HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Web-based Collaborative Geographic Information Systems Developer
jobs.content:
About:


The Landscape Spatial Analytics section is part of the Habitat Science Division in the Washington Dept. of Fish & Wildlife. This group has created a successful program mapping land-cover change through a mixture of machine-learning methods, automating spatial processing and innovative user-interface optimization for accuracy assessment. Current projects seek to complement their successful remote sensing approach with crowd source data and collaborative knowledge capture tools. 


You'll work in the Habitat Science division of the Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife on developing a collaborative GIS system to help the public and professionals track multiple natural resource issues in an online dataservice. The Geospatial Land Activities Dataservice will combine the data binding magic of angularjs and d3 with custom mapping tools developed through the ESRI javascript api. You'll develop a set of tools to facilitate mapping and discussion about ecosystem restoration projects, wetlands, shoreline armoring and more that will grow to help the Dept. of Fish & Wildlife, state and federal agencies, tribal nations, NGOs and the citizens of Washington track and achieve a sustainable future for the area we have come to know and love. You'll be a key player in a small team helping craft a new set of tools to bring increased transparency and effectiveness to natural resource management in one of the nations most important estuary complexes, Puget Sound.


As a member of our team you will have the opportunity to bring your creative skills to bear on solving real world problems. As an innovative team we encourage continuous learning and you'll have access to Lynda.com and time to delve into new topics as we grow and build. You can even help us get our Joel test score up to 12!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Barkly has an awesome opportunity for an exceptional engineer.  You will join an incredible team where everyone holds themselves to the highest standards of excellence, raising our caliber as a group to greater than the sum of its parts. You will collaborate, work hard, have fun, and build something game-changing while learning from your teammates.   


What you’ll do every day:



  • Design, develop, test and deploy highly scalable, complex applications

  • Define and solve logical problems for highly technical applications

jobs.content:
As a core member of the development team, you will build innovations for our flagship product, Concur Expense. With a user base of over 30 million business travelers with year-over-year growth exceeding 30%, Concur Expense is the key component of Concur’s product delivery and growth.


In the first 12 months you will be involved in:



•Creating REST based Web Services: Creating highly scalable services that leverage Concur’s internal cloud as well as other commercial cloud platforms such as AWS to build and scale.

•Transforming our product into services based architecture: Moving our product into a more modular and scalable solution.

•Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: We run small agile teams with a mission, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the product, including full-stack service development and operations. (11324)

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability.  We have a great opportunity for a PHP Developer to join our team in our Addison, TX office.  


This role will be responsible for supporting the development and maintenance of client and internal web applications. This position requires a deep understanding of PHP, extensive knowledge of web application architecture, application frameworks and LAMP environments. Analysis and problem solving skills are required along with excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment on several projects concurrently. Preference is given to candidates who can demonstrate resourcefulness in creating technical solutions leveraging production quality open-source libraries and services.


What You Will Do



  • Work as a part of an on-site development team, which will coordinate with other internal departments.

  • Maintain and introduce functionality to existing systems.

  • Collaborate with leads to develop solutions and complete projects successfully and on time.

  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Contribute to the quality of code through participation in code reviews, refactoring, and unit testing.

jobs.title: Senior Back-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Backend Engineer



Empirical is a digital product design agency headquartered in beautiful Portland, Oregon. We incorporate research & design to create great user experiences for our well-known clients – eg Jaguar Land Rover, Intel, Samsung, Dreamworks, etc.



Up to this point, our current development services have been mainly front-end, but we recently added full-stack development to our menu of offerings. We need you and your skills in back-end development to help get us there.



You will be a Sr. Engineer, working with our front-end developers on projects that require full stack development. You will interface with our client engineers, shore up our current development processes, work with internal and contract developers, help estimate projects, and generally be a technical badass.



Of course this means that you have a wide range of talents, skills and perspectives. Not only are you an amazing at back end dev but also have a great understanding of how the two-worlds of front-end & back-end interact. And let's not forget your voracious, never-ending appetite for new tech and how quickly you learn them, sometimes in a matter of days.



Here are some bullet lists for those of you that like them.



You will:



  • Work with our designers to create kickass user experiences in a wide array of industries and cutting edge technologies

  • Build solid solutions for our clients

  • Live in Portland and work out of our Portland offices



You have:



  • 5+ years of development experience (preferably in both agency AND product environments) with a track record of shipping clean code that other engineers might regard as poetry.

  • Some experience in Python

  • Some experience with Python web frameworks like Django and Flask

  • Experience working with cloud technologies

  • Understanding of modern web services and SOA

  • Knowledge of testing and continuous integration

  • Exposure to other languages and their ecosystems, especially Ruby and modern JavaScript

  • Experience communicating with clients in a manner which is honest, clear & respectful

  • Skills to organize yourself and projects so that nothing will fall through the cracks



You have experience in one or all of the following:



  • Ruby, JavaScript, C#, TypeScript, Elixir, etc

  • Apache, nginx, haproxy, node, etc

  • Celery, Beanstalk, SQS, etc

  • MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, memcache, etc

  • Heroku, Google App Engine, AWS, Docker, etc

  • Jenkins, Capistrano, Ansible, etc

  • Basecamp, Lighthouse, JIRA, Trac, Redmine, etc

  • Extreme Programming, Kanban, Scrum, etc

  • Command, Decorator, Actor, Template, Promise, Facade, etc




We offer:




  • The opportunity to work with a variety of clients and tech on interesting projects – eg, IoT, IVI systems, big data, etc. many projects will be cutting edge and secretive (seriously secretive! though not quite FBI-level, but you will be under NDA)

  • A very supportive environment with people who aren't afraid to tell you that you're awesome (well, because you are awesome.)

  • A flat hierarchy without micro-management. we want to get out of your way so you and others can operate at your best

  • A team of smart, talented people who work together to get stuff done. if we had egos, we would check them at the door

  • No cubicles, nor time cards, nor set hours – seriously, ...none ...never ...ever. just flexibility when you need it because Life Happens

  • A beautiful, hip office with views

  • A stocked refrigerator with snacks and drinks, and Friday happy hour

  • A freakin' fast Mac laptop and a big ol' monitor



When responding, be sure to include your github account (or similar) so we can see all of the cool projects to which you've been contributing. Also include a link to one of your favorite pages from xkcd.com or theoatmeal.com (we won't judge).


Thank you!

jobs.title: WEB DEVELOPER & SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR
jobs.content: Under direction, manage web servers and develop web applications to support the operational requirements of the Student Health and Counseling Services and Student Disability Center administrative and clinical staff. Perform systems administration functions in a complex Microsoft Active Directory domain-based network with a mix of Windows and Macintosh client computers. Provide second-tier computer, application, clinical device, and network technical support services via telephone, email, and in person.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Cambridge, MA
jobs.content:
Hopper is a travel startup based in Cambridge, MA and Montreal, QC.

We combine insightful research on massive data sets with intuitive design to help travellers make informed decisions about air travel.

We launched the Hopper app (iOS) at the end of January 2015. Since then, the app has been featured in outlets such as Mashable, TIME, Travel + Leisure, and Buzzfeed. In February, Apple featured Hopper in the App Store ("best new apps").

As a Software Engineer you'll work directly with Product Designers, other Developers and the CTO. You'll be part of a small team with big ambitions: delivering a delightful and powerful product that empowers travellers. We are a versatile full-stack development team. Were always looking for smart, adaptable engineers to help us build great things throughout our stack, which includes:

  • Mobile application development for iOS (Objective-C and Swift) and Android (Java).
  • Middle tier APIs, processing pipelines (Kafka, Storm, Spark) & web services (Finagle) in Scala.
  • Analytics on big data sets (trillions of rows) using Spark (Scala and Python), Hive and Hadoop.
  • Internal web applications using Play (Scala) and Javascript (AngularJS).
  • Development Operations (DevOps) for all of the above, using Mesos, Marathon and Ansible.

What youll do:

  • Write beautiful code: well designed, testable, efficient and maintainable.
  • Learn new languages, technologies and frameworks from one project to the next.
  • Work on a problem from design through to deployment and operations.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company to solve tough technical and product problems.

***Please note: We are hiring for this position in both Montreal and Cambridge, this application is specifically for the Cambridge-based position. If you are applying for the position in Montreal, please click 'All Jobs' at the top of this page and select the Montreal opening.


Benefits


Compensation will be competitive including equity in an early stage startup backed by top-tier VCs (Atlas Venture, Brightspark and OMERS Ventures).

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Web App UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
You will be a key role in helping us build beautiful usable software that runs fast and gets out of the customer's way.  You'll be responsible for the design and aesthetic of every piece of our software.  We are currently the easiest system in the market to use and need to maintain that offering. In addition to the UI/UX we need someone to build and maintain our style sheets.


Here are some recent projects our development team has finished up:


Recent Projects



  • Marketing module with a powerful email designer that enables golf courses to build effective marketing campaigns. This module is used by hundreds of golf courses to send millions of emails per month.

  • Custom reporting system that allows users to build reports with any combination of filters and sorting to get the data they need.

  • Food and beverage module that allows our customers to design their own custom restaurant table layout and complete sales with lightning speed.


What You'll Do



  • In your first week you'll mock up a ui/ux for an existing module

  • In your first month after user testing you'll ship a new design for a module

  • In your first 6 months you'll have prepared a business theme, structured the css, and much more.

jobs.title: Digital Designer
jobs.company: University of California Office of the President

jobs.title: Sheriff
jobs.content:
Our engineers build systems that catch bad guys.  Using all available payment, user, and machine data, we have to separate legitimate credit card transactions from fraudulent in under 400ms.  That means doing just-in-time mash-ups of internal data with external APIs and reducing it all into a single score with a few critical insights for end-users.


To solve this problem, we're looking for world-class engineers who are eager to learn, adopt, and contribute to a reactive style of programming.  The position is for a backend engineer and will involve architecting and building scalable, event-driven fraud detection systems.


Signifyd is a VC-backed startup (yet has a real business model :-) ).  We most recently raised $20 million in Series B funding in February 2016 from Menlo Ventures, Allegis Capital, IA Ventures, and QED Investors.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Description


The mission of BitTorrent is to build technologies and platforms that democratize creativity and empower the world’s creative communities. We are a team of passionate individuals who are building the definitive ecosystem for brave, original, and emerging media.


Do you like building and shipping code in a fast-paced environment? Do you geek out over APIS, CSS frameworks and the latest Javascript specification updates? Do you want to build something reaches millions of people around the globe?


BitTorrent is looking for an experienced Senior Web Developer to join us in our San Francisco office. As our Senior Web Developer, you will be responsible for building responsive and elegant websites that reach millions of people every day.


What you will do:



  • Work closely with team members (visual designers, operations, PMM) to deliver responsive, beautiful and engaging web experiences.

  • Provide ideas, input and expertise on all things web

  • Build brand new websites using best practices

  • Maintain and debug existing websites (php)

  • Be a subject matter expert and provide assistance and direction for Jr Web Developers

jobs.title: Software Engineer (m/f)
jobs.content:
Giant Swarm is providing a programmable and fully managed container platform to allow developers to easily deploy, run and scale their containerized microservices.

We are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f)

Your Job:

  • You will be responsible for architecting and building distributed systems
  • You will use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools
  • You take part for testing, metrics, continuous integration

Requirements:

  • You have experience with more than one language and a strong architectural background. One of these languages is Go.
  • You love to automate things and you are used to deploy in production multiple times a day
  • You are a profound Linux user
  • You have worked with docker, experiences with kubernetes, prometheus are a bonus point
  • You prefer to build your applicatinons as multiple services instead of a monolith
  • You know the concepts of CAP theorem, paxos/raft concensus, distributed databases and message passing

WHY US?

We like to give you a glimpse on how working with is like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybodys input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.
