jobs.title: Solutions Architect Manager
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




This Solutions Architect Manager role requires a strong background in solutions architecture as well as several years of team management experience. thePlatform's media publishing system SDK and custom solutions are extensive and require in-depth technical understanding to apply them effectively. Solutions Architects do not contribute code to the project codebase, but being able to prototype new functionality is important. In this role you will be an individual contributor in a custom-facing engagement as part of our Consulting Services organization. You will also manage a team of solutions architects involved in independent engagements.







Responsibilities






  • Serve as primary technical contact with the client.

  • Gather product requirements, evaluate, and when necessary prototype, alternatives to determine the most appropriate approach for each solution.

  • Determine how to satisfy these requirements using thePlatform's SDK and services.

  • Where appropriate, define new services to fulfill a project's particular needs.

  • Prepare functional specifications that can be understood by customers and internal development teams.

  • Work with the professional services team members to estimate the work for a given project.

  • At times work directly with the sales force to coordinate new projects, many of which will involve multiple phases.

  • Transition finished projects to the support group.

  • Represent thePlatform in discussions with client's engineering, marketing, business development, and other high-level departments.

  • Drive execution of products from inception to release.

  • Manage a team of solutions architects.

  • Be a hiring manager for future growth of the team





Requirements






  • At least 5 years solutions architecture experience including experience defining and developing against SDKs.

  • Prior team management experience.

  • Proven experience with SOA, design patterns, web services technologies, and UI design.

  • Proven experience as a technical leader. Demonstrated ability to lead the design and development of complex applications.

  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of projects from inception to rollout and maintenance.

  • Understanding of and experience with the full software development lifecycle (SDLC), including functional and technical specification, implementation, QA processes, deployment, and maintenance.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability and confidence to work closely with a customer in pre-sales and collaborative scenarios.

  • At least 2 years software experience at an engineering level.

  • A Bachelor Degree in computer science or a related field is required.

  • Knowledge of rich media and content management a plus.





About thePlatform



thePlatform is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.





We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated to provide our customers with the best online video publishing and management solutions in the industry.





We are a team of incredibly bright and driven people, who also believe in having fun. We enjoy a dynamic and flexible work environment, and hope you will consider joining us.





This position will be filled at thePlatform's headquarters in Seattle, WA. Our stylish downtown location is easily accessible by bus, train, car, and bicycle (we have racks and showers!). A subsidiary of Comcast, thePlatform offers competitive compensation and spectacular benefits typically seen only at very large organizations.





Check us out on Facebook and learn more about us! http://www.facebook.com/theplatform.people






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Engineering Ops
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

Responsible for operating, deploying, managing, and continuously improving Comcast's Voice, Video, Commercial, Data, Home Security,

Systems, and Network services as well as associated infrastructure in a 7/24 environment. Examples of infrastructure include, but are not

limited to: routers, CMTS, switches, optical and TDM transport, applications, servers, IP scopes, databases, etc. Position focuses on

deploying and stabilizing code, technologies, services, networks, systems, tools and driving standardization, automation, and service

focused instrumentation. Provides subject matter expertise, resolves complex break/fix scenarios, engaging broader teams as necessary;

partners with/leads engineering, vendors, and regions to achieve continuous improvement. Serves as high-tier operations support for

various field, CARE, vendors, and customer-focused organizations. Contributes to command and control-related activities focused on

restoration of complex outages, communication across Comcast, and rapid restoration. Works and directly leads external vendors, third parties,

and associated agencies, when necessary, to address issues across the PSTN, peering arrangements, inter-operability issues, etc. Works with

limited supervision and direction while executing associated functions and responsibilities. Follows operational practices and independently

determines/develops approaches for non-routine solutions. Receives general direction in areas of focus. Serves as team lead on projects.



Core Responsibilities:

- Administers and deploys configuration changes in a Weblogic, Unix, Linux environments. Develops and implements fail over procedures to mitigate impacts resulting from failures in the application or infrastructure.

- Performs a variety of complex analytical duties in the planning, deployment, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network, products, and

services including CRAN, CMTS, and the IP platform, Voice, Data, Commercial, Systems, and Video platform. Works closely with engineering,

vendors, and field to identify and drive improvements across the topology.

- Directs third party agencies (i.e. AT&T, Verizon) and internal resources while troubleshooting and resolving complex peer-to-peer

troubles focusing on rapid restoration. Devises and implements strategies for solving technical issues directly impacting internal and

external customers or increasing performance across broad eco-systems.



- Develops, produces, and reviews of documentation, instructional, and procedural manuals for other employees to utilize to resolve problems or

make network improvements. Examples include: complex processes for acceptance of new products (i.e. cable modems, systems,) testing such as operational readiness, tools focused on automation (i.e. IP scope tool,) etc.

- Supports all of the XNOC tools and alarms; analyzes systems needs and determines prioritization of break/fix scenarios; implements code

changes and suggests improvements. Ensures the availability of networking services; studies, evaluates, analyzes, and monitors the

network and services to determine problem areas and/or areas of concern. Monitors, isolates, triages, and resolves outages and impairments.

Identifies and implements opportunities for improvement.

- Ensures databases, applications, hardware, and other related resources are properly maintained. Provides subject matter expertise on equipment and services to other operational groups. Updates code and software to ensure proper system performance.

- Provides clear, crisp, and concise technical communication and coordination during medium outage scenarios.

- Directly executes changes, in the network and across systems, focused on deploying new services, implementing changes, and stabilizing

products following established change management processes. Accountable for configuration management techniques, ensuring infrastructure is

correctly aligned and fully compliant with standards.

- Accountable for understanding and managing services across complex ecosystems, cutting across multiple technologies, organizations, and

solutions. Requires detailed understanding of interdependencies/intradependences. Accountable for providing technical

assessment of changes across ecosystems to ensure resolving potential conflicts before impacting intra-/inter- related vertical systems.

Develops and reports on metrics which show system uptime and overall service desk compliance to ITIL standards.

- Possesses in-depth knowledge and breadth across two to three major ecosystems/technologies requiring technical competency, advanced

training, and outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Leverages engineering methodologies is specific areas of focus.

Possesses in-depth working knowledge and application of process design, client server technology, and internal processes. Provides training and

coaching to NSAR, CARE, sub-set of field organizations, peers, and more junior engineering operations staff.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience



- 3+ years of in-depth troubleshooting experience of complex large scale enterprise application server environment(s); experience in an ISP like environment involving 24x7x365 support is HIGHLY desirable.



- Well developed oral and written communications skills and customer-centric attitude with the ability to communicate in both a technical and non-technical manner.



- Experience in some formal ticketing system and a demonstrated ability to work in a metrics based service desk that tracks work through metrics



- In-depth knowledge of OSI layers 1-7 and an ability to troubleshoot and categorize issues accordingly and then engage the appropriate fix agents if they are not able to affect a fix.



- Must have an understanding of the various components of a large scale enterprise system such as: IP routing, TCP traffic analysis, application flows, switches, web servers, web services, DHCP, DNS, SQL/RDB backend systems, IP Management, LDAP, HTTP/XML



- Unix/Linux or Windows experience, that includes the basic commands required to effectively troubleshoot, move files, write basic scripts, and quickly differentiate an OS system issue from an application server issue.



- Hands on knowledge and working experience with any enterprise system and application level monitoring solutions. Examples include Netcool, Concord, Wily, Nagios, SevOne, Spectrum, and Network Node Manger.



- Desirable: prior knowledge of major MSO (Multi-Service Operator / cable provider) supporting provisioning systems for video, high speed data services, and/or telephony a plus



- Desirable: Hands-on experience in any of the following technologies:



- IP Networking protocols and systems including DHCP, DNS, TFTP, ToD, ARP, IP, TCP, UDP, SNMP



- DOCSIS Cable modem technology



- IP subnet management



- CORBA, JAVA, XML



- LDAP Directory Servers



- Sun/Solaris hardware/software platform



- TCP/IP and its various protocols



- Cisco Hardware and IOS (routers, switches, CMTS)



- Strong understanding of UNIX heavily weighted towards Solaris and LINUX



- Ability to troubleshoot and work with other operating systems including Windows



- Strong analytical and problem solving skills



- Outstanding interpersonal, oral, listening and written communication skills



- Ability to independently execute the tasks assigned within the scope of this position.



- Ability to contribute as a team member and work in concert with others to deliver a high level of support to the Service Desk's customers both internal and external



- Solaris/LINUX/UNIX Certification preferred



- Weblogic Certification is a strong plus



- Programming skills in Perl, Java, C, C++, JavaScript, all UNIX Shell Scripting plus skills with web based embedding (HTML, PHP, etc.) desirable.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Principal Engineer, VIPER Player Platform
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





As a Principal JavaScript engineer of the Player Platform you will write client side libraries that are used by millions of people to stream Live, On-Demand, and Recorded content on their desktop computers and set-top-boxes.



Our code powers the video playback experience on the Xfinity TVGo, Xfinity TV, and Xfinity OnCampus applications as well as all IP Capable Set Top Boxes. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and real-time analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



Player Platform team is a diverse technical group of engineers that bridges all internal groups within VIPER. You will be interacting with teams that use our product to build consumer facing applications, internal testing platforms, and research and development projects.



Your customers will be software engineers, dev-ops engineers, and quality assurance engineers that are Comcast employees and partners. You will have the chance to experience and interact with many platforms and software languages if you desire as we expand our platform



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.



You’ll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Skills & Requirements




  • B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

  • 8+ years experience

  • Expert-level knowledge of the JavaScript language.

  • Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

  • Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

  • Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

  • Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

  • Familiar with a scripting language

  • Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

  • Experience with version control tools such as git.

  • Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

  • Experience with multi-threading programing

  • Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

  • Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.



About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast’s Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that’s been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in and out of the home. Check us out at: http://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/comcast-viper

jobs.title: Product Support Engineer
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






Our Continuous Delivery team's mission is to empower engineering teams to build, test, deploy and operate their own products. We will achieve this by leading the adoption of Continuous Delivery and Dev/Ops philosophies, by modernizing the company's product architectures to be cloud compatible and by implementing a Platform as a Service that our engineering teams can consume. We are leveraging both established and emerging technologies, such as Zookeeper, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes and TeamCity.





This role is focused around supporting customers, who are primarily fellow engineering employees, and operating the team's products. Day to day work will include troubleshooting, configuration management, automation, consulting on integration solutions and representing the customer's needs during design reviews. New and interesting challenges will present themselves almost daily. There is a heavy social aspect to this role, and in time you will come to be known by many as one of those people who knows how to do everything. There is huge upside for someone looking to advance a career in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering Site Reliability Engineering or Technical Support. We value cultural fit, intelligence, self-motivation, empathy and passion for learning as much or more than matching experience. If this sounds like a role you would enjoy, but you're concerned about specific details below, please apply anyway. You might be the perfect person for us.





Responsibilities:




  • Provide front-line support to internal users of the team's products through several channels: chat, JIRA, email and in-person help requests.

  • Troubleshoot and repair issues with the team's products with minimal guidance.

  • Perform regular and emergency maintenance activities.

  • Escalate software defects and the most difficult issues to the rest of the team. Advocate for the customer's interests in getting these issues solved.

  • Consult with users on the design and implementation of Continuous Integration pipelines, custom deployment workflows and complex monitoring problems.

  • Collect and analyze data for root cause analysis and business intelligence.

  • Champion Dev/Ops and Lean philosophies encourage empathy across functional roles, automate repeatable tasks and eliminate waste.

  • Take ownership for high quality, successful completion of projects.





Requirements:




  • A structured and detail-oriented approach to problem solving and troubleshooting.

  • A positive and collaborative attitude. A willingness to take calculated risks and learn from mistakes.

  • Strong foundation in Shell, Ruby, Python or a similar scripting language.

  • Some experience with Object Oriented programming in Java or C# a plus.

  • Proficient with Linux OS and command line operations.

  • Understanding of distributed web service architectures.





Extra Credit for:




  • Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS or Graphite.

  • Experience in UI design or implementation.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to join our growing Hadoop team. As a Big Data Engineer, you will be designing and coding reliable ETL pipelines and building scalable, low latency, near real-time applications using Spark, Scala, Python, and Hive. Collaborating with other Development, QA, and Product Management teams in an agile environment will be part of the job.





Responsibilities



- Design and build data processing pipelines for structured and unstructured data using tools and frameworks in the Hadoop ecosystem

- Architect and develop applications that scale up to a Billion events per day

- Build streaming and real-time data analytic pipelines

- Implement and configure big data technologies as well as tune processes for performance at scale





Minimum qualifications

- Solid software engineer with excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills

- 1+ years of experience building production large scale big data applications

- Proficiency in a programming language, ideally Scala, Python, or Java

- Experience with big data interactive query technologies like Spark, Hive, or Impala

- Excellent communication skills

- Eager to learn





Preferred qualifications

- Experience with Spark and/or Kafka

- Experience with Scala

- Experience tuning Hadoop jobs for better performance

- Experience working in an Agile Environment






Comcast is an Affirmative Action/EEO employer M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Manager, Product Development Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary



Responsible for leading a team of Engineers in theplanning and designing of software and analytical systems. Managesprojects from design to testing, including new programs, enhancements,and modifications. Collaborates with Quality Assurance team to conducttesting. Develops financial and operational objectives. Ensuresoperational plans are aligned with business objectives. Contributes tofunctional strategy development. Has a greater degree of impact onbusiness results, and typically manages one or more groups ofprofessional employees.





Core Responsibilities



- Oversees the planning and designing of analytical and software applications and processes, including new programs, enhancements, and modifications.



- Provides guidance to the Engineering Analysis team and other departments inidentifying analytical and technical requirements. Serves as primary point of contact andliaison between Engineering Analysis and other teams.



- Directs implementation initiatives for new analytical products and applications.Organizes software update process for existing applications and coordinates theroll-out of software releases.



- Manages all the deliverables to ensure adherence to deadlines, specifications, andbudgets. Implements performance metrics and prepares period reports and/orproposals. Monitors and tracks project progress and reports findings to leadershipteam.



- Ensures all engineers keep current with technological developments within theindustry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products.



- Provides leadership and direction to department personnel from lower-levelmanagers to non-exempt employees.



- Manages cross-project communications.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters ofsignificance.



- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights andweekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.



- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Education Level



- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent; Advanced Degree Preferred



Field of Study



- Engineering, Computer Science, or Similar Analytical or Technical Field of Study

- Generally requires 8-11 years related experience

jobs.title: Lead Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
As one of the most iconic brands in sanitary ware, American Standard has earned the trust of its customers by constantly delivering style, quality and reliability to their bathrooms. Today, backed by more than 140 years of pioneering legacy, American Standard continues to raise the bar in delivering dependable bathroom solutions that combine thoughtful designs and innovative technologies to create inviting bathroom sanctuaries offering ultimate comfort and performance to its customers.

American Standard operates under the business unit of LIXIL Water Technology, the world’s largest and most global leader in sanitary ware market with sales of about USD 6 billion, some 30,000 employees, sales offices across 150 markets and around 50 production facilities worldwide. LIXIL Water Technology Group globally combines the expertise and offerings of LIXIL Group’s worldwide sanitaryware business with the purpose of providing water technology solutions to improve people’s lives around the world, every day. The existing brands are GROHE, American Standard Brands and LIXIL/INAX.
Learn more about us at www.lixil.co.th/americanstandard/about-lixil.

As part of our expansion, we are looking for an extremely talented and passionate individual to be part of our growth in a true global organization:

LEAD INDUSTRIAL DESIGNER
(Based in Bangkok, Thailand)           

The Lead Industrial Designer will be responsible for the creation of innovative bathroom concepts, products, experiences, services and human interfaces through the mastery of the design process within the New Product Development community.  
The position is located at the new American Standard Asia Pacific Design Studio in Bangkok.  

YOU WILL:
· Create and develop innovative, thoughtful and culturally sensitive design solutions on both roadmap and advanced concept projects.
· Research into design, social and technological trends as well as consumer segments, and market competitors to inspire the organization and guide your design directions.
· Create outstanding presentation deliverables that may include research summaries, sketches, user scenarios, high-quality renderings, and appearance models
· Build CAD models of intended design directions for the creation of prototypes or to communicate design intent to engineering teams.
· Collaborate and lead fellow designers, engineers, and manufacturing partners to identify opportunities, solve design issues, and preserve design intent throughout the projects
· Provide support in the development of internal skills and tools to help the team stay at the forefront of the design field.
· Develop and mentor junior staff.  

YOU HAVE:
· A Bachelor’s degree in Product Design    
· Minimum 10 years experience designing consumer products in a multidisciplinary team from concepts all the way to tooling and production
· Prior years of living and working in Asia is a must.
· A strong portfolio of cutting edge designs that proves not only solid design skills but forward thinking
· Excellent skills in ideation, concept visualization, form development, CAD, model making and rapid prototyping
· The ability to rapidly explore a wide variety of styling options: forms, colors, finishes, materials
· Flexible and adaptable in approach, focused on finding a workable solution to every problem
· An extensive knowledge of materials, manufacturing and engineering processes
· Strong sketching skills, both hand-drawn and digital (Wacom Tablet experience required)
· Digital proficiency in the use of 2D and 3D tools such as the Adobe Creative Suite, SolidWorks, ProE, Rhinoceros and Keyshot.
· A passion for design, technology, and an active lifestyle
· A team-oriented, positive and constructive attitude
· A strong ability to speak and write in English  

HOW TO APPLY:
Please send an email with your CV along with a portfolio with samples of your work (including sketches)
in English language as a pdf-file (file size should not exceed 8 MB) to:

Nanthanut Tangsthien
nanthanut.tangsthien@lixil.com

This is the developer job you wish you had!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Technology at Avaaz is scaling fast, and we need a DevOps Engineer whose skills connect the worlds of Software Engineers, DBAs, and Systems Administrators. This role will support maintaining and expanding Avaazs infrastructure to improve the way our software is developed.

The ideal candidates will have experience in system administration, developing software using modern languages and frameworks and as well a good understanding of SQL and non-SQL data stores. They will be able to advise on decisions regarding hardware performance for a given software, and will also know when we should modify the underlying infrastructure or fix a particular piece of code. They are familiar with test automation and applications that work at scale.

The DevOps Engineer does not need to be an expert in all areas, but rather have a broad range of experiences in different areas with excellent team and communication skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage our deployment and testing infrastructure, supporting the implementation of Continuous Integration.
  • Refine development processes to make interactions between Software Engineers and Administrators constant, fluid, and productive.
  • Participate in architectural decision-making in support of scalability.
  • Automate repetitive tasks required to maintain a secure and up to date operational environment, eventually supporting the Engineering team with hands-on coding.
  • Develop, improve, maintain, and document infrastructure management systems.
  • Work with other teams to build, test and roll out systems.

Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of experience as a Software Engineer, and 2-3 years of experience as a Systems Administrator.
  • 1-2 years of experience working at large-scale applications.
  • 2-3 years working in Amazon AWS environments, particularly VPCs with an understanding of the AWS API.
  • Intimate knowledge of Linux (Redhat/CentOS) and at least 2 years experience managing Linux in enterprise-class environments (more than 10 servers).
  • Experience with infrastructure as code (Puppet/Chef/others).
  • Experience managing application build pipelines and continuous integration environments.
  • Strong fundamentals in Python/Ruby and strong bash scripting skills.
  • Comfortable working with a range of storage engines (MySQL, Elasticsearch, Redis) and knowing when each type is appropriate.
  • Understanding of network and application security with deep understanding of all layers involved in web communications, including experience in network debugging.
  • Must be a strong culture match including having a growth mindset and a deep commitment to world change and the Avaaz mission.
  • Experience at large-scale web companies is a huge plus.
  • Fluency in English is a requirement.

Location

Avaaz is a virtual organisation, with most of our work done over email, telephone and Skype. Our staff are based in cities all over the world and meet at team retreats twice per year. Avaaz covers office costs, either to establish a home office or to rent one, and we support staff to house themselves in local similar organisations when preferred.

Compensation and Benefits

Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive with leading nongovernmental organisations. Benefits also range with location, but include 5 weeks paid vacation per year.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
A Color Story is young mobile app company primarily developing photo editing apps. The flagship product, A Color Story is an editing app used by hundreds of thousands of people across the world as a bright, colorful alternative to an otherwise faded industry. As a company, we are a small, tight-knit family where everyones ideas are heard and matter. Were looking for someone excited by a fast pace and problem solving to grow with our little company.

What youll do

  • Oversee our hosting structures for both our mobile backend and web presence
  • Build and maintain a web-based image processing application
  • Support our Android application for smaller updates and implementations, as needed
  • Consistently look for improvements and further optimizations
  • Test, test, test, ship, repeat

What we need from you

  • 3+ years building complex, scalable mobile or web applications
  • Extensive understanding of object orientation and design patterns
  • Establishing and managing dedicated servers as well as scalable options like AWS
  • Must be very familiar with Java and have a working knowledge of PHP and databases (C++ would be great too)
  • Self-starting personality that thrives in a minimal management environments

What we prefer from you

  • BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science
  • Science Android development experience a huge plusiOS would be nice too
  • Understanding of image processing
  • Interest in photography and a mobile photo editing app user
  • Startup experience

What we offer

Competitive salary, full benefits package including health and dental, 401k, flexible PTO

jobs.title: Senior UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Here at GigSalad, were building an easier way for people to hire talent and services for events. From musicians to magicians, we match customers with entertainment professionals for all of lifes events.

As Senior UI/UX Designer at GigSalad, youll be responsible for designing a two-sided marketplace that has serviced over a million users. Were looking for a seasoned pro a designer who is comfortable creating beautiful, functional experiences and excited to instill their design philosophy in the company as a whole. As an instrumental part of the company, youll work closely with engineering and product management to take your vision from idea to execution. Your insights will not only influence the look of the site, but will also extend to branding and marketing initiatives across the company.

We're looking for either a full-time employee or an outstanding freelancer who is excited to improve our marketplace. Were a private and profitable company. We like tackling rewarding problems, taking time to solve things the right way, and focusing on a single product. Reach out to us and learn more about your role in improving GigSalad.

As Senior UI/UX Designer at GigSalad, you will

  • Lead the UI/UX design and impact millions of people
  • Develop and maintain mockups and specifications as needed
  • Craft our visual identity
  • Participate in ongoing discussion with product, engineering and other team partners to bring beauty and simplicity to complex issues

A little more about GigSalad

We are GigSalad, an online entertainment booking company serving all of the United States and Canada. Founded in 2007, our company has two offices: one is in Wilmington, NC and the other is in Springfield, MO. GigSalad is no longer a budding start-up but feels a lot like one (one exception: were profitable!). We move fast, work hard, and have fun. We are passionate about what we do: providing a safe, easy platform for event hosts to hire talent and services for events.

REQUIREMENTS

The ideal UI/UX Designer were looking for has

  • 4+ years of experience designing for the web
  • A solid portfolio of web-based projects
  • Experience with e-commerce or marketplace sites
  • A strong understanding of both design theory and practical tools
  • The creativity to design clean, usable solutions to common web patterns (search results, messaging, forms)
  • A permanent home in the U.S. or Canada
  • A desire to help us create the worlds best (and most beautiful) booking platform

BENEFITS

What we offer to you

  • A competitive salary
  • A matching 401k
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • $1,500 in an education expense account (books, conferences, programs, etc.)
  • A fitness reimbursement program
  • A startup atmosphere with the stability of an established, profitable company
  • A remote job structure that respects your work/life balance

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented and motivated engineers to join our team here at RideCell who can hit the ground running and take our product to the next level, as we scale up and develop our business in our target markets. The Fullstack Engineers who are building our Core Platform work across the stack, always willing to go the extra mile to deliver the highest quality in enterprise software. As a developer for RideCell you are building the tools today that will redefine tomorrow's transit.

The Role

  • Take ownership over project timelines and deliverables
  • Contribute to the design, architecture and build of our Core Platform
  • Help scale the platform and build out new features
  • Contribute to the DevOps process and tool building
  • Contribute to the frontend if and when needed, developing new skills as needed
  • Apply algorithm development to solve deep problems
  • Work with customers when needed

Requirements

  • Fluency in Python & Django or confident that you can get there quickly, and 5+ years experience in another programming language
  • Front end experience with javascript frameworks like Backbone.js or React.js
  • You always leave code better than you found it, and you have opinions on software design.
  • Self-directed, but also work well with other engineers.
  • Excited about working for a startup and moving quickly.
  • 5+ years of experience (internships included)
  • Experience working remotely in the past
  • Must live in the United States

Preferred

  • Experience with RESTful APIs and API design.
  • DevOps experience, especially with AWS, Vagrant, Ansible, and Postgres.

About RideCell

RideCell is the leading provider of software to power mobility-as-a-service (MaaS), including car-sharing, ride sharing, fixed-route, and dynamic transit services. The Global Call for Transit Innovators award winner is helping customers reimagine and re-architect transportation in cities, communities and campuses around the world.

RideCell's unique differentiator is autonomous fleet operationsTM: technology that automates end-to-end business operations from consumer apps to the day to day fleet management, demand and supply analytics, marketing, CRM, and payments. Its mobility software platform automates some of the hardest operational tasks in running a transportation system enabling cities, campuses and multi-city mobility providers to launch on-demand, car sharing and fixed-route services in weeks and optimize and scale them without human intervention. In addition to mobility providers such as BMW, RideCell's clients include transit agencies such as Santa Clara VTA in Silicon Valley, companies such as 3M, universities such as UC Berkeley, hospitals such as UCSF.

RideCell is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Key investors include BMW iVentures, Khosla Ventures and YCombinator. RideCell's vision is to help their customers Run the world, better TM.

jobs.title: Back-End WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a remote back-end developer with at least one year advanced WordPress development experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is actively working in the website and plugin development field and is knowledgeable about the most recent releases and standards of WordPress. Applicants should be passionate about WordPress and eager to learn and grow with our company.

Please note: This is not an entry-level position. Experienced programmers only.

Your job duties will include:

  • Developing WordPress plugins, custom functionality, and themes
  • Developing and maintaining complex WordPress-based applications
  • Supporting clients in a fast paced environment
  • Using bug tracking, project tracking, and SVN +/or Git software
  • A variety of miscellaneous development tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish
  • Heavy lifting data, migrations, etc.

Requirements:

  • Excellent knowledge of WordPress, PHP, MySQL, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, and jQuery
  • Good understanding of accessibility considerations and web standards
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Ability to work remotely with little to no supervision is a must
  • Available during the day, Eastern time, Monday through Friday
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to be a team player and grow as business grows
  • Experience using SVN & Git software a plus

Types of projects were doing lately:

  • WordPress websites, mainly (some with and some without a blog) for small and large businesses, multisite networks, social communities and lots of social media integration.
  • WordPress with E-Commerce (WooCommerce experience is a plus)
  • WordPress Multisite and BuddyPress
  • Membership sites with WordPress

(Do you get a feeling that we do a LOT of WordPress sites??? We do!)

Work Environment:

  • Remote work Monday through Friday 9am 5pm EST
  • Office dress code: Pajamas, if you like.
  • This is a full-time, salaried position
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities
  • Lots and lots of informal gif sharing

Were looking for someone who:

  • Thinks design is about solving problems, not making them.
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Likes to have a lot of fun tinkering around inside the guts of cool websites.
  • Gets more kicks out of removing elements from a page than adding them.
  • Wants to learn, push themselves, and make the web a better place to be.
  • Excellent time management and ability to work, remotely, on a deadline and on multiple projects at once.
  • Great critical thinking skills, a good work ethic, and customer service skills.

No third parties or outsourcing agencies will be considered, but we are open to worldwide applicants!

We give each application consideration, but please do be patient as we go through all of the applications received. We will read them all and will be contacting you within the next week or two.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a front-end developer/designer with at least one year WordPress theme design experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about front-end code like JavaScript, HTML, CSS and the WordPress loop.

Our projects will challenge you and if youre up for it, then were up for talking with you!

Heres the down and dirty

Your job duties will include:

  • Working with clients to create website design mockups based on their ideas, samples, likes/dislikes, etc
  • Converting PSD website mockups to functional themes in WordPress
  • Troubleshooting design issues with CSS, website layouts, graphics, etc, including cross-browser compatibility and responsive design
  • Various design tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish

Minimum Requirements:

  • Documented experience in front-end website development in WordPress.
  • Ability to convert Photoshop files (PSD) to WordPress themes using HTML/CSS/JS, etc
  • Experience with WordPress is required (Example: building a theme from scratch is no sweat, and customizing existing frameworks is right up your alley!).
  • Advanced level competency with CSS & HTML (Sass, HTML5/CSS3 a big plus, as well as responsive design techniques).
  • Experience troubleshooting browser compatibilities.

Nice to haves (not required, but would be considered a plus):

  • Understanding of PHP development practices
  • Comfort level with JavaScript, jQuery and/or AJAX
  • Ability to perform some back-end development tasks (ie: building simple widgets & plugins)
  • Experience with creating Photoshop mockups and graphic design

Types of projects were doing lately:

  • WordPress websites, mainly (some with and some without a blog) for small and large businesses, multisite networks, social communities and lots of social media integration.
  • WordPress with E-Commerce (WooCommerce experience is a plus)
  • WordPress Multisite and BuddyPress
  • Membership sites with WordPress

(Do you get a feeling that we do a LOT of WordPress sites??? We do!)

Work Environment:

  • Remote work Monday through Friday 9am 5pm EST
  • Office dress code: Pajamas, if you like.
  • This is full-time, salaried position
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities
  • Lots and lots of informal gif sharing

Were looking for someone who:

  • Thinks design is about solving problems, not making them.
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Likes to have a lot of fun tinkering around inside the guts of cool websites.
  • Gets more kicks out of removing elements from a page than adding them.
  • Wants to learn, push themselves, and make the web a better place to be.
  • Excellent time management and ability to work, remotely, on a deadline and on multiple projects at once.
  • Great critical thinking skills, a good work ethic and customer service skills.

No third parties or outsourcing agencies will be considered, but we are open to worldwide applicants!

We give each application consideration, but please do be patient as we go through all of the applications received. We will read them all and will be contacting eligible applicants within the next week or two.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
The QA team is looking for an SDET that has a passion for testing complex applications and systems at scale.  You have demonstrated expertise in assessing quality with respect to service contracts, performance, reliability in addition to the standard competencies around software design, testing, and automation.







Responsibilities:


  • Design and build automation systems that reliably validate product code

  • Participate in code and design reviews

  • Advocate for the testability of product code

  • Suggest quality measures to be implemented

  • Write and implement test plans

  • Help development team diagnose and test fixes

  • Aiding issue fixing by recreating issues for Production team review

  • Recommend and utilize appropriate tools needed to better automate testing

jobs.title: WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
About Our Company



ElegantThemes.com is a leader in WordPress Theme & Plugin Development. We have been building the top premium WordPress themes and plugins for the past 8 years and we maintain the largest customer bases in the ecosystem. 350,799 users, freelance developers and web design agencies depend on our beautiful designs and we work hard everyday to make sure we are creating the best WordPress products on the web. Divi, our flagship theme and page builder plugin is pushing the boundaries and has inspired an absolutely amazing community to form around it. A focus on community is a core part of our culture and it makes our work environment is a truly rewarding one.





Job Description



As a WordPress Developer at Elegant Themes, you will be working with a small and agile team made up of talented devs from all around the world. We work with git, chat on Slack and our team structure is flat and open. Self-motivated individuals tend to thrive best here, and we are looking for someone filled with inspiration and who isn't afraid to take initiative.



This position is for someone with a deep understanding of WordPress. You have built your own themes and plugins before and possibly even contributed to WordPress Core. You enjoy finding elegant solutions to complex problems and are familiar with the WordPress motto - "code is poetry." You are up-to-date with the latest and greatest trends and technologies because you are engaged in the open source community and you enjoy building software that pushes the web forward. While WordPress is a PHP-based application, we are continually moving towards React as our main development language, so you should be excited about learning and working with Javascript. 



This is a full time position available to both on-site and remote employees. Employment includes full benefits, paid vacation, a competitive salary and unlimited espresso brewed from our Rocket Cellini Premium Plus v2!

 



Responsibilities




  • Be creative and contribute based on your own merit.

  • Be a positive, humble and contributing member to our small team. 

  • Take the initiate to better yourself as a developer and to apply that knowledge to better our products and help our team succeed. 





Required Experience




  • Complete understanding of the WordPress core software and its functions at the code level.

  • Experience building WordPress themes/plugins.

  • Mastery of WordPress coding and security best practices.





Required Skills




  • PHP

  • CSS

  • HTML

  • MYSQL

  • JAVASCRIPT

  • GIT





Bonus QualificationsREACT




  • REACT

  • JQUERY

  • BACKBONE

  • REDUX

  • GRUNT

  • GULP

  • SASS

  • A history of open source software contribution



Learn More



Learn more about life at Elegant Themes, including our full list of perks and benefits: http://www.elegantthemes.com/careers/

jobs.title: Director of Software Development
jobs.content:
What we’re looking for:
Wyatt Technology is looking for a highly skilled software leader to help us design and implement amazing new features to ensure that we remain the undisputed leader in our industry.


Ideally, you will love software development like other people love baseball. You will play with obscure languages in your spare time, and might have written your own photo editing system, music generation software, or video game…just for fun. You like:



  • Keeping a development team on track and happy (when possible).

  • Building organizations of exceptional software engineers and teams.

  • Project planning and prioritization under tight deadlines.

  • To be the voice of the SW team to the business and the voice of the business to the SW team.

  • Ensuring sufficient processes and tools are in place to meet the requirements of the business and customers.

  • Writing production code and leading by example.

  • Science, instrumentation, and have preferably worked in a laboratory at some point in your career.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer @ Talkatone  connect millions
jobs.content:
Talkatone is a rapidly growing mobile VoIP product with millions of users. Our users rely on our service each and every day to communicate with family, friends, colleagues and even people outside of their existing networks. They want us to make their lives easier and better by enabling reliable, real-time mobile communications when they want, where they want, how they want.


 As a senior iOS engineer at Talkatone you’ll be responsible for taking the existing app to new heights, as well as developing new offerings and taking them just as high.

jobs.title: Backend/API Developer
jobs.content: The foremost responsibility of this position is development of (and maintaining of) the backend-end and middle-ware of our flagship product. Development is predominantly in Python with some C/C++. Strong backend-end development skills are a must with the ability to rapidly prototype and work collaboratively with other developers (including our overseas developers). It is important that a candidate be energetic and enthusiastic about this kind of work, with a "take charge" attitude and willingness to devour existing code/documentation to take ownership (or rewrite it if you think you have a better solution). In addition, this position requires work on internal tools and automation. Some basic web development/design skills are a plus. If you are interested in software security this position provides the opportunity to participate in security research.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager - San Jose, CA
jobs.content:
Reference 122118BR. Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.

For immediate and confidential consideration, please send your resume to kelcenko@ebay.com. The Commerce OS team is looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic Technical Product Manager to own and drive the delivery of our platform and web services capabilities. This person will work closely with world class developers, quality engineers, program managers, architects and business stakeholders in an agile environment. He/she will be responsible for driving innovation, delivery, communication and adoption of eBay’s public and partner APIs and focused on making eBay’s partners and sellers successful on the platform. The right person will be passionate about technology, scalability and online commerce and have strong technical and product management skills to drive strategy and execution.


We measure our success by our customers' success.This is supported by the most powerful selling platform, making eBay the place people go to sell things - small and medium-sized retailers and consumer sellers alike. The Commerce OS organization inside eBay sets eBay’s technology standards, provides a scalable platform for web service development, and provides a coherent set of APIs that are used both internally and externally by thousands of partner developers around the world to build these possible buying and selling experiences.


The right person will be passionate about technology, scalability and online commerce and have strong technical and product management skills to drive strategy and execution.


Qualifications:




  • Solid understanding of technical platforms, and internal and 3rd party interfaces.




  • Demonstrated ability to treat technical platform components and API as products and drive their roadmap and delivery




  • Proven track record of building ecommerce applications (native and web)




  • Strong knowledge of REST, OAuth, security and other API-related technologies.




  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




  • Very strong knowledge of agile software development methodology.




  • Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with diverse internal audiences




  • Demonstrated analysis and innovative problem solving skills using a systems thinking approach.




Education:




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field. MBA is a strong plus




•eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.

jobs.title: Lead Architect - Digital Products and Platforms
jobs.content:
The Lead Architect on FBC’s Digital Products and Platforms team is responsible for the design of RESTful API services and client integrations. This role is part of a cross-functional team that experiments with new technology and proactively searches for the best solutions and ideas in the marketplace.


Responsibilities:


As Lead Architect, you will design systems that support iPhone, Android, Apple TV, and the Web as well as:



  • Build applications primarily using a Node.js, Angular, React and PHP.

  • Lead, train, and motivate developers to deliver first-class technology solutions in a positive, fun, yet challenging and deadline driven environment.

  • Work closely with other Product and Technology teams, internal and external, to bring technology solutions and perspectives to the product development process.

  • Set forth code quality guidelines and standards, lead code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned to pre-defined architectural specifications.

  • Identify/troubleshoot application code-related issues, and review and provide feedback to any required final user documentation.

jobs.title: Java / JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Infomedia Ltd is a publicly-listed company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX symbol "IFM"). We are the leading supplier of information solutions to the parts and service sector of the global automotive industry. Infomedia's business solutions are currently used each business day by over 150,000 dealership personnel. They are produced in more than 30 languages and at work in 186 countries. Their powerful search functions and intuitive, user-friendly interface helps boost efficiency, profitability and customer retention for OE Parts and Service Departments.

At Infomedia we do things differently. We develop niche, one-of-a-kind software solutions for the automotive industry but we also know that to stay unique and to continue to be the #1 in our industry we need unique and one-of-a-kind thought leaders and intelligent problem solvers who are always striving to take our products to the next level. We pride ourselves on our values of Integrity, Innovation, Togetherness, Care and on having a Global mindset in everything we do to ensure we are always thinking BIG!

This is where you come in……..

What are we looking for?

  • 1-3 years of full-stack Java development
  • Solid experience in JavaScript development (Ideally AngularJS)
  • Experience with AWS, MongoDB, Lucene or MS SQL highly regarded
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal and awesome attention to detail
  • Relevant university degree with solid grades

That's the tangible stuff. Now the softer stuff.....

  • Of course we want the passion, the drive and and intelligence but that's a no brainer.
  • Analytical problem solver and intelligent thought leader.
  • Not shy of throwing out solutions to problems and jumping in at the deep end.
  • The person that will be the master of their own destiny - we will nurture, support and guide any of our team into whatever technology or business skill that the want to grow into, but you will be accountable for being the driving force behind that progression

In return you will be joining a company who doesn't just throw out an awesome marketing spiel to lure you in just for you to realize you have joined another humdrum dev shop. Our team works with some of the coolest technologies around, building some seriously innovative and interesting products and we have a culture of openness, honesty and creativity.

Some other key benefits:

  • Onsite gym facilities for staff
  • Games & Breakout areas
  • Onsite parking
  • Fun, relaxed but very high performing environment!

Sound like you? Then hit the apply button and drop us over your profile – we want to chat with you.

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer

jobs.title: Technical Support Professional
jobs.content:
Milestone Systems, Inc. is looking for a skilled Support Professional to work in our US Headquarters located in beautiful Beaverton, Oregon. We are looking for someone who is tech savvy and thrives in a technological environment. If you are a believer in technology at its finest, then this is the place for you.


We offer an exciting and challenging job in the world’s leading VMS Company. The Support Professional (SP) is typically a first point of contact with Milestone Partners and therefore has a key role in helping Milestone achieve its mission goal of excellent Customer / Partner satisfaction. The SP delivers responsive and reliable solutions to Milestone Partners through application of knowledge of Milestone organization, services and products.


As a Milestone Employee, YOU are the key to our success. Come join our dynamic international team and be a part of our rapidly growing, successful business.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Make every customer interaction a satisfying experience through a professional, outgoing and personable attitude

  • Resolve customer requests, questions and complaints effectively, frequently requiring analysis of situations to determine best use of online or technical support resources

  • Serve as liaison between the customer and the Technical Support team, escalating cases not within own skillsets up the support chain in a timely and effective manner

  • Provide timely & accurate status updates to customers and relevant internal stakeholders

  • Represent expectations, intentions, and attitudes of customers and co-workers accurately

  • Continuous effort to acquire and maintain good knowledge of Milestone’s products as well as Support procedures, practices, and policies

  • Assist in ensuring that delivered solutions are documented as knowledge base articles to help make the team successful

  • Ensures that observed patterns of customer pain-points are highlighted to manager

  • Informs customers of the appropriate support options that best fit the customer's needs

jobs.title: Platform Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Broala, Inc is seeking a talented, collaborative, and deeply curious Platform Quality Engineer to help us create a new family of cybersecurity products. We are an ambitious startup based in downtown Berkeley. Our customer list includes 10% of the Fortune 50, and we are growing rapidly.

In this important role, you will be a champion for product quality:



  1. Using well-honed instincts for how systems fail, you will identify creative and diabolical techniques to stress our products and make them break.

  2. You will find solutions for the issues you discover, gaining deep knowledge about our platform in the process.

  3. You will test integration with external products and systems (for example: Splunk), and strive to automate every aspect of your work.


We expect you to help mold this role based on your skills, perspectives, and interests.  We’re a dynamic startup, and inevitably you’ll be involved in other engineering projects as well (brainstorming, troubleshooting, prototyping, testing ideas).

We care about your resume, but much more important is clear demonstration of talent, dedication, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment.     

Ideally, you are:



  • Highly skilled in systems / platform engineering, with a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience

  • Energized by a steep learning curve

  • Intrigued by the challenge of measuring and assuring product quality in some of the most demanding network environments  



  • Most happy working in a collaborative environment where clear communication, mutual  respect, and technical excellence are highly valued

  • Familiar with the Bro network monitoring platform, and other open-source cyber security tools


A sampling of the technologies we use:



  • Bro

  • Linux

  • Python

  • C/C++

  • Docker and VMs

  • AWS


We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. In fact, we expect and want you to learn new things in this role. If in doubt about your qualifications, please consider applying - and use the cover letter to address any gaps in your experience.  

More about Broala

Our company was founded by the scientists and technologists who created the Bro network monitoring platform, now protecting thousands of organizations worldwide including some of the largest and most complex. We aim to build exceptional tools for cybersecurity and network monitoring, and to generate an ongoing revenue stream for the open-source Bro project.   

Broala offers:



  • an unusual startup experience: high-profile customers, accelerating growth, proven technology

  • a small team (~10) of smart, friendly, and dedicated colleagues

  • rewarding and challenging work

  • generous healthcare benefits and vacation

  • stock options


We are located in Berkeley, near downtown BART.  Within a small walking radius you’ll find an amazing museum, multiple theaters, music venues, a world-class film archive and cinemas, international restaurants at every price point, bars and breweries, the YMCA, swimming pools, a public library, running trails, bookstores, UC Berkeley, a dog park, Trader Joe’s, and much more.  We also have a small team located in Columbus, Ohio - another possible work location.   

Broala strongly values diversity and inclusion.  

To apply, please send a cover letter and CV or resume to jobs@broala.com. Be sure to let us know where you heard about the job, and feel free to send links to any projects or code you’re proud of.  


https://www.broala.com/platform-quality-engineer.html
