jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Who are we? CoStar Group is the leading data provider of Multi-residential and Commercial Real Estate Data in an industry valued at over 13 trillion dollars. We own and run some of the most highly trafficked sites in commercial real estate like www.Apartments.com, www.ApartmentFinder.com, www.Loopnet.com, www.LandsofAmerica.com to name a few.


Responsibilities:



  • Work in a fast-paced environment managing multiple products across the organization to include www.Apartments.com, www.LoopNet.com to name a few.

  • Manage all components in the full stack, and assist with building out server automation across the entire infrastructure. 

  • Ensure critical systems, applications, and services are always up and running by monitoring, gathering, and analyzing data from different network sources.

  • Oversee and administer the operations and processes of a virtualized environment.


Qualifications.



  • At least 5 years of experience managing a highly available public facing webserver or website.

  • Expertise in configuring, maintain and troubleshooting issues.

  • Hands-on experience in at least 2-3 of the following:



  • Chef or Puppet or similar tools,

  • F5, Web configurations, caching, and content delivery networks.

  • Scalable and open architecture of IIS.

  • Experience with monitoring tools.

  • Experience with Virtualization.

  • Scripting guru.

  • Good understanding of storage and Networking.

  • You consider yourself a borderline developer – but you know that you enjoy playing the coveted role in operations.


Good to have:



  • Experience with AWS or Azure

  • Have supported iOS or Android applications.

  • Experience with SSIS and ETL.

jobs.title: Agile Project Leader
jobs.content:
Job Title: Agile Project Leader


Location: Portland, ME


Job Description


Newforma is seeking a senior, versatile, and experienced Agile project leader in Portland, ME.   Join our team that is transforming the construction industry by delivering state-of-the-art web and mobile applications.  Our office is located in beautiful downtown Portland in a second-story office with a view of the harbor.



Primary Qualifications



  1. You have the experience to lead software teams following Agile best practices.  

  2. You value customers and users -- and know how to manage and motivate your team so that they are inspired to champion customer experience the way you do.  

  3. You have the ability to empower team-members to maximize their ability to deliver working software.

  4. You are an experienced software development leader, and understand what it takes tactically to lead successful software projects.

  5. You see beauty in simplicity, and strive to simplify process, status, and communication needs between the delivery team and project stakeholders.  

  6. You understand the dependency between requirements and delivery -- and don’t settle for soft or poorly articulated requirements.  You recognize what a risk it can be to start software projects too early, or create backlog stories that are poorly defined.

  7. You are trustworthy and respect the responsibilities that come with leadership.  You communicate honestly and openly about needs, status, risks, and progress.

  8. You are able to work with other product stakeholders to fulfill the role of Product Owner

jobs.title: Manager, Software Development - Identity and Access Management, Job ID 1029290
jobs.content:
About Pfizer
 A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Role Description

This role can be based in New York, NY, Groton, CT, Peapack, NJ, or Collegeville, PA.

 The Digital Credential Services Engineer is responsible for the development and management of service technologies for the Digital Credential Services (DCS) area. The DCS Engineer will work with the Delivery Manager and Service Lead on enhancements, continuous improvements, and guide the work activities of developers and other technical resources. The role responsibilities include requirements gathering and definition, technical design and specification, development, testing, and implementation support. The DCS Engineer will develop new solutions and maintain the existing technology to engineer world class global Digital Credential Services. This position is responsible for the end-to-end technical management of DCS solutions encompassing Multi-factor authentication and high-assurance credential management processes. The processes and services provided are audited regularly and are required to meet all corporate security policies. This is an Operations role with 24x7 global service support responsibilities along with continual monitoring of the service for quality levels, and response to outages or performance issues with a sense of urgency.

Responsibilities
•Develop and deploy solutions to ensure that Digital Credential services are performing according to specifications, meet defined procedures, and comply with applicable information security policies and requirements.
•Integrate applications and third-party products into internal services and support and upgrade implemented systems.
•Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve Pfizer processes and end user experiences.
•Collaborate with the Service Lead, Service Delivery Manager, and customers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
•Maintain highest levels of development practices including technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
•Develop and maintain service patterns used for application integration.
••Manage technical work activities of contingent worker resources to support enhancements and continuous improvements to services.
•Support 24x7 management and oversight of BAU operations.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Connance is seeking a driven DevOps Engineer to apply their technical skills and programming knowledge to help improve platform deployments, build internal tools, and quickly provide solutions to production platform issues.  In this role, you will work on high-profile bug fixes and work with internal teams to improve operational efficiency of the Connance platform.



The successful DevOps Engineer will have a strong programming background in C#, a solid understanding of SQL and database programming, as well as a solid understanding of running and automating production systems in a Windows and MS SQL Server environment.  This individual must be passionate about technology and able to maintain a clear, organized approach in critical situations.



Responsibilities:




  • Use C# .NET, ASPX, JavaScript, CSS, and MS SQL Server to enhance software that:

    • Provides customers with workflow tools for modifying data and reporting on that data

    • Enforces security and restricts access to features based on user permissions

    • Provides logging and exception handling allowing for a seamless user experience



  • Investigate production issues pertaining to customer features to determine root cause and then implement a solution

  • Build well-designed software and internal tools in a way that is generic, reusable, and easily extensible, as well as solves the business needs and requirements

  • Participate in code reviews, design reviews, testing, and deployment

  • Capture experience from troubleshooting system and customer issues by documenting known issues and solutions

  • Contribute to our standards and processes for maintaining and updating our production systems

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Connance is seeking a talented Technical Support Engineer to apply their technical skills and application knowledge to help diagnose issues and provide solutions internally and for our clients. In this role, you will diagnose and fix systems in multiple environments by monitoring data flows and system statuses.


The successful Technical Support Engineer will have strong communication skills, as well as a solid understanding of IT networking and system issues in a Windows environment. This individual must be passionate about learning technologies and able to maintain a clear, organized approach in critical situations.


Responsibilities: 



  • Monitor the daily operations of the enterprise application environment by analyzing information and recommending short and long-term resolutions to issues; including the creation and maintenance of scripts and automation tools

  • Respond to unplanned customer issues and incidents, solve challenging technical support issues, answer technical questions, and develop means to reduce downtime and minimize customer impact related to supported applications

  • Write and verify results of complicated Microsoft SQL Server queries

  • Support the IT systems and networking needs of a MS Window’s environment

  • Capture experience from troubleshooting system issues and diagnosing support incidents by documenting known issues and solutions

  • Contribute to our standards and processes for maintaining and updating our production systems

jobs.title: SQL Report Developer
jobs.content:
Connance is looking for a talented SQL Report Developer who is passionate about designing and implementing great software, able to quickly become familiar with our platform, and make immediate contributions to the team. The Report Developer will be a key member of a small Scrum team that is focused on building reports that integrate with our existing web platform.  It is these reports that help our clients gain visibility into their revenue cycle and provide insight on revenue performance.


Responsibilities:



  • Build new reports using Logi Info Studio and Microsoft SQL Server

  • Investigate existing queries and/or write new queries with performance optimization in mind

  • Display report data in a web platform using data tables, charts, graphs, and other data visualizations

  • Investigate production issues pertaining to reports to determine root cause and then implement a solution

  • Build well-designed and secure software in a way that is generic, reusable, and easily extensible, as well as solves the business needs and requirements

  • Participate in code reviews, design reviews, testing, and deployment

  • Contribute to standards / processes that are appropriate for our business for software design, implementation, documentation, QA, and releases

jobs.title: Director of Engineering, Android
jobs.content:
iHeartRadio seeks a seasoned Android leader with deep hands-on experience to lead our 10-12 person Android engineering team. You must be driven to build great Android apps, be fluent in good architecture design, and able to work within a fast paced Agile team structure to lead engineering efforts across several Android form factors. Delivery, accountability, and passion are three words your peers use to describe you; you excel in setting the right standards in continuously delivered clean, well tested code. You have the experience supported by a successful track record of delivering solutions in a complex and fragmented Android ecosystem.


In your first year on the job, expect to lead several large platform wide initiatives (think brand new product, full app redesign, i18n, etc), in addition to platform improvements of your own design. We want to preserve battery life, maintain a high Play Store rating, and you know exactly how we will accomplish it. You set the standard for good code reviews and know how to operate in a variety of product team structures. You are a proponent of unit tests, continuous integration and rapid deployment. You write code that runs on Lollipop and doesn't break on Marshmallow. Or an Android TV. Or a 4:3 screen. Or a smartwatch. Or a Chromecast. Or inside a Ford.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage a team of 10-12 engineers and remote contractors encompassing a variety of Android specialties

  • Develop, architect and deploy major new features on iHeart Android apps

  • Build and maintain common code libraries used in phones, tablets, TVs, smart watches and automobiles

  • Create innovative solutions in media streaming and mobile user experience

  • Maintain high unit test coverage and continuous integration principles

  • Cultivate an environment of excellence, through code design, code reviews

  • Mastery of the Android development and hardware ecosystem, from devices to the Play Store


Requirements:



  • 5+ years of hands on experience with the Android platform (additional experience with server side Java or Scala highly preferred)

  • Experience building high volume consuming facing applications at massive scale

  • Considerable experience debugging and profiling Android applications

  • Experience with continuous integration tools like Jenkins or Travis CI and automated testing frameworks such as Espresso

  • Ability to independently set tasks and complete work for yourself and your team with limited direction

  • Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment and maintain high productivity

  • Ability to devise creative technical solutions

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field preferred

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Security
jobs.content:
There's no such thing as a "safe system" - only safer systems. Our Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. As a Security Engineer, you help protect network boundaries, keep computer systems and network devices hardened against attacks and provide security services to protect highly sensitive data like passwords and customer information. Security Engineers work hands-on with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. You also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

You use your industry experience to own and drive the resolution of complex security incidents, policy questions and technical security issues.


You are a skilled software engineer who enjoys security work and is an expert in systems security, applications security, network security, cryptography or automated malware analysis. You are a security researcher who thrives on addressing real world problems and likes to code.


In this role, you will focus on security for components of our systems, such as client devices, networking equipment and server infrastructure, with an emphasis on threats from all sources. You will be building large-scale systems to protect Google's users including, for example, hardening our core infrastructure, detecting intrusion attempts, or preventing malware across various platforms.


Responsibilities



  • Design and apply advanced security techniques.

  • Develop advanced security and cryptographic systems.

  • Build large-scale detection systems.

jobs.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications
jobs.content:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


[Responsibilities]



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a great dev who wants to work on new and interesting projects, with new problems to solve all the time? We’re looking for great devs who want to work on really interesting projects.  


You know that Android is the dominant smartphone platform, and will be powering many different types of devices in the years to come.  At touchlab, Android is our focus and our goal is to be the best Android development shop around.  Period.  Come help us make that happen.


We need developers that want to help define what great software development is, both for Android specifically, and small, agile teams in general.


Besides just “coding”, we like to stay involved and give back to the community. Our team runs the NY Android Developers meetup and Droidcon NYC, so we’re looking for people who want to increase their visibility and contribute to the community.  If you’re interested in teaching others how great Android is done, we’re launching a training school in the fall, so this is the place for you.


We're entering a major growth phase for the company and looking for the right people who want to help make that happen.  Rev share and equity plans to the right candidates.


Relocation assistance can be discussed.  Visas are a different story, but will do what we can.

jobs.title: Contract Automation Engineer
jobs.content: Hearst Television reaches more than 25 million people across the US every month on its 26 local digital properties connected to loved and trusted brands like WCVB – Boston, KCRA – Sacramento and WESH – Orlando, to name a few. We’re crafting new, elegant digital experiences that make our local news that matters come to life across all platforms and devices. Check out our recent native app re-launch by searching WTAE in the Apple and Google stores. We’re unifying our publishing tools and user experiences to enable talented editorial teams to tell more engaging stories more often.  We’re creating a game-changing modern content technology stack - built from the ground up to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell these amazing stories.  We’re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe passionately in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems.  We’re committed to test-driven development and need a talented contract Automation Engineer to join our team who is passionate about ensuring the quality of products used and valued by our users.  You express your passion through code, relentlessly seeking to enhance the release process and ensure integrity across our sites and apps.

jobs.content:
Why join Runkeeper as an Android Developer? We have fully embraced RXJava, using it for all async operations. We investigate and utilize new third party libraries, including but not limited to Butterknife/OkHTTP/Retrofit/Guava (not new but grrreat!) /Picasso/ Roboelectric/ Mockito, etc. etc.  As a team member, you will implement key features and functionality in our Android app and across Runkeeper as a whole. You will provide real technical leadership to the engineering team at large in terms of our Android approach and implementation. 


RunKeeper transforms your phone into a personal trainer, helping you track your activities, set your goals, and stay motivated to go that extra mile. We are a small, successful Boston based mobile startup with over 50M users worldwide. We work closely with Google on cutting edge projects. We were out at launch with the release of Wear and Google Fit. Our team has sent engineers to Google I/O every year for the past 4 years and will continue to do so moving forward.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us


Appboy is an industry-leading customer relationship suite for mobile marketers. Thousands of global brands use Appboy's robust audience segmentation and advanced multi-channel messaging system to create highly personalized lifecycle marketing campaigns in every relevant channel -- from push, in-app, and web to email, wearables, and emerging technologies -- across billions of user profiles worldwide to better engage, retain, and monetize their customers.


We have a cool office and fun people.  Our benefits are great and we get lunch catered every day.


About the role


On the mobile team, our customer is the engineer. That means we build bulletproof, performant, adaptable SDKs that support any environment you throw at it.  We build SDKs that the worlds best app engineers are excited to put in their app.  The APIs must be clean and intuitive, the integration must be quick and easy, and the footprint must be minimal.


As a member of the mobile team you will be contributing to SDKs that the worlds top apps use to understand and engage their users.  Your code will run on hundreds of millions of devices and you’ll have the opportunity to work on multiple platforms.  You will be on the bleeding edge of mobile development, working with a great team and owning critical pieces of our product.

jobs.title: C# / ASP.NET MVC Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Shift Digital is a cutting edge digital marketing and technology company, providing innovative business solutions that power the most successful and cost-effective digital programs. Since 2000, the Shift Digital team has built, deployed and managed easy-to-use solutions focused on the retail distribution channel of our clients. While focusing primarily on automotive digital advertising, Shift Digital has grown into other verticals such as home building, power sports, and finance verticals.



We are currently looking for Senior Software Engineers to join our growing Web Development team in Birmingham, MI! We want to talk to bright folks interested in things like search/display advertising, social, cloud computing, and analytics/big data solutions. Our Software Engineers are part of a larger delivery team, working alongside Digital Project Managers, Business Analysts, and a team of Creative professionals.

You’ll be working on one of our many different product sets such as Lead Management Systems, Analytics/Data Sciences, CRM, or our proprietary CMS solution. Each product is design for enterprise scale using the latest and great bits such as Microsoft Azure, MVC 5, SignalR, AngularJS and so much more. As a client driven organization, we move at an incredible pace and believe in the philosophy that shipping is a feature.

This is a full time position with Shift Digital. In addition to our excellent benefits package, we offer very competitive compensation, paid holidays, generous paid time off (PTO) and other employee perks

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Lead IT Software Developer
jobs.content:
Aurico

Lead Software Engineer - Manager, Software Development

Job Description

Software engineering professionals, are you looking for a rewarding career opportunity working with an industry-leading organization? Join us at Aurico! This is an exciting time for us, as we have joined the CareerBuilder family. We are one of the leading background screening, drug testing, and occupational health service companies in the world - rapidly pursuing our goal of creating a user-focused screening platform that is simple, dynamic, and easy to use. Quite simply, we dig deeper than many of our competitors. By providing accurate and in-depth information in our reports, we help our customers retain the "A" players and lead them to a higher performing organization.

Due to our continued growth, we are seeking a Lead Software Engineer or Software Engineering Manager to join our team. In this position, you will play a key leadership role serving as a subject matter expert developing and testing new applications for our next generation background screening platform. We are passionate about creating quality software through the practice of user-input design, automated and manual tests, and clean code principles. If you are interested in joining an innovative company that will both reward and challenge your expertise, then Aurico may be the perfect fit for you. Contact us today!

Job Responsibilities

As a leader over our Software Engineering team, you will be responsible for overseeing and supporting the complete life-cycle development of new features for our WebACE platform, from requirement gathering and deployment, to ultimately deliver a product that will produce business value along the way. This will involve influencing the prioritization of product backlogs, mentoring junior engineers, and being an active contributor to the code base.

Additional responsibilities for this research operations coach role include, but are not limited to:
  • Leading the development of new features, bug fixes and system integrations, as well as providing architectural and systems-design expertise to the solution.
  • Following established coding standards and practices
  • Applying your subject matter expertise to a variety of web development tools and technologies, such as .NET, JavaScript frameworks, HTML, CSS, Responsive Design, relational and non-relational databases, or other related technologies within modern web application frameworks
  • Working with the Product Owner in scoping and prioritizing product backlog items
  • Providing support to your Agile Project Manager to optimize process, planning, and execution for the team




Job Requirements

We are looking for a passionate Lead Software Engineer who combines exceptional leadership and coaching abilities, with a demonstrated knowledge of Software Engineering principles and Object Oriented concepts. You should also be highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to convey highly technical information to internal staff as well as external clients. It is also important that you display verbal and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to work well both independently or as part of a team within a fast-paced deadline-driven environment.

Specific qualifications for this senior IT engineering role include:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical education
  • Minimum 5+ years of professional software development experience
  • Extensive experience with object-oriented programming with C# or .Net
  • Experience mentoring and leading engineers towards software solutions
  • Experience with automated testing to insure product integrity
  • A practical understanding of agile development methodologies
  • Proficiency with MS Office products


Join Aurico - experience the difference. Take the challenge.



Apply now!

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer, AWS & Continous Integration + Perks
jobs.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer


at Headspace(View all jobs) Santa Monica HQ


About Headspace:


Headspace was founded in London in 2010 by Rich Pierson and Andy Puddicombe. Originally conceived as a meditation events company, Headspace has evolved into the world’s most popular meditation app. Using proven mindfulness techniques, it will teach you how to train your mind for a healthier, happier life. Sessions take as little as 10 minutes a day, and you can do them wherever and whenever you like. Our app has now been downloaded more than 5 million times in 150 countries, helping so many people to enjoy the benefits of a clearer calmer mind. Today, we’re ready to embark on the next phase in our evolution: to become the world’s most comprehensive guide to health and happiness.  


Last summer we completed a $30mm Series A funding round. The round was led by The Chernin Group, with significant participation from other media and tech leaders including Jim Breyer (via Breyer Capital), Allen & Co, William Morris Endeavor, Freelands Ventures (the venture arm of Elisabeth Murdoch) and Advancit (the venture arm of Shari Redstone). Rounding out the raise were a handful of influential individuals including Jeff Weiner (LinkedIn CEO), Jessica Alba, Ryan Seacrest, and Jared Leto. 


You can read more about us in Fast Company or the New Yorker.


About the Sr. DevOps Engineer @ Headspace:


We are searching for a Sr. DevOps Engineer to join our team. This role will provide support for the Developers, Big Data, QA and Product teams and will focus heavily on automation, monitoring and scaling the infrastructure.


How your skills and passion will come to life at Headspace:



  • Build and maintain Production, Development and QA environments

  • Improve performance and scalability of existing systems

  • Monitor and troubleshoot server related issues

  • Develop and document best practices for disaster recovery and application deployment

  • Perform penetration testing to ensure security of our infrastructure

  • Research and develop new technologies for improving existing systems

  • Build, maintain and improve CI/CD systems

  • Participate in on-call rotation


Some perks of working at Headspace:



  • Meditation

  • Catered Lunches

  • Flexible hours

  • Transportation Subsidy

  • Bonus Program

  • Team Events / Trips

  • Gym Membership

  • Healthcare

  • New computers

  • Parental leave

Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Haiti and India.

jobs.title: Remote Customer Support Associate (New York Based)
jobs.content:
Paperless Post is seeking a compassionate customer support associate that will help our users have the best experience possible on our platform on a daily basis. Because we never read answers out of a manual, youll spend your days providing the kind of personalized responses that make customers feel like theyre talking to a real live human beingbecause, well, they are!

After completing a two-week training session in our New York City office, remote support team members work 40 hours a week in 6-8 hour shifts, including some weekends and holidays, from home. Were aiming for 24/7 support as much as possible, so your ability to work odd hours is a plus.

 **To apply, send us your resume and a cover letter that answers the following questions:

  • Please provide your general availability for each day of the week. Is it steady or does it change frequently? How flexible is your schedule?
  • What do you think is the most important responsibility you have as a customer support rep?
  • Explain a scenario when you had to tell a customer no or had to correct their mistake.
  • Explain a scenario when you made a mistake. What did learn from the experience? How was it resolved? How did you feel about the feedback you received (from your customer, teammates, or manager)?  
  • Whats your favorite gif? 

What you'll do here
  • Troubleshoot and respond to customer questions and issues over the phone, via email, and on live chat.
  • Work closely with fellow support reps to identify and track major issues and trends to improve the user experience.
  • Stay familiar with our site and its offerings to best serve user questions.
  • Work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.
 
What you bring to the table
  • MUST be a permanent resident in New York
  • 2+ years experience in customer support with a track record of both working independently and collaborating with a team.
  • A reliable Internet connection and a quiet environment to work in.
  • Ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-volume environment. We get a lot of inquires and we work through them quickly; our reps are energized, not discouraged, by the pace.  
  • Fantastic written and verbal communication skills and superb interpersonal skills.
  • Experience working with a team to analyze issues, learn from them, and create short-term solutions and long-term improvements.
  • An endless curiosity for our site and product and users.
  • Experience with Adobe Photoshop a big plus.
  • Familiarity with online platforms a plus.
  • Fluency in multiple languages a plus.
 

A little bit about us
The PP Support team takes empathy to the next level. Were a small but mighty team of brand ambassadors who are the first line of defense for the company, interacting with customers, analyzing feedback, and working with tech teams to ensure new features match real-world needs. We laugh and cry with users and appreciate a well-timed cat GIF.

Company-wide we enjoy an amazing ecosystem of an even gender split and healthy balance of engineers and designers. Because Paperless Post isnt supported by ad revenue, we get to spend our days focused on creating and improving on the ideal version of our platform, product, content, and partnerships for our users.

To apply: Please apply here: http://grnh.se/pnbo31**To apply, send us your resume and a cover letter that answers the following questions:Please provide your general availability for each day of the week. Is it steady or does it change frequently? How flexible is your schedule?What do you think is the most important responsibility you have as a customer support rep?Explain a scenario when you had to tell a customer no or had to correct their mistake.Explain a scenario when you made a mistake. What did learn from the experience? How was it resolved? How did you feel about the feedback you received (from your customer, teammates, or manager)? Whats your favorite gif?

jobs.title: Web Development Team Manager
jobs.content:
Portland State University (PSU) seeks to enhance the intellectual, social, cultural, and economic qualities of urban life by providing access to a quality liberal education for undergraduates and an appropriate array of professional and graduate programs especially relevant to the Portland metropolitan area. PSU is located in beautiful, vibrant downtown Portland. Easily accessible by bike and public transit, PSU is surrounded by many restaurants, food carts, parks, and local businesses.


In the PSU Office of Information Technology (OIT), we provide academic and administrative computer support and communications for the University. Our number one value is our employees - as such, we actively encourage a healthy work-life balance and strive to support our employees professionally and personally. This is fostered through many avenues. We strongly support professional development, and there are many offerings on campus and in the local Portland area. PSU offers a robust tuition discount and we encourage our staff to take advantage of this, be it for pursuing a degree or personal interest. Dynamic, engaged, motivated, innovative, curious, impassioned, transparent, open, honest, communicative, collaborative are values OIT lives by.  In OIT, we believe that this type of support creates a positive environment for our employees both at work and in their personal lives.


The Web Development Team (WDT) Manager reports to the Associate CIO and is responsible for the leadership and management of the Web Development Team within OIT. This position will oversee planning, implementation, maintenance and administration of the academic & research focused web applications managed centrally for Portland State University. This is a new department within OIT, with exciting potential for expansion and collaboration. This position will also contribute to the OIT management team by providing input on and evaluation of technology based initiatives, helping ensure that OIT meets its goals and mission.


Below are some of the technologies the WDT uses. Our new leader should have some familiarity with similar technologies to:



  • Python, Django, Django REST Framework

  • JavaScript, AngularJS, jQuery, Bower, RequireJS

  • LESS, Bootstrap, and Angular Material

  • PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and RabbitMQ

  • Git, GitHub, and JIRA

  • Linux (CentOS) and Mac OS, Apache, mod_wsgi


The starting annual salary rate for this position will be between $70,000 and $80,000/year with an excellent benefits package including 95% premium paid healthcare for employees and family members; a generous retirement and vacation package; and reduced tuition rates for employee, spouse, or dependent at any of the seven Oregon public universities. Wellness offerings include an extensive and affordable recreation center and free classes on topics such as investing, sustainability, and saving for retirement. More information on compensation and benefits can be found at: http://pdx.edu/hr/core-benefits


If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you, please read the qualifications in the full job announcement and apply at https://jobs.hrc.pdx.edu/postings/19883

jobs.title: Director of Design
jobs.content:
Arteriors is seeking a product design leader to spearhead our innovative design of case goods and upholstered furniture collections. The Director of Design is responsible for the design of new product collections by utilizing existing or self-sourced inspirational elements, leveraging new materials through interface with factories and refining of product prototypes. Managerial functions include sales analysis, market intelligence, mentoring designer staff, and cross-functional collaboration with several other internal departments. The role will lead a small team that is anticipated to grow over time, and proactively leads the brand’s large furniture product development (which is currently in an early stage of evolution)..

The Director is expected to be on top of market and competitive trends, collaborate closely with quality control and merchandising teams, and work closely with senior management. The ideal candidate is a rare mix of creative ideation with a cultivated eye for design and still actively designs product, has strong product collection visualization, and luxury aesthetic combined with analytical and planning skills and the ambition to build a business through a high level of accountability and drive to achieve tangible results.

Key Responsibilities
-Drive conceptual design and development strategy with supporting execution plan for upholstered furniture and case goods incremental collections
-Oversee entire design process for upholstered furniture and case goods lines
-Drive assortment planning for follow-on collection launches
-Execute regular design reviews with executive team, including Founder and President, leveraging concept boards and other presentation tools
-Prepare for and execute productive onshore and offshore sourcing trips to identify new factories, identify new materials, review and refine prototypes, perform quality control activities, and establish and nurture supplier relationships
-Facilitate the design and development of robust product packaging
-Mentor less experienced product designers and facilitate their professional development
-Manage collection design efforts effectively to ensure product development deadlines are met and well aligned to associated expense budgets.
-Evaluate product sales analysis reports for trends and patterns, and adjust new product development assortment planning accordingly
-Collaborate with a variety of cross-functional managers, merchandising, marketing, and sales to facilitate the launch of new collections
-Drive market intelligence research on competitive lines; research, analyze and monitor home furnishing and fashion trends that influence design (color schemes, forms, materials, and other).
-Drive high performance by creating and delivering clear expectations, following through with all commitments and cultivating an environment which breeds open communication and employee growth.
-Build and maintain honest relationships with fellow leadership team.
-Catalyze commitment to and vigorous pursuit of Arteriors’ core values, culture and strategic vision.

Prior Experience and Qualification Requirements
-Minimum of 8 years of previous luxury home product design/production experience required.
-Minimum of 5 years of previous experience in furniture (case goods and/or upholstered furniture) design experience is required, with a strong emphasis on designing for stylistic flare as well as comfort & functionality.
-Minimum of 2 years of experience in a management position or higher leading design initiatives for a specific product line, including managing other designers.
-Minimum of 3 years of experience managing offshore manufacturing required.
-Must have a Bachelor’s degree in design or related field; Master’s degree preferred.
-Must have demonstrated experience in direct report management, strategic planning, and heavy cross functional collaboration and leadership.
-Experience in early concepting, design, development, and launch of a several new collections preferred.
-Demonstrated design eye for luxury home furnishings, combined with a high standard of quality for design detail and function.
-Experience in a wide variety of styles & design processes a plus.
-Must possess the ability to evaluate new product conceptually, as well as understand the design and engineering of case goods and upholstered products.
-Candidate’s portfolio must demonstrate the ability to communicate both the production and design of product.
-Strong strategic and conceptual skills.
-Ability to analyze, integrate and present data in an understandable and compelling manner.
Ability to interact effectively with Senior Management.
-Excellent computer skills with AutoCAD, Solidworks, and Adobe Creative Suite with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint.

Position Location: Dallas Texas
Travel: Approximately 20%

jobs.title: SR WEB DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
FMA is looking for a full-stack Sr. Web Developer to help grow and support our websites.


We use modern, object-oriented PHP in the Laravel framework, with MongoDB and MySQL on the back-end and Bootstrap and jQuery on the front-end. We also work with WordPress and Drupal, and our sites mostly run on Linux and nginx.


It's a relaxed environment with flexible work hours and partial remote work opportunities, but we expect quality work and love to build great products. You'll work with internal product owners as well as some external partners, but we aren't an agency. Our top publication site, thefabricator.com, has experienced 30% annual growth in unique visitors each of the past two years and our industry outreach effort, mfgday.com, boasted over 2,500 events last year. Join us to make a difference on a small, but impactful, team.


Note: FMA is currently located in Rockford IL, but is relocating to Elgin IL in December, 2016.


In this job, you will:



  • Design, develop, test and implement web applications in PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript

  • Design and maintain databases in MySQL and MongoDB

  • Lead projects within the web department

  • Provide detailed specifications and serve as a technical resource for coworkers

  • Work with a designer and digital marketing manager to continuously improve UI/UX

  • Monitor website performance and make improvements as needed

  • Implement SEO techniques to improve and maintain rankings

  • Fix bugs and address other issues submitted to the web help desk


Benefits:


FMA offers a competitive salary & benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, life, & disability insurance; flexible spending plans; 401(k) plan; 529 plan; generous paid holidays, vacation, & sick time.


FMA also offers company-wide incentive plan; paid professional development & memberships; tuition reimbursement; & fitness reimbursement.


We encourage you to visit our websites: fmanet.org; thefabricator.com; fabtechexpo.com; mfgday.com; nutsandboltsfoundation.org.


When applying, please include a cover letter noting your salary requirements with your resume.

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Engineer in the Solar Industry
jobs.content:
Become an integral part of the solar industry, and increase residential solar adoption across the U.S. by lowering soft costs associated with system design and permitting. Based in downtown Detroit, our growing business offers a creative, fast-paced, high-energy atmosphere. 


GreenLancer is looking for self-motivated software engineers with exceptional skills to join us in developing innovative solutions for the solar industry. Our technology team works in an agile fashion to deliver business value consistently and as often as possible. We're building microservices on AWS with the latest JavaScript frameworks, which allows us to deploy new functionality quickly and effortlessly.


As a Software Engineer you will architect and develop new functionality end­-to­-end, working closely with peers and collaborating with other teams to implement technical solutions. Being a Software Engineer means keeping up-to-date with new technology, and always learning, improving, and advancing your skills.


As a member of our small technology team, your work will have a huge impact.


Essential Functions and responsibilities:



  • Write clean, maintainable code using modern technology

  • Execute on the technical vision

  • Collect and analyze research from end users and other teams to present

  • Develop scalable and high-performance web applications

  • Execute on deliverables in a timely manner

  • Work closely with designers, other software engineers, leadership, and management

  • Provide feedback and solutions that would improve department processes and or task deliverables

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
adjust is a fast-growing mobile marketing analytics company with offices in Berlin, San Francisco and 10 other cities all over the world. We build business intelligence for mobile apps, placing a high premium on scientific statistics, hand-in-glove UX, and lean, pragmatic product iteration.


Our core dashboard app, running on Rails, Angular, Elixir, provides our clients with analytics and statistics on the thousands of apps which we track worldwide. The focus lies on good performance as well as usability, and our developers pay special attention to the details, while also bringing a sense of creativity to the role. You'll be working closely with colleagues from the front end and back end teams to implement and design new functionality, keeping our commitment to provide a robust, strong and practical dashboard. 


In return, we offer some of the best equipment money can buy, an ergonomic and healthy work environment, flexible hours and competitive salaries. Twice-yearly week long coder's retreats, regular friendly meetings over breakfast or some spare ribs, and of course a proper beer fridge.


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with tech & product teams

  • Planning and realization of product features

  • Significant participation in core product design

  • Contribute ideas for the improvement of the overall solution

jobs.title: Junior Designer
jobs.content:
Award winning Design & Concept firm, AvroKO, is seeking Architects and Interior Designers for the position of “Junior Designer” in our San Francisco office. Since its launch, AvroKO has earned a reputation as one of the most innovative design firms in the field of Hospitality Design. AvroKO functions as an “idea engine” thanks to a team of architects, interior designers, industrial designers, and graphic designers who collaborate to produce all aspects of the Hotels, Restaurants, Markets and Residential projects that we focus on. With offices in New York, San Francisco, and Bangkok, AvroKO is working on projects all over the world.

Junior Designer Requirements:
•The Junior Designer acts as a team’s supporting staff member in performing its services and producing its deliverables under the direction and support of the Senior Designer and oversight of the Project Manager.
•Interior Design or Architectural related degree from an accredited 4+ year program,
• 2-3 years’ experience in Hospitality Interior Design or related field.

•Ideal candidate is collaborative, self-motivated, positive and flexible with strong verbal and written communication skills.
• AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite & Microsoft Office proficiency a must,
•SketchUp, Spexx, 3Ds Max & Revit a big plus.

Local candidates preferred - possible relocation to be considered.
Position is full time, salaried, with benefits. T

To apply please submit cover letter, resume, work samples and references in PDF format to:
intdesign.manager@gmail.com with “Junior Designer – San Francisco” in the subject line.

jobs.title: Graphic Design Lead / Art Director
jobs.content:
CRYE PRECISION, a Brooklyn based manufacturer and designer of military gear and apparel, is seeking a Graphic Design Lead / Art Director.

CRYE PRECISION designs and manufactures truly innovative equipment for America’s fighting forces.
We make uncompromising gear for uncompromising individuals.
We work hard to provide smart, high-performance, long-wearing gear for people who demand the best. We make all of our gear in America from American materials.

We are looking for a talented Graphic Design Lead / Art Director to lead our growing internal creative team. You will be responsible for all of the graphical content required to bring a product to market. You must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and possess the ability to wear many hats while handling multiple projects at one time. The position consists of about 90% design work and 10% project and team management.

This position reports to the Director of Product Development, while working closely with product designers, and other creative staff to conceptualize, execute, and oversee, all visual creative, for all print and interactive material. Mentor and develop the growing design team through design critique, project oversight, and development of visual standards and documentation. We are a tight knit team and there is a lot of opportunity to work on a large range of creative projects.

Job Responsibilities:
• Oversee all content creation and production of catalogues, website, and videos for multiple internal brands.
• Implement and further define our current visual guideline/identity systems, while ensuring its alignment with the overall brand positioning and strategy.
• Create visual designs, typography, and logos for all new product lines.
• Set up photo shoots and photograph all new products and retouch photos as necessary.
• Design catalogs, instruction manuals, packaging, and garment labels, proof reading copy, and prepping all files for print.
• Adding and updating web content on existing websites.
• Design trade show booths, from layout through graphics. Quote with vendors and oversee installation.
• Creating new web sites/ interactive experiences as needed.
• Shoot and edit video / motion graphics.


Skills:

Expertise with:
• Photoshop
• Illustrator
• InDesign

Experience with:
• Premiere Pro (or other NLE)
• After Effects
• Sketchup
• 3d modeling/rendering (cinema4d/modo/3dsmax, etc…)
• Experience building responsive web sites
• Knowledge of JavaScript, PHP, ASP.NET, or other web programming languages a plus.
• Must be self-motivated with good organizational skills, strong attention to detail and excellent follow-through.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills.
• Job is based in Brooklyn, NYC.
• Must be a US Citizen.

Application details:

• Portfolio showing Graphic Design work
• Portfolio showing Web Design work
• Salary Requirements
• Education Level


Disclaimer
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed

jobs.content:

jobs.title: Senior Visual Designer
jobs.content:
Position Summary
We are seeking a Senior Visual Designer to join our highly-collaborative, award-winning team. We are looking for someone with a passion for web design and creating innovative digital experiences.

You will be a part of a unique design team where you will work closely with other senior level designers and UX designers. You will also work collaboratively with clients, project managers, developers, and digital strategists to create compelling digital experiences that complement and enhance our clients' business goals and design objectives.

You will:
• Be the design lead on an evolving roster of clients
• Be able to communicate directly with clients throughout the project cycle
• Lead projects from conception to delivery and launch
• Collaborate with the team to create beautiful and effective responsive web designs
• Create compelling branding materials, logos and other assets for select clients
• Articulate the value of design through verbal and visual presentation
• Be a team player and a positive addition to our company culture
• Establish and maintain consistently high visual design standards and proactively learn new techniques and trends in digital design.

Who you are:
• 4+ years visual design experience, preferably in an agency setting
• Bachelor’s degree in visual design or related field—or equivalent experience
• Strong passion for pushing the envelope in web design
• Understanding of user experience principles and practices
• Delight in understanding and exceeding client expectations
• Must value working collaboratively with all team members
• Must be able to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment

You have:
• Strong portfolio of web designs across multiple industries and platforms (mobile/tablet/desktop)
• Expert knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and Indesign
• Familiarity with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and their limitations and capabilities
• Familiarity with Invision, Sketch and/or Omnigraffle is preferred
• CMS experience with WordPress, Drupal, or similar applications is preferred

Compensation and Benefits
• Competitive salary
• 401K with employer matching
• 100% Employer sponsored healthcare
• A well stocked office kitchen
• Free office parking

To apply, please send us the following:
• Resume
• Brief description of your relevant experience
• Link to your online portfolio
• Annual salary expectation

Liberty Concepts is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports a diverse workplace.

jobs.title: System Administrator Linux
jobs.content:
Wirecard is a globally operating and leading provider of technology for electronic payments in all distribution channels: Online, mobile and at the point-of-sale

As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.

The companies belonging to the Wirecard Group develop intelligent solutions to assist mail-order merchants, tourism and haulage companies as well as providers of digital goods and services with electronic payment transactions. 


We are looking for a System Administrator Linux (m/f)  to join our team at Wirecard Technologies GmbH, a subsidiary in Aschheim/Munich.



Your Duties




  • Operating and planning of an enterprise server environment

  • Support of development, QA and production systems

  • Install, upgrade and support of infrastructure services

  • Development and maintainance of different administrative applications and scripts

  • Enterprise-level Troubleshooting and Analyzing

  • Conceptional work and project based work

  • Optimizing performance and reviewing concepts of the current IT Infrastructure

  • Coordination of subcontractors



Your Profile



  • BS/BA in Computer Science or related discipline

  • Several years of related IT engineering or operations experience in an enterprise-class environment

  • Excellent knowledge of linux core platform and infrastructure with Red Hat (RHEL)

  • Excellent history of enterprise-level troubleshooting

  • Excellent knowledge with install, configuration and support of a linux enterprise environment

  • Excellent knowledge of virtualization (VMware) and scripting (Ruby, Perl)

  • Good Knowledge in planing and building IT infrastructure for highly scaleable and high available systems

  • Good Knowledge of IT Infrastructure services (Infoblox, Puppet, Satelitte) is a plus

  • Good Knowledge in working with web servers (Apache)

  • Good Knowledge in working with application server (Tomcat/Weblogic/JBoss)

  • Knowdlege in working with databases like MySQL

  • Good communication skills, including creation of engineering documentation and presentations of varying technical levels

  • Fluent english written and spoken skills



What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events



Become part of our success story. Become part of a highly qualified team, united by a vision: to make payment happen.

For any questions please contact:

Mr. Benedikt Bossert
Human Resources Manager

benedikt.bossert@wirecard.com

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Digital Analytics Team
jobs.content:
The BlueLabs Digital Analytics team is a fast-paced, innovative, and agile group that is at the forefront of revolutionizing the ways that citizens use and learn about services. Our analytics support ranges from strategic analysis—such as identifying year-over-year trends in demand and availability—to operational support—such as measuring the effectiveness of specific outreach tactics. Our work focuses on individual targeted outreach efforts across email, SMS, phone, and mail, empowered by a culture of testing. These contacts have direct, measurable impact on the lives of millions of individuals. We work closely with internal government innovation groups, and build on the analytics methodology pioneered in e-commerce, advocacy, and retail.


AS PART OF THE DIGITAL ANALYTICS ENGINEERING TEAM AT BLUELABS, YOU’LL...




    • Make a difference. The digital analytics engineering team supplies the engine at the heart of our analytics operations. Your role will be first and foremost about enabling the BlueLabs team to succeed in its mandate to improve the lives of citizens.

    • Learn and adapt. As a member of the digital analytics engineering team, you will work in BlueLabs cutting-edge technology stack. You’ll be called on to wear several hats: frontend, backend, DevOps.

    • Design. We’re building a platform to support teams like our digital analytics team, and our engineers are the driving force behind it. You'll need to understand the problem and define it. Your own expertise and experience will help us design the solution we need.

    • Collaborate. Every project benefits from diverse viewpoints from the very beginning, and so you’ll work closely with analysts and data scientists and with our clients to develop the technology that empowers them to drive change.

    • Create. Ultimately, we’re looking for you not just to write code—but to create apps, systems, and solutions that are challenging and exciting.



AS AN ENGINEER ON OUR DIGITAL TEAM, YOU'LL...




    • Join a team of engineers with responsibility for the development, deployment, and support of BlueLabs technology in support of the government analytics team.

    • Architect and implement the data pipelines that power the day-to-day work of our analysts and clients.

    • Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment, with a focus on owning small-to-medium features.

    • Engage in pairing, design review, and code review to improve our code and systems.

    • Contribute to engineering team’s mission to improve continuously, by leading and participating in planning sessions, code reviews, and best practices discussions.

jobs.title: UX Designer
jobs.content:
User Experience Designer – Innovative Cyber Security Company

We are looking for a versatile User Experience Designer with great visual and interaction design chops who can’t imagine doing only one or the other, and who’s charged up by working on complex UX challenges. We need someone to help in devising visual vocabularies, data visualizations, and interaction workflows, to support the detection, prevention and remediation of security risks. You’ll join several senior designers who share your passion for bringing great UX to the enterprise space. You’ll work cross-functionally with product management and engineering, and have frequent opportunity to obtain feedback directly from people who work in the dynamically evolving software security field.

Our small UX team is a startup within a startup: we move fast, learn faster, collaborate enthusiastically and lay track on processes as we go. We’ve got great support from both product management and software engineering, and executive sponsorship. Our colleagues are smart, open, and ready to work with us on taking our users’ experience to the next level.

Responsibilities:
• Refine user scenarios and user stories in concert with product management.
• Facilitate cross-functional design jams to explore user and business goals.
• Explore design possibilities with quick sketches.
• Create polished mockups and schemas to communicate detailed visual designs.
• Refine designs with wireframes and build basic prototypes when needed.
• Present design alternatives with confidence, and absorb feedback with grace.
• Validate product specifics with users.
• Make solid prioritizations for your work to meet project objectives.

Requirements:
• 3-5 years’ experience working on UX for complex web applications (not just web sites).
• Commitment to working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
• Excellence in visual design and data visualizations.
• Proficiency in interaction design and information architecture.
• Capability in articulating design rationales and facilitating productive discussions.
• Skill both in blank-slate initiatives, and in projects for established products.
• Ability to break down goals and objectives into a reliable work plan.
• Independent initiative within shared team goals.

Bonus Point:
• Experience in at least one project in the security technology space is a huge bonus.
• In lieu of a cover letter, please include a portfolio/link and answer the following:
• Why would you be interested in a role like the above?


About us: Cyber-attacks are now the new normal. Advanced hackers, nation states, organized crime groups and nefarious actors are doing anything and everything they can to get their hands on valuable information that isn’t theirs. With more than enough attack vectors out there, we at Carbon Black are looking for more creative and committed security professionals to protect today’s top organizations.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We offer an exciting and fast-paced working environment and challenging responsibilities. Working in an Agile environment with three week iterations you will work in an open, collaborative atmosphere. We welcome suggestions and within our flat management structure your ideas become part of the discussion; giving you the opportunity to make a difference immediately.



Our web developers are responsible for participating in application design, development, testing, validation, maintenance, and enhancement projects and should possess specialized technical knowledge covering API, functionality, user experience and document control converting clients conceptual requirements into solutions using appropriate and applicable SharePoint application development.


There is a high level of collaboration between project team members and with other stakeholders. To this end we operate in an open space environment where ideas as well as challenges can be shared to ensure we get to the best solution possible for our clients.



Our developers translate requirements into an appropriate design, formulate and define application scope and objectives, and implement complete solutions.  Our products are developed to comply with architectural and usability standards and established methodologies and practices.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer for a Healthcare Company
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work here? Do you crave building experiences and systems that delight users internally and externally? Do you love to continually learn, grow, and work with others who share your passion? Do you want to innovate and make the world a healthier place?


If you answered yes, Premise Health is a leading provider of employer-dedicated onsite health centers that are designed to provide more meaningful, effective and higher quality health care to employees and their dependents. They control and reduce health care costs for corporations, measurably improve worker productivity, and provide an employment benefit that far surpasses the level of service that is found in the community. The result — healthier employees and a healthier world.


We’re creating something truly wonderful and are looking to engage software engineers who can create remarkable experiences that motivate, inspire, and delight our patients in meaningful ways anywhere anytime. We are a company whose culture is focused on finding creative ways to enhance the lives of all of those we come into contact driving care innovation along the way. If you want to grow, build, and lead in a company that shares these values, then we would love to hear from you.


Essential Functions:


Senior Developer is responsible for the design, construction, integration, and implementation of applications software in an exciting, innovative, dynamic environment that supports corporate strategies and objectives. This is considered an experienced development position that requires cultural fit, technical skills, and expertise commensurate with a high quality, innovative team focused on building stellar experiences for our users. This role will be responsible for the following items in addition to other duties as assigned.



  • Provide input and direction to solutions fulfilling product ownership and client requirements.

  • Identify and implement technical and procedural solutions in alignment with operating objectives.

  • Conduct code reviews, and mentor junior teammates in best practices, patterns, and new industry developments.

  • Perform complex programming assignments requiring an advanced aptitude of established programming standards, methods, and best practices.

  • Design, Build, Maintain and Modify service, web, and mobile applications

  • Provide support for critical application problems and issues.

  • Aid and lead in the experience design process.


If you want to join a team of knowledgeable, compassionate, like-minded healthcare professionals, join Premise Health for an unlimited opportunity with the company that is changing the face and the place of the healthcare industry as we know it.


We are an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
If you enjoy being a part of the entire software development lifecycle; from design to deployment, ensuring the highest code quality and performance at every step, then you’ll love what we have here at Klarna.


We're growing our test engineering teams here at Klarna; building test automation infrastructure to increase test coverage and improve code quality across our entire engineering organisation.


Some of the stuff you’ll do;



  • Build test automation frameworks that enable development teams to deliver high quality software at speed.

  • Improve the quality and health of Klarna's systems by providing information on how their services are perceived from the outside (using both blackbox and whitebox testing).

  • Devise testing strategies for new business features.

  • Advise development teams on software design choices.

  • Act as a technical ambassador for quality throughout the entire engineering organisation.


Realistically, you’ll need experience building test automation tools and frameworks, as well as a strong coding ability; While we mainly use Ruby, we're searching for problem solvers that are confident working with different technologies and willing to learn new skills. You’ll need to know about contract-driven testing, context-driven testing, agile methodologies (pairing, TDD, BDD) and continuous delivery practices.


You'll work in our knowledge sharing culture, receive a generous occupational pension, 30 days paid annual leave, subsidised gym membership and a range of discounts on everything from electrical goods to flights and hotels.


Interested in finding out more?


Send over your CV and let's arrange a chat.

About us


Here at Klarna we’re simplifying buying - We do this by letting the consumer buy online without signing up for anything, they pay after receiving the goods; we assume the credit and fraud risks for the merchants.


We have more than 1200 employees and we’re active in 18 countries. We serve 35 million consumers and work with 50,000 merchants, processing over 400,000 transactions every day.

jobs.title: Senior User Experience Design Lead
jobs.content:
Description:
The Print Experience and Design team is looking for a passionate Designer to lead the design of next generation solutions that will define how people will work in an enterprise environment. Come build the future. You must be able to thrive within a fast paced global design team and help us solve complex business challenges with innovative and simple design solutions that excite the mind and heart of users. You’ll be responsible for gaining user insights and leveraging them with multi-discipline teams to take projects from concept to completion.

Responsibilities:
• Create best-in-class user experience and interaction for the enterprise print ecosystem of products, services and solutions.
• Identify customer needs, design new product features, and deliver an intuitive and attractive product experience.
• Be able to balance being a representative of the end users’ points of view while understanding the unique needs of enterprise environments.
• Work on projects across multiple platforms including mobile, tablet, PC, web, and embedded devices.
• Produce end-to-end user journeys, specifications and prototypes to clearly communicate concept pitches and final design.
• Clearly communicate concepts and design rational to the multidiscipline project team and stakeholders.
• Lead user experience design for specific projects.
• Plan and conduct user research, usability evaluations and usability tests.
• Revise designs based on design reviews, usability testing, A/B testing, customer support feedback, and partner input.
• Brainstorm innovative ideas.
• Mentor junior staff.

Qualifications:
• A portfolio showcasing original, innovative and inspiring work that solves complex design challenges.
• An excellent understanding of digital product design process, methodologies and tools.
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
• Ability to effectively communicate interactive and interface design data, design proposals and product specifications and negotiate options at senior management levels.
• Passion for creating compelling designs that are meaningful, engaging, functional and easy to use.
• Ability to think holistically and design beyond the screen.
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
• Experience delivering designs that meet business and technical requirements without compromising the quality of the end user’s experience.
• Experience assimilating customer feedback received through user research, user feedback, user testing, etc.
• Be self-motivated and entrepreneurial with the ability to work efficiently and meet deadlines.
• Excel at collaborating with a multi-discipline team that includes designers, developers and marketing.
• Have a minimum of 6-10 years of relevant design experience.
• Have a formal degree in Interaction Design, HCI, Product Design, Industrial Design or a related discipline.
• Be an expert in your digital tools of choice, such as Adobe Creative Suite, to document and bring your compelling vision to life.
• An understanding of HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and mobile platform capabilities from a design perspective.
• Experience with both creative agency and in-house design studio is a plus.

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Deployment Engineering
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

Responsible for planning and designing internal communications network. Plays an important role in the testing and certifying of new hardware,

configurations, and services prior to deployment to the Company Network. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.



Core Responsibilities:



- Manage the procurement, deployment, and tracking of all network elements across the Comcast Regional and National TCP/IP network.



- Directs the day-to-day coordination and technical project management of network equipment including change control, resolution of stake holder issues, schedules and timelines to ensure equipment implementation is on track for overall project success.



- Assists in the risk assessment, quality, budgeting, and scope management of deployment technical project plans.



- Manage vendor relationships by providing recommendations for contractual agreements on technical services and installation support.



- Manage facility As Built drawings, cabling running lists, floor designs and records of deployed equipment.



- Accountable for evaluating Engineering Design requirements and documents for nationwide facilities and ensuring that a sound architectural design is achieved.



- Administers vendor relationship communicating the latest industry standards, pricing structures, purchase orders and delivery timelines.



- Acts as the lead interface for internal and field organizations in the deployment of network gear during the design, installation, and configuration phase.



- Responsible for the inventory management of Comcast Regional Area Network, CMTS and related project network elements.



- Responsible for the timely distribution of facility requirements to Field Engineering staff including power, HVAC, space planning and supporting documentation.



- Continued focus on streamlining Methods and Procedure for equipment deployment and implementation.



- Works with limited amount of supervision for job duties and high performance.



- Some travel required.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience



- Three plus years of experience in deployment and installation of switches, routers and servers or related equipment.



- Three plus years of experience in High Speed Data, Voice, IP and Data Networking.



- Diverse background and working knowledge of HVAC, power, and cabling terminology.



- Advanced Technical Project Management skills.



- Advanced Microsoft Office or equivalent computer skills.



- Basic knowledge of all current types of networking and server hardware.



- Proven analytical, problem solving and organizational abilities.



- Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to work with vendors, employees and management.



- Develop and maintain excellent team skills including proactive, customer service oriented working relationships with all appropriate levels within and outside the company.



- Plan, organize, assign and prioritize multiple engineering support assignments and projects as directed by the manager of the group and/or other departmental officers.



- Ability and willingness to adapt and accept change with strong decision-making skills to complete project successfully.



- Personal qualities to include integrity, respect for others, personal responsibility, and a passion to approach all aspects of the job with enthusiasm.



- Solid technical skills relative to Voice and High Speed Internet network engineering, planning and management including experience with IP routers, switches and CMTS equipment.



- Strong understanding of AC/DC power configurations and HVAC related thermal architecture.



- HFC and 2-way RF outside plant engineering (i.e. RF modulation schemes).



- Strong proven background in reviewing and implementing Engineering Design guidelines and requirements.



- Good technical understanding of the IP protocol suite (e.g. ARP, IP, TCP, DNS, SNMP).



- Strong abilities with using Microsoft Office.



- Self motivated team player.



- Excellent written and oral communication skills.
