jobs.title: Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
SENIOR NETWORK ENGINEER


Fastly is seeking best-in-class Senior Network Engineers who can help us scale and operate one of the fastest growing networks in the world. Ideal candidates have experience with high-density, multi-vendor data center deployments, and are excited by the opportunity to build and operate a complex software-defined network. Members of Fastly's Network Engineering team must possess the ability to autonomously define and complete complex projects, automate routine tasks, manage around failure, and work across many teams for larger initiatives.

jobs.title: System Administrator and IT Professional
jobs.content:
We are looking for an IT professional with a diverse set of skills and the ability to respond and adapt to unique requirements. We offer a flexible and supportive work environment with the opportunity to continuously learn and develop as you provide creative technical solutions in support of our engineers and projects.


Kyrus is a small company that works with the big picture in mind, taking on projects with real significance that grow our capacity to tackle even more fascinating development problems.  We've earned a reputation for efficiency, effectiveness, and impact since our founding in 2009.


Communication is paramount in this position, and we are interested in hiring an effective team member who will actively engage with our administrative and engineering teams and work closely with our Director of IT to design and implement systems and solutions.


Responsibilities


System and network administrator in support of engineers, software developers, and administrative staff.


Participate in the design, setup, and maintenance of project-specific IT systems and solutions.


Work as a site lead and team member. Ideal candidates will be comfortable working with a  diverse set of hardware, software, and networking environments. Essential skills include administration and maintenance of VMware ESXi servers, Linux servers, Windows Servers, Active Directory, networking, and Windows, Linux, and OSX client and development systems.


Advantages of Working at Kyrus


The opportunity to work with a small team of highly-skilled individuals dedicated to solving real-world problems.


A small company with a focus on personal productivity and potential, Kyrus respects employees and trusts them to do their jobs. Kyrus provides: flexible hours, work from home when appropriate, flexible vacation and leave, personal training and business travel budgets.


Benefits


Fully paid medical and dental benefits;


Health Savings Account;


Flex savings account (FSA) for health and dependent care;


401k;


Annual training and conference budget;


Life , short-term and long-term disability insurance;


Cell phone and home internet expense reimbursement;


Unlimited paid vacation;


Flexible work schedule;


Ability to work from home when applicable;


Fitness budget.


Additional Requirements


Due to the nature of our work, applicants are required to be a US citizen with an active security clearance, or have no significant impediments to acquiring a security clearance.


Due to the nature of this position, applicants must be able to perform heavy lifting: up to 50 pounds. Must be willing and able to perform physical activities including bending, stooping, pushing, standing and kneeling for long periods of time.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a software engineer to join our growing team at Starburst Labs. In this role, you will work closely with our engineering and customer support teams to quickly iterate on customer feedback.


A typical day might include adding an enhancement which saves a customer hours of time per week, debugging application errors, fixing user experience issues, or discussing feature requests.


Responsibilities



  • Write clear, maintainable, tested code

  • Solve complex customer support tickets for web, desktop, and mobile application issues

  • Communicate technical information to the engineering and support team

  • Identify bugs and improve the codebase of the applications you are supporting


Requirements & Skills



  • One or more years of full-stack Ruby-on-Rails or Python development

  • Knowledge of distributed version control systems like Git

  • Appreciation of UX and usability

  • Understanding of relational databases

  • Ability to communicate clearly and positively

  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers

jobs.title: IT Program Manager  Digital Collaboration
jobs.content:
BCG's Digital Products & Services IT is a critical element of the IT function. It strives to enable digital transformation of how BCG employees work together as well as interact with clients.   It is a global community of collaborative professionals with an immutable commitment to excellence.


POSITION SUMMARY:


The Communication and Collaboration IT team is looking for an experienced Program Manager to join the team to lead programs driving how BCG digitally collaborates both internally as well as with our customers.



The Program Manager will lead a highly cross-functional effort focused on envisioning, designing and delivering a Digital Workspace for BCG employees.


The ideal candidate will have experience in digital workplace initiatives and how these initiatives can drive employee engagement and transform business processes. This role is focused on understanding the specific business problems in order to develop the business and solution architecture to address those problems, together with the Communication and Collaboration Solutions Architect.



The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.



BASIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Program manage cross-functional initiatives within IT.   This role will work with the key stakeholders to ensure proper resourcing, planning, quality and execution in order to deliver large scale, multi-project solutions throughout the entire development lifecycle from inception to operation. Initially that will include managing the following initiatives


    • Digital Workspace for Business Support Team

    • Accelerated Collaboration Experience


  • Work closely with IT Directors, function leaders and managers to help coordinate cross-team efforts and resources to deliver cross-functional capabilities and solutions


    • Effectively use program management and estimation skills to provide predictable results and actively manage risk



    • Define and justify additional resources to accelerate intiatives



    • Manage interdepartmental dependencies

    • Develop work plans and monitor project activities

    • Be accountable for quality assurance

    • Be accountable for implementing effective change

    • Manage operational handover and documentation of delivered solutions to Operations teams for effective long-term customer support


  • Serve as a core member of DPS Communication and Collaboration team, driving the BCG Digital Collaboration journey.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for experienced senior software support engineer to join our growing team and expand both our current products and launch new ones this year. Our next team members love to architect, build, ship, and maintain web and mobile apps and have a passion for UX.


Starburst Labs are the makers of Wealthbox, a web-and-mobile CRM app for financial professionals, and Wealthbase, an inbound marketing network for consumers to connect with financial advisors, launching later this year. We’re also launching InvestorSay, a new community app for investors in early 2016.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence
jobs.content:
When the world throws technology challenges at us, we eat them up. And then we ask for more. Welcome to life on the TMP technology team. Here, you’ll work on our scalable, evolving platform, face tremendous software challenges, and work on projects for Fortune 100 clients. You'll be part of a fiercely collaborative technology team charged with creating digital solutions that are transforming the way employers and job seekers connect. That means contributing to high-traffic websites for a broad range of high-profile companies. Developing next-generation applications and products for some of the most recognized brands in the world. And actively supporting our diverse suite of best-in-class technologies. All this in an environment that constantly challenges you to push beyond boundaries and enhance your expertise—with the support of a global team of industry experts. Sound like a fit for your talent and passion? Read on.


The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer’s role is to design and implement BI software and systems. This includes requirements gathering, analysis, planning, selection, blueprinting, designing, developing, rolling out, and end-user training of BI solutions to the user community. The Business Intelligence Developer is also responsible for timely data availability and system up-time through support functions and in-depth testing.


Responsibilities:



  • Gathers requirements, analyzes, creates design documents, and performs impact analysis.

  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.

  • Continuously evaluate industry trends for opportunities to utilize new technologies and data sources for BI improvement and prepare strategies to implement these enhancements in the BI environment.

  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.

  •  Develops Extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) processes to acquire and load data from internal and external sources.

  • Develop, enhance and maintain the metadata layers, reports, report definitions and dashboards.

  • Produce guidelines and standards for ETL usage, manageability and maintainability within the organization.

  • Build database models, dashboards, reports, interfaces for BI packages.

  • Assist users with problems and resolves issues independently.

  • Creates test plans, test cases, test scripts and performs testing of the BI and related environments.

  • Promote BI benefits to the organization and usage of our tools to relevant business groups.

  • Plan and organize tasks, reports progress to manager.


To learn more about TMP Software Development and what we are working on- check out these links:


https://www.tmp.com/tmp-technology-jobs


Stack Overflow page: https://careers.stackoverflow.com/company/tmp-worldwide

jobs.title: Product Manager, Digital Ads
jobs.content:
At Stack Overflow, we are obsessed with serving developers. Whether we’re helping developers get answers to their questions or find a new job, we build products that make millions of developers' lives better every day.  As an Ads Product Manager, you’ll work with our passionate Developer, Design, Marketing, and Ad Sales teams, bridging the gap between the technical and business worlds.  Ads are an important part of our business at Stack Overflow.  Ads initiatives, like any other feature we build, need to be additive to the developers overall experience.  In the past we’ve run contests and developer surveys through our ad platform, but as one off projects.  We want you to productize these kinds of initiatives and come up with new ones to help grow our business and offer new compelling experiences for our community.


You’ll have the opportunity to do a lot at Stack Overflow, and you can expect during the first year:



  • First Month: Get onboarded and brought up to speed on our current roadmap and past experiments.  You’ll spend most of your time learning about our products and customers, and building a rapport with the product, ad sales, design, and marketing teams, as well as starting to sketch out your initial plans.



  • Next 3 Months: Start piecing together the roadmap.  Our Director of Ad Sales will want to introduce you to key customers, you’ll spend time talking to developers in the Stack Overflow community, and you’ll begin implementation of your high priority projects.



  • Next 6 months: You can expect to be be the primary owner of new ad initiatives.  You’ll be involved not just in product development, but in the ongoing relationship with paying customers and the community, and in improving our internal development processes.  


We like to work in public.  Not only does that mean being open with the company about what your team is building, but also bringing in the community as soon as we’re able.  Some examples of big projects/discussions we’ve had with the community recently:



  • We’re standardizing the sidebar width at 300px on all sites

  • Why Stack Overflow Doesn’t Care About Ad Blockers

  • Documentation

  • Developer Story


Skills and Requirements


What you’ll do:



  • Conduct market research to determine needs of clients while balancing the company’s requirements of a positive user experience

  • Create a product roadmap to support Ad Sales goals and strategies

  • Help make build/buy decisions concerning the development of new products, features, and enhancements

  • Define and monitor metrics to determine the effectiveness of new features, and administer split tests to learn whether a change is an improvement

  • Partner with the Director of Ad Sales when building your roadmap, product positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategies

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering Team.  We are a highly motivated, innovative, broad-minded and flexible team that enjoys taking on hard problems of all types.  We seek fast, flexible learners that want to apply their knowledge and experience to complex problems.  You should be adaptable and creative in the face of a highly competitive and changing social networking analysis landscape, and enthusiastic about seeking truth in the face of huge amounts of data.


We are particularly seeking engineers of diverse backgrounds, experience in fields outside of pure software development being valuable to help bring differing perspectives to the table when it comes to solving problems.


We want passionate engineers, those who feel a great deal of pride and ownership in the work that they produce.  We feel that care in testing, documentation and logging and analysis go part and parcel with the development of a complete project.


We want excellent communicators, as our engineers work closely with our product development and design teams to determine the best ways to share our data and analysis with our customers.

jobs.title: Enterprise Java Developer
jobs.content:
The (Enterprise) Java developer uses technical expertise and advanced business skills to design and develop and implement solutions for difficult business problems.  The Systems Consultant is an expert in a functional alignment of technology within a business line, functional operation or technology.  The incumbent understands and communicates how technology impacts the business.  The Systems Consultant identifies, develops, and implements technologies and practices that have value for the business.  The Systems Consultant works within project teams to develop solutions that drive the success of the business.  The Systems Consultant acts as a subject matter expert in one or more areas of technology.  Knowledge and expertise may be in one technology or environment.  The Systems Consultant acts independently or as a member of a project team responsible for providing technical and business process guidance concerning the business implications of one or more applications.  The position provides technical consulting in area of expertise and mentors Sr. Programmers and Programmers within the business channel or technology supported.

Demonstrates technical competency in specific tools and technologies as determined by the strategic direction of Technology, specifically in the development of distributed services and applications using JEE, WebSphere and RAD.  Possesses solid understanding and application of the connection between the business being supported and its technology strategy and systems. An expert in a functional alignment of technology within a business line, functional operation or technology. Independently interacts regularly with associates of various levels to interpret business needs and issues in order to design and / or evaluate technical solutions that solve the most complex technical and/or business issues for financial applications.Performs necessary investigation, analysis and evaluation to determine feasibility for the business.  Develops cost and benefit estimates to establish worth of program to enterprise.  This includes the development of alternative considerations leading to recommendations for new systems or equipment installations or change to existing ones.  Develops, implements, and integrates major financial business systems.  Provides technical guidance to Technology Managers.

Acts as primary consultant on multiple Enterprise Java (JEE) projects concurrently primarily in the financial services.  Maintains high level of technical expertise in one or more applications.  Advises appropriate people on the implications of existing Technology systems that can be applied to a problem.  Uses appreciable originality on system assignments.  Develops and/or evaluates previously refined data and select from a range of alternatives to determine the appropriate action to be taken.  Develops or assists in the development of work plans, task sequencing, and the extent to which tasks may be performed concurrently.  Develops time schedules, conversion, and test procedures for all aspects organization development.  Recommends technical approaches needed for solution of the problem.  Modifies systems designs to take maximum advantage of expertise.

Demonstrates advanced oral and written communication skills and mastery of all aspects of the System Development Methodology (SDM) to make technical and non-technical material understandable to technical and business units.  Evaluates project documentation including formal proposals, feasibility studies, schedules, requirements studies, design documents, use cases, system test cases and testing plans according to standard system development lifecycle methodologies.  Makes frequent presentations to client(s) and Technology management and associates.  Plans and conducts meetings including: application development sessions, fit-gap analysis sessions, design reviews, documentation review meetings, etc. 

May lead small to medium projects of short duration, or portions of large projects related to specific deliverables or segment of the SDM.  This may include project definition and investigation; coordination of vendor selection and RFP processes; requirements gathering; development; testing; and configuration.  Mentors developers and business analysts in Department/Team including: training on all facets of the SDM; technical design; and review of project deliverables delivered by developers and analysts.

jobs.title: Software Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Software Quality Engineer


A Senior Software Quality Engineer at Confluence is responsible for participating on our agile teams as a test engineer. Your focus is to assure the entire team adopts a quality mindset and implements best practices to improve team performance in order to deliver high quality products as a result. This person will be involved with the entire product lifecycle – requirements, design, review and coding, and testing.  You’ll work closely with project managers, software engineers, product owners, architects and client services to collaborate and solve business problems in an agile development environment.


What you will do here?



  • Help shape our products by providing input on user stories and designs and by giving feedback on usability.

  • Implement automated and manual test cases with a focus on validating complex calculations, functional scenarios, performance, scalability, and usability

  • Work on a cross-functional Scrum team participating in planning, stand-ups, retrospectives and demos.

  • Develop and execute test plans and work with other team members to implement the plan

  • Possess the ability to define and apply test methodologies/metrics to ensure that the quality guidelines for the product have been met

  • Seek constant improvement of yourself, our products, our software development process, and your team’s performance.

  • Mentor Software Engineers and QA Engineers on quality software practices. 


What technical skills do you need?



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and/or related discipline

  • A minimum of 6 or more years professional experience in software development and/or automated testing

  • Experience with Java, C++, or C# is preferred. Experience with XML, JavaScript is a plus.

  • Relational database experience is preferred

  • Proven automation skills using a test automation tool (Selenium or Test Complete would be a plus).

  • Experience with Visual Studio’s Web Performance and Load Test or a related performance testing tool is preferred.

  • Experience with Scrum or another Agile methodology is required

  • Exceptional communication, leadership, organizational and teamwork skills with strong desire and ability to deliver results

  • Experience with Microsoft Azure or other cloud hosting solutions


We are looking for someone with a strong willingness to learn continuously and take ownership and accountability.  A successful team member will appreciate mentoring others and have a willingness to be mentored.  We require a sound decision maker that utilizes knowledge of business to drive decisions with a great sense of commitment in doing the job right the first time.


Potential remote employees must have experience working as a remote team member.  Success delivering high-quality software and collaborative teamwork while working from a home-office must be demonstrated.


Confluence’s company culture and values guide our decisions, whether it’s about product, brand or people.  So if you are an ambassador of Integrity, Imagination, Discipline and Service to others and have the skills and interest, we would love to hear from you.  To apply for this position, please send a cover letter with salary requirements along with your resume to https://confluence.applytojob.com.


Confluence is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: High-scale Software Engineering in Go
jobs.content: This job is a fun, high-scale use of Go on Google Cloud Platform for a fast-growing (and well-funded) startup. If you secretly thought that you loved computer science more than everybody else in your classes and wrote code for fun outside of class, then we'd love to talk to you. And you'd probably enjoy working with our engineering team. We combine serious computer science with a scrappy, self-directed engineering culture that will give you plenty of opportunities to demonstrate valor and achieve glory.

jobs.title: PHP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
DomainTools is seeking a junior level PHP Software Engineer to join our team. This position is perfect for someone who loves the challenge of designing and building products for big data. At DomainTools we process and display information about relationships between hundreds of millions of domains, IP addresses, and domain ownership records. As a PHP Software Engineer, you will help develop and improve products that encourage user discovery and experimentation with our large data sets. This is a full-time permanent position in our offices in Seattle (Belltown).


At DomainTools, you will work as part of a small but highly productive team of smart and engaged engineers. Expect to spend much of your time solving complex technical problems around delivering large-scale data and analysis to security researchers. You will work in an environment where productivity is fostered. You will spend very little time in meetings, and you won't be distracted by processes that get in the way of high-quality results.


Perks



  • Work with big data and machine learning that matters. We're not just trying to sell more ads or widgets, we're helping organizations improve their security and protect against cyber attacks and domain hijacking.

  • Whatever hardware and software you need to do your job. Multiple 30 inch monitors - no problem, fully loaded MacBook Pros - no problem. Access to more processing machines than you can shake a stick at - no problem.

  • Free lunches brought in twice a week plus a kitchen stocked with plenty of snacks and beverages.

  • An incredible Italian espresso machine.

  • A cool, open layout workplace that is blocks from Westlake and Whole Foods.

  • A ping pong table (matches held every day during lunch time) and a media/game room.

  • And for the last few years we've taken a paid company ski vacation to Whistler, BC!

jobs.title: Software Engineer Full Stack
jobs.content:
Looking for a Software Engineer to work on an interactive teaching/learning website for children. This would be a contract/freelance job with potential for long term down the line. Front end almost all done, mostly back end that needs to be built.


Back end will include: Admin management, Customer management, Direct subscription enhancement, Customer email export, Gift vouchers, Gift voucher integration into account creation, Gift voucher integration into billing.

jobs.title: Software Engineer: Full Stack
jobs.content:
Looking for a Software Engineer to work on an interactive teaching/learning website for children. This would be a contract/freelance job with potential for long term down the line. Front end almost all done, mostly back end that needs to be built. (USA based only.)


Back end will include: Admin management, Customer management, Direct subscription enhancement, Customer email export, Gift vouchers, Gift voucher integration into account creation, Gift voucher integration into billing.

jobs.title: Digital Campaign Optimisation
jobs.content:
We're looking for highly motivated, efficient and data-driven campaign managers with a minimum of 18 months experience running direct response campaigns on Adwords, Facebook (paid campaigns) or any other programmatic platform. 

We work with some very exciting companies (a handful of which we've even helped launch) with whom we like to integrate ourselves as much as possible, offering a very high level of service and acting (albeit remotely) as extensions of their teams.  This is an opportunity to get some excellent experience working for some great companies, alongside some very talented and driven people - all from the comfort of your home/the beach/local coffee shop.

There are currently 6 of us running campaigns remotely (UK, Italy and Spain) for a range of start-ups and SMEs from around the world and we're looking to add to the team. We tend to work on GMT/CET time so as long as you're happy to work during those sorts of hours then we don't mind where you're based!

 

Extra tags: marketing, digital, optimisation, analyst,

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer, Amazon Flex Android App
jobs.content:
Amazon Flex is a new program at Amazon that supports Prime Now in offering one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers.



Our transportation technology group is responsible for designing and implementing software that makes the delivery of these items possible in one hour or less. Our software has to take into account item, delivery associate, network and environmental constraints to provide a fast delivery experience for our end consumers.



The Amazon Flex Mobile team is looking for Android engineers to help build the next generation of Last Mile delivery experience for our delivery associates. We operate globally to support many region specific use cases and challenges such as varying network connectivity, including no connectivity (offline), performance and latency, varying devices, business complexity, Geo-fencing, real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing and optimizations and many others.



If you're passionate about Android development, want to build one of the most innovative, high performance mobile applications, this team is for you. We are just getting started, are very much in that start-up (It's Day 1) mode! This is your opportunity to get in early on a brand new product and influence the future of where it goes!

Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications.

5+ years of software development experience with the following technologies:

o Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK

o Expert knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

o Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

o Experience writing multi-threaded apps

o Expert knowledge of Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

o Experience with the application submission/provisioning process

o Expert level debugging and analysis skills using ADB



Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control

Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change



Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.



Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.



Experience with databases.



Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop



Experience with protocol buffers



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer - F/M/V/D

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer



Opportunity


Autodesk is the world leader in design software with over $2B in revenue and customers in every industry you can think of.   As a global leader in 3D design, engineering and entertainment software, Autodesk helps people imagine, design, and create a better world.  Autodesk accelerates better design through an unparalleled depth of experience and a broad portfolio of software to give customers the power to solve their design, business and environmental challenges.



Candidate



  • You are a talented Software Engineer who is passionate about code quality, usability, and technology

  • You excel at working with multidisciplinary teams to deliver great user experiences

  • You are a power web user keeping yourself up-to-date with the latest trends and breakthroughs in web development technology

  • You have a strong record of project execution and completion and have experience with Scrum and agile development practices

  • You love working with smart people and want to be part of a team

  • You are excited by the challenge of pushing the limits of the web platform to deliver disruptive, innovative solutions to the world that will delight your customers



Responsibilities



  • Contribute to the design and development of new web applications and features

  • Maintain and improve existing web applications

  • Profile and optimize the code to get the best possible performance across browsers and operating systems

  • Work closely with designers and other developers in a tightly knit, agile team

  • Demonstrate a dedication to code quality

  • Managed code with unit tests and GitHub

  • Keep your ear to the ground and help us incorporate industry best practices and important developments into our products




Qualifications



  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

  • 5+ years of professional experience

  • 5+ years of experience with web application technologies such as Java, java script, HTML, CSS, Node js, Angular Js,

  • 2+ year Experience with using cloud platforms such as AWS, Heroku

  • Intermediate knowledge of MySQL or PostgreSQL

  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming, the MVC paradigm, and Service-Oriented Design

  • Experience and interested in Frontend Development

  • Experience with third-party APIs and Web Services

  • Working knowledge of the general web application landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

  • Experience with Agile development, preferably Scrum

  • Experience with Perforce deployment and code management

  • Experience with Jenkins for Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment



Success Factors



  • Demonstrated commitment to high quality user facing and back end code that is usable, maintainable and well thought out

  • Ability to work both collaboratively and independently

  • Self-directed learner who has quickly learned new programming languages

  • Open to modification of the work we do, based on customer feedback and other data we acquire

  • Self motivated

  • Get Stuff Done

jobs.title: Senior Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Development Manager, Full Stack Web Development



Autodesk is seeking a highly motivated, experience development manager to join our Autodesk Accounts (Portal Services) platform team.



As an ideal candidate, you’ve managed UI and Server Side development teams developing modern web applications and have demonstrated hands on experience with interactive web applications.  You should have strong knowledge in the current web technologies and are in tune with the industry trends.  You are comfortable in an agile environment and know how to build and guide a highly effective and high performing team. Most of all, you can inspire a team to do great things.  As the ideal candidate:




  • You understand what it takes to develop and deliver highly scalable and highly performant web applications

  • You know how to motivate and inspire your teams to be as effective as possible

  • You can spot and attract amazing talent

  • You have a passion for being a mentor and a teacher

  • You are a leader with vision

  • You have a sense of humor and don’t take yourself too seriously

  • You take risks and can make quick decisions

  • You can maneuver sometimes vague requirements

  • You have a passion for devops, continuous integration and continuous delivery

  • You know how to execute and have demonstrated the ability to incrementally delivery on your team’s vision.



Responsibilities




  • Manage a cross functional team of developers and business systems analysts responsible for delivering features and functionality in Autodesk Accounts

  • Work with your team to help understand requirements, evaluate new features, new architecture and help drive decisions

  • Build collaborative partnerships with software architects, technical leads and key individuals within other functional organizations.

  • Build and foster a high performance culture, mentor team members and provide your team with the tools and motivation to make things happen



Requirements




  • Proven ability to manage and resolve complex and ambiguous issues

  • Experience with key technologies and tools such as Java, Javascript (angular, node), Bootstrap, Ruby, AWS, Jasmine, jQuery

  • Experience with Scrum and agile development processes and methodologies

  • Excellent communication and written skills

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field

  • 5+ years experience

jobs.title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content: Shopify's platform is expanding at an incredible rate. Along the way, it generates vast swaths of information, which if understood correctly, can lead to far better decisions, and a more successful company. Hadoop powers these critical insights for all levels of decision makers at and building on top of Shopify, and these insights need to be delivered reliably. This is why we're looking to add an experienced Data Infrastructure Engineer to our data engineering team. Please note that all members of the Data Engineering team participate in a 24/7 on call rotation.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HealthMEDX is looking for talented, passionate Senior Software Engineers who can come help us build and maintain a leading-edge healthcare software suite. Our Engineers build software that creates a better quality of life for thousands of post-acute care patients. Occasionally, they help Senior Support Representatives when they get stuck on a client issue. Most importantly, they help us continue to set the bar in our industry. 


Under minimal supervision a HealthMEDX Senior Engineer develops, debugs, and tests code for a variety of complex processes in a web-based applications environment.  The Sr. Engineer uses ingenuity and creativity to meet complex challenges. The Sr. Engineer develops technical specifications and serves as technical expert in assigned product areas (Clinical, Census, Financial). They ensure adherence to standards and requirements. They improve knowledge of internal programming languages and tools, extended healthcare industry, and relationship with other software products.  The Sr. Engineer also recommends improvements to cross-functional processes and mentors/trains less experienced engineers.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for experienced developers to join our team. Need to learn Ruby? No problem. Training’s on us. Once you’re on board, you’ll jump into our three-week Ruby on Rails training program.


As a Developer at CoverMyMeds, you create solutions that make our healthcare system work more efficiently and effectively in order to help millions of patients receive their prescription medications every year.  You build products that our partners in healthcare use everyday, and innovate products that don't even exist yet.  You work on small teams with other really smart developers with endless opportunities to take on responsibility, continue learning and mentor others.


Our Tech Stack:


Ruby on Rails, Python, PHP, Backbone.js, SQL-Server, PostgreSQL, Git, Elasticsearch, Capistrano, Redis, Sidekiq, Vagrant, Puppet, Apache, RSpec, Capybara, Cucumber, Watir


 What You'll Do:



  • Design and develop web applications and APIs for the CoverMyMeds product line

  • Design and develop internal support software  for our own awesome coworkers

  • Help our world-class support team solve tough customer issues

  • Contribute to and improve revision control and deployment in our fast-paced, agile environment

jobs.title: Senior Rails Software Engineer, world class web based app
jobs.content:
Elastic Suite is looking for an experienced Rails software engineer to work on our custom order entry/digital catalog applications for our current and future clientele.  It’s in our DNA to continuously advance our platform and improve its features, speed, stability and usability.  Your primary role will be to meet those challenges, to architect and develop new capabilities for our server side application.  You will also be involved in onboarding new clients to the platform.


Our current application stack consists of Rails 4, MongoDB and Elasticsearch. This application provides web services for consumption by various client applications, communicating principally via RESTful services in the JSON format. A possible secondary role would be working on our complex single-page Javascript client.


We loosely follow a software as a service model, and you will have the opportunity to build web based applications for many of the action sports and outdoor industry’s major brands. We are always eager to explore developing technologies and processes. You will collaborate with developers of other specialties as well as our in-house design team, you will still have opportunities to execute projects yourself, from soup to nuts.

jobs.title: Laravel Back end Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Laravel developer to join our team full-time.  You must have extensive knowledge in Laravel/PHP and Javascript.  U.S. based developers only.

Coded Design is a rapidly growing startup firm that specializes in high-end enterprise and SaaS web applications.  

##### SKILLS WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
 * 4+ years commercial experience as a PHP Developer
 * 2+ years as a Laravel Developer
 * 2+ years of commercial Javascript experience
 * Strong knowledge of OOP principles
 * Excellent written and verbal communication
 * Experience with 3rd party integrations/APIs (Google/Facebook)
 * Intensive desire to build things that are awesome

##### WE WORK HEAVILY WITH:
 * Laravel
 * Javascript / Vue.js
 * DigitalOcean / AWS
 * Both SQL and NoSQL (Primarily MySQL, Redis & MongoDB)

###### You must have relevant and recent code samples to show us.

Extra tags: php, laravel, vuejs, javascript, back-end, full stack, senior developer, api, startup

jobs.title: Principal DevOps Engineers - lead role driving change in how we deliver products
jobs.content:
Role purpose:   


We are seeking multiple talented and self-motivated Principal Infrastructure / DevOps Engineers.   


You will be joining a new and fast-growing agile team to help design and build a global infrastructure for high volume, highly available and high performance web applications.  This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in changing the way that web products are delivered within the company, devising and implementing a modern approach to software engineering that enables continuous delivery and releasing features on-demand.  As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be as comfortable with strategic thinking as you are with rolling up your sleeves and scripting cloud infrastructure configuration or developing infrastructure in code.


Key Tasks:



  • Establish the right infrastructure architecture, balancing performance and resilience with cost

  • Advocate a DevOps approach to product development and demonstrate best practice by example

  • Automate provisioning, deployment, configuration management, monitoring and all other infrastructure and ops activities

  • Set up, configure and monitor all environments including production using cloud computing platforms and local resources

  • Monitor live services and respond quickly and effectively to any problems

  • Establish disaster recovery, service outage, and risk mitigation processes for the production environments.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Who You Are


You are a web development guru. You take pride in your work, writing clean, maintainable code. You also prioritize and build what’s necessary to accomplish the business objectives at hand. You roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to push the company forward. You have strong back-end skills, but are also comfortable with front-end work and can drive a feature from PSD to functional product.


You Have



  • A GitHub account (or portfolio) that rocks

  • Projects that you can point to that you personally (not your team) built

  • 2+ years of Ruby-on-Rails experience

  • 5-10 years of web development experience, ideally some of which is in a startup environment

  • An understanding of web analytics, A/B testing, and agile development methods

  • An outstanding academic background; CS degree preferred


What You'll Do Here


We're looking for a full stack engineer to help us build amazing products.  We've got a full slate of interesting projects and need an exceptional engineer to help us create innovative technology that will change real estate.  You'll be working on mission critical projects, both on our internal tools and on our customer facing products, and will be able to help shape our engineering culture as we grow.


You Want



  • Your work to matter - to be critically important to your team’s success

  • To work on a small team that gets sh*t done but also likes to have fun

  • To receive a competitive equity/comp package

  • To build cool technology that will transform an industry and forever change the way people buy and sell real estate

jobs.title: Full Stack - NodeJS + React
jobs.content:
So we're not Twitter. We get that. We're also not GreenPeace.  We get that as well.  What we are, though, is trying to do our part to better the industry that we know best: Online Video.  And if we do our jobs right then we will become greater then Twitter and (maybe) GreenPeace!


We're creating a break through platform using NodeJS + React that will transform how online video is traded and exchanged globally.  Everything from your favourite music videos to breaking news will be discovered, exchanged and reported on our platform.  


We're just at the beginning of our journey so we need the ground floor crew - people who lean into problems and have great initiative and talent.   People who take calculated risks and push boundaries.  And yes, you've heard this song and dance before, but this is the real deal.  If we can get this right then the sky is the limited.


The ideal you will be:



  • A rockstar in NodeJS and React;

  • Have envious experience in transaction based architecture;

  • Be able to work remotely and as part of a virtual team;

  • Bonus marks if you've worked with online video before (we have!)

jobs.title: Full Stack
jobs.content:
So we're not Twitter. We get that. We're also not GreenPeace.  We get that as well.  What we are, though, is trying to do our part to better the industry that we know best: Online Video.  And if we do our jobs right then we will become greater then Twitter and (maybe) GreenPeace!


We're creating a break through platform using NodeJS + React that will transform how online video is traded and exchanged globally.  Everything from your favourite music videos to breaking news will be discovered, exchanged and reported on our platform.  


We're just at the beginning of our journey so we need the ground floor crew - people who lean into problems and have great initiative and talent.   People who take calculated risks and push boundaries.  And yes, you've heard this song and dance before, but this is the real deal.  If we can get this right then the sky is the limited.

  • A rockstar in NodeJS and React;

  • Have envious experience in transaction based architecture;

  • Be able to work remotely and as part of a virtual team;

  • Have a brain, two feet, a heart beat and some interesting things to say about life;

jobs.title: QA Analyst
jobs.content: Want to expand your software quality assurance talents in a team environment that values your contribution and gives you the resources to get the job done, all while having true ownership in a growing company that's been leading real estate innovation for over 35 years? At FBS, the creator of real estate software Flexmls, it's all possible. We're 100% employee owned and looking for a passionate entry level QA Analyst to join our Quality Assurance team. You’ll be working with developers and other team members to make sure we are consistently delivering high quality software and will be deeply involved in the testing and launch of new features and products needed by our hundreds of thousands of real estate professionals and their customers.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are a small team of software engineers passionate about creating fast, lean, and robust Python code. We use Python 3, and broadly employ modern language features/libraries such as generators, decorators, functools, itertools, and collections. We leverage high-performance libraries like Pandas, numpy, and PyTables, and use Flask for microservices and (with Javascript) web UIs. While we do not write much C, we understand Python at the C level. We have spent some time in academia, so we prefer thoughtful, reasoned approaches. We tame large datasets filled with noise and irregularity, and develop reusable approaches to data pipelining, caching, and numerical processing. We habitually test everything we write, and practice continuous integration and continuous deployment. We develop on Linux and deploy, via Ansible and Supervisor, on a fleet of internally managed VMs. We take the time to find optimal designs, and invest in building powerful, general-purpose tools when needed. All of our tools are used in-house, so we benefit from having a small and collegial set of users.

We are the core development team in Investment Management at Research Affiliates, a global leader in innovative indexing and asset allocation strategies. We build the tools that construct hundreds of different portfolios; we create and maintain an expanding network of applications for processing portfolios and financial data, from back-end reporting to front-end comparison and analysis.

We are looking for software engineers who share our interests.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Priceline.com, the leading online destination for smart travelers, is seeking an intelligent, motivated full-time front end developer to join our growing team.  Our creative, flexible company culture merges the agility of a start-up with the stability of an established, international public company.

The ideal candidate is passionate about creating well-architected solutions; well-versed in the latest web technologies, such as SASS, node.js, AngularJS, and NoSQL; comfortable with distributed version control; and fluent in current best practices for responsive and accessible design. 

Our agile development process centers around A/B testing incremental changes and empowering our technologists to suggest best practices. We understand the dynamic nature of front-end technology, and we support our developers’ efforts to stay on the leading edge by attending meet-ups, going to conferences, and educating one another through code reviews and presentations. 

What You’ll Do:

You’ll be working in a small, tight-knit team, supporting our high-traffic Hotel, Airline, Rental Car and Vacation Package businesses, building applications that deliver real value to our customers.

You’ll be working closely with Product and Design team members on a modern technology stack grounded in node.js, with an MVC-based javascript framework (currently AngularJS) delivering data from our REST-based APIs. You will be optimizing our sites for cross-device performance, including mobile, desktop, tablets and phablets, with an emphasis on time to start render.

Your Skills Include:

* JavaScript

* At least one modern MVC-based JavaScript framework (Angular, Ember, Backbone, Knockout)

* node.js

* REST-ful API design; Spring framework a plus

* HTML5

* CSS (SASS/Compass a plus)

* Git

* A collaborative work ethic and the ability to work within a self-organized, cross functional team

* Familiarity with agile techniques

* Great communication skills

* Familiar with web server-side technologies, such as JSP, PHP, Ruby or Python

* Previous startup experience

* A degree in computer science or equivalent work experience

Required experience:

Associate Front End Engineer: 1-2 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Front End Engineer: 3-5 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Senior Front End Engineer: 5+ years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

jobs.title: Fullstack Javascript Node.js Engineer
jobs.content:
Want to be 100% remote, work on the most cutting edge technologies and get paid well?



We need full stack javascript / node.js engineers with these capabilities:




  • Has 4+ years production experience with JavaScript and Node.

  • Understands microservice architecture best practices.

  • Has worked with process managers and/or container orchestrators.

  • Is fluent in multiple SQL and NoSQL databases.

  • Knows how to write thorough, articulate documentation.

  • Practices testing in all areas: unit, e2e, load, regression, etc.

  • Evaluates new technologies/patterns/frameworks on the regular.

  • Have intimate knowledge of the event loop



Bonus points:




  • You've used Koa

  • You're familiar with Bluemix & CloudFoundry

  • You have recent experience working in a completely remote situation that we can reference if needed. We offer you complete 'physical' flexibility but your communication and ability to be completely engaged in daily standups and online presence in Slack is critical.

  • You've contributed to some great open source projects that we can see.



Dealer Market Exchange (http://dmx.io) is releasing a virtual market for pre-owned vehicles. We are a global team with engineers, product owners and designers in 10 different timezones around the globe.

jobs.title: Python Engineer in NYC
jobs.content: We're looking for an intelligent engineer who enjoys building software that matters, simple and robust systems, someone who first write code for her/his peers, then test suites, then for the computer. In the perfect world, you're a UNIX philosopher and Pythonista, fluent in SQL (we love PostgreSQL) and you've abused AWS APIs for few years. We're very team-centric and while you'll have the opportunity to work on your own, you should have good communication skills.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Neverware is seeking a Software Engineer to help us continue to create and deliver our linux distro CloudReady.


The Job
As a Software Engineer at Neverware, you will be working with our engineering team to continue to develop great products and deliver them to customers who need them.  From day one you will begin to work on and refactor existing features, in addition to architecting and building new ones.  While we primarily develop in python and c++, web development is a large part of this role, so experience with web projects is necessary.  You can expect to:



  • Have general autonomy when architecting and implementing new features and projects

  • Write code that gets shipped out to customers and updated on regular intervals

  • Take ownership of all current Web Products

  • Contribute to team discussions pertaining to other components in our software stack

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer Needed for Software Development Company
jobs.content:
PIE seeks a talented Front End Developer to join our fast growing software company.  You’ll collaborate with senior members of our design team to create and implement website designs for MoneyGuidePro.  The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a fast-paced, small team environment and enjoy a highly collaborative approach to development.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with design team members to produce wireframes and/or screen mockups

  • Work on the number one financial planning software in the industry

  • Collaborate on robust, web based, client facing software

  • Code mockups into beautiful frontends

  • Design and edit web page content

  • Troubleshoot front-end coding and browser compatibility issues

  • Remain current on all topics related to web and user experience design

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
SMART is embarking on engineering the next generation of our software which will be web-based, we're looking for a Sr. Level web developer to complete our team. This role will be a unique opportunity to build a robust web-based application from the ground up.


The Sr. Web Developer provides advanced web application development services. Also responsible for providing guidance on new technology directions and advancements while contributing to refinement of  Development standards, practices and processes.

jobs.title: Senior .NET Software Developer
jobs.content:
Microdesk is seeking a Senior Software Developer to join our Application Development team. You will assist the project team working with a major  NYC-area public agency client based in Jersey City, NJ to help create new cutting-edge .NET solutions to optimize operations and maintenance.


What’s GREAT about a career with Microdesk?


Microdesk combines technology and business process consulting to help firms successfully plan, design, build and operate land and buildings. With Microdesk, you are part of a company that is delivering solutions to improve the entire project delivery process, from planning and design, to construction and operations & maintenance. We combine a strong vision with the latest tools and the talent of individuals from every corner of the industry to bring our clients’ projects to life. A career with Microdesk is a rewarding way to contribute to a variety of projects that help our clients throughout the AECO industry not only realize what is possible today, but also envision the future.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Serve as technical lead for a team of 2-3 other software developers

  • Work closely with end-user department leads to help improve business processes through effective use of technology bases system solutions

  • Act as primary developer for one or more software development initiatives using .NET 4.0/4.5, C# and SharePoint

  • Assist with business analysis, requirements gathering and drafting of scope/concept documents as required

  • Enhance the use of Enterprise Architect (EA) and Team Foundation Server (TFS) solutions for rapid development and application management

  • Take part in providing Level 2 application support for existing/legacy applications

  • Upgrade all systems to the latest Visual Studio, .NET and TFS supported versions   

  • Provide training and systems documentation for all responsible systems

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Software Developer
jobs.content:
Particle is hiring experienced Full-Stack Engineers to build amazing tools for companies building "Internet of Things" (IoT) products. You'll be building easy-to-use developer tools, a reliable and secure platform, and services that will scale to support millions of connected devices and trillions of messages. Particle is famous for the Particle Photon and Electron — Wi-Fi and cellular hardware development kits for creating Internet connected products. We've shipped more than 100,000 developer kits out to customers in more than 170 countries, and these developer kits are powered by our IoT platform, the Particle Cloud. What you may not know is that the Particle Cloud is also the back-end for hundreds of IoT products, from smart home appliances to heavy-duty industrial equipment. Particle is the most widely-used IoT platform out there, in particular because our tools are easy-to-use, open source, and affordable. As a Full-Stack Engineer at Particle, you would work closely with a global team of talented and experienced engineers to make our platform more reliable, more secure, and more scalable. You would listen to customers in developer community and work to make our developer tools easier to use. You would build new features to help our customers ship their IoT products and build IoT businesses. You'll launch those features, collect customer feedback, and rework those features to make them even better.


You are likely to work on some of the following products:



  • Particle Build, our Arduino-like web IDE for programming IoT devices over the air

  • Particle Cloud, our secure, scalable, efficient IoT platform

  • Particle Dashboard, our interface for managing devices, the data they generate, and the software that they're running


You are likely to work with some of the following languages, frameworks, and technologies:



  • Node.js

  • Express

  • Ember

  • React.js

  • MongoDB

  • ZeroMQ

  • Redis

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Docker

jobs.title: Full-Time Research Software Engineer in Los Angeles, CA
jobs.content:
MISSION STATEMENT


You are at the forefront of pioneering technology at space150. You are passionate about software and hardware development and wish to apply your experience and wisdom to new challenges. Your peers will seek you out for answers to difficult problems, or to check the feasibility of a solution. You will be a core software engineer on projects that push the agency forward through new ways of applying technology.


ACCOUNTABILITIES



  • Stays educated on latest trends and practices across all software engineering disciplines (Web, Mobile, Interaction, Animation, Computer Vision).

  • Functions as a core developer on one or several projects at a time.  Research Software Engineers often own entire code bases for a project, or responsible for large portions of functionality in extremely large projects.

  • Collaborates and reviews code with peers to ensure projects will be maintainable and performant

  • Assists supervisor with development story writing and estimation tasks

  • Configures development and production environments (including on-site installations) for both internal and external use

  • Collaboratively audits and provides feedback for interface designs.  Ensures that designs are appropriate with current development standards and within technical scope of projects

  • Ensures that projects developed achieve a precise alignment with creative design and user experience design specifications

  • Assists in planning or responding to projects and new business opportunities that have a higher degree of technical uncertainty or pioneering aspects


BACKGROUND



  • Degree in computer science, technical education or equivalent work experience

  • 3-5 years of experience in a Senior Software Engineer (or similar) role

  • Demonstrable record of successfully launched products

  • Competency in several core languages for space150


SOFT SKILLS



  • Ability to react positively to fast changes and requests

  • Communicates effectively on project progress and across disciplines of interaction

  • Constant awareness on projects, identifies issues and proposes solutions

  • Capable of leaving their comfort zone to learn a new language, framework or hardware

  • Creates a positive attitude when working with legacy code and/or projects

  • Proactively shares relevant technical and industry information across space150


CONSIDERATIONS



  • Research Software Engineers can work out of our Venice, CA office

  • Some travel is required for on-site installation and support


BE BOLD. APPLY.


You know the drill. Send us an email at careers@space150.com

jobs.title: Machine Vision Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're a small machine vision company in Denver, CO generally focused on industrial markets - Artemis Vision www.artemisvision.com. It's currently a very busy team of 10. We have sales offices in Charlotte, NC, Dallas, TX and Lincoln, NE. We've been in business for 6 years and counting. The business is growing and so we need another engineer to join us. Given the size of the place we all end up doing a lot of different things and you'll be handed a lot of responsibility from day one. You'll discuss solutions with clients directly, and then go about implementing them. All the solutions we build accomplish very real world goals and solve real world problems of parts on production lines.  It's a very tangible job, solving "how it's made" for our customers.  We want somebody who looks to grow a business and deliver great solutions. We want people who are able to fully focus on building the best systems and solutions, yet also pragmatic and flexible enough to work for a small company.

*What we do:

We put in machine vision solutions throughout North America. Solutions are programmed here in Denver and then installed at the client site. We also program and license machine vision software and systems other companies install. We've been working on building a portfolio of standard products.

We're looking for fellow programmers who like machine vision and building systems from the ground up to exacting levels of quality. Because machine vision often moves into industrial automation, we end up communicating with a lot of embedded devices and dealing with some robotics and motion control. Skills with PLCs are a plus as are database skills (Oracle, MS SQL, MariaDB, etc.). We're programmers ourselves so we certainly understand skills in C++ transfer to C# or Java and vice versa. Every project is very different, and we need people who enjoy challenges and seeing if a given industrial puzzle can be solved and then pursuing that solution to a solid and reliable system.

In general most projects are programmed by 1-2 people so there's generally little bureaucracy around interfaces. Typically the system will have 1-4 users at a factory and you'll know them by name so there's no guessing about what the hypothetical "user" wants. Part of the job is discussing it with them and they'll tell you what the system needs to do.

jobs.title: Application Security Architect
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life of an Application Security Architect: 



The Application Security Architect secures enterprise information by determining security requirements, planning, implementing, testing security systems, preparing security standards, policies, and procedures.



Responsibilities: 




  • Assist software and network engineers, system and database administrators, and product managers with assessing security threats, identifying and tailoring security requirements and integrating security controls into the Product / Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Ensure the implementation of a secure build integration process; secure source code repositories practices and code escrow process

  • Ensure WAF protection and implementation are in place and responsible for maintaining rules, monitoring alerts and ensuring appropriate actions are taken.

  • Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researching information security standards; conducting system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studying architecture/platform; identifying integration issues; preparing cost estimates

  • Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards

  • Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts

  • Maintain security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs

  • Upgrade security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements

  • Serves as the security architecture expert for the security functional areas across the organization and with 3rd-parties

  • Performs architecture risk analysis for existing systems, new acquisitions, identifies gaps and provides feedback for advancing enterprise security capabilities

  • Integrates security activities into projects or programs development lifecycle, ensures security activities are aligned with schedules and understands how to make win-win decisions between security and functionality

  • Lead the Security development effort to build secure applications to ensure key business and regulatory requirements are delivered.  Staying abreast of current and emerging technologies, and applying security best practices and technical expertise to create best-in-class Secure System Architecture

  • Drive secure application delivery through automated and manual application security testing

  • Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation

  • Leads or participates in setting the System Architectural strategy and defining the architecture roadmap

  • Leads or participates in the creation of application solution designs

  • Reviews work of other team members and mentor junior analysts as needed

jobs.title: C++ Software Engineer Building a Brand New Platform!
jobs.content:
Shaping the future of travel is important to us at Amadeus. Today, with technology getting smarter by the minute, that future is more exciting than ever.


Our business success relies on our people being always passionate about what we do. We believe in aiming for excellence, taking responsibility, working together and putting our customers first.


We encourage you to be part of new and exciting projects and for you to take the lead when it comes to your progression.


Since mobility allows you and Amadeus to grow, we always look internally first when searching for candidate.


Summary of the role 



We are seeking today’s leaders who can move toward greater responsibility and results. We also offer internships to college and university students who want to grow and learn from some of the industry’s best experts. Discover how you can shape the future of travel with us.
The mission of Amadeus’ Hotel IT team is to design and deliver high performance systems that can process tens of thousands of requests per second and return the highest level of accuracy in the fastest response time. Our SaaS platforms are designed to serve millions of users who are seeking information and reservations from tens of thousands of hotels offering millions of hotel rooms around the world. Utilizing our proven ability to build and deploy mission critical software for the global travel industry, we are creating the next generation of technology solutions for the hospitality industry including: reservations and distribution, high-volume data acquisition from heterogeneous sources, sophisticated search engines, payment processing, hotel operations, business intelligence, and revenue management.
 
Responsibilities:

The Amadeus Hotel platform is an SOA solution delivering a fully centralized reservation system for large hotel chains. New customer needs will require evolution of the platform. Two types of technology are deployed: C++ for the open back end in charge of the core functionality and Java for the portal in charge of the platform administration.
 
We are looking for  Software Developer in C++ to join the team and participate in these efforts in an Agile and collaborative environment!
    • Design, code, test, debug, document and maintain software solutions.
    • Design technical solutions and perform feasibility studies.
    • Propose viable technical solutions to Product Management and/or users for validation.
    • Model, design and implement databases as necessary.
    • Develop software according to Amadeus Standards.
    • Conduct unit, package and performance tests of the software and ensure a level of quality in line with the Amadeus guidelines.
    • Participate in the validation / acceptance phase of the product cycle ensuring the fine-tuning necessary to finalise the product.
    • Produce software documentation necessary for the application and issue it to the requesting departments.
    • Support the end user in the Production phase by debugging existing software solutions in response to defect or stories issued from Product Management or Business Analyst

Lab126 is part of the Amazon.com, Inc. group of companies and is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

  • take part in expanding, documenting and implementing our UX pattern library

You meet the following requirements:



  • expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scoping, and closures

  • familiarity beyond ES5 (e.g. ES6, TypeScript, CoffeeScript) 

  • you care about consistency of design and dislike having ten different buttons on a single page

  • you like fast web applications and know how to optimize them

  • experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React and Backbone is a plus but deep JavaScript knowledge is way more important

  • you want to learn new things: technology, practices, user interactions

  • you have an interest in coordinating cross-team efforts and initiatives

  • a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience as a frontend developer

  • familiarity with automated testing, be it unit-, functional- and/or acceptance testing


We offer:



  • top notch MacBook, 27” display, keyboard layout of choice

  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings

  • support with visa and work permit application

  • we only need to support IE 10+


Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:jobs@internations.org

Please include in your cover letter a list of projects you contributed to and are proud of. We also like to hear about what kind of work environment you aspire for and what technologies you find interesting right now.
