jobs.title: Software Developer - Large Application Development
jobs.content:
Who are we?


Configura leads the industry in parametric software tools for automating, simplifying and accelerating the design, sales and order processes. We are a global company with customers in 10 countries and users in more than 50. We are headquartered in Linköping, Sweden, with two wholly owned subsidiaries in Grand Rapids, Mich., USA, and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.


What do we need?


We are currently looking for skilled developers for our Grand Rapids location experienced with object-oriented programming and Java, C#, or C++ programming languages.  We develop in our own object-oriented programming language tailored to our specific needs. With this considered, we value programming skill over years of experience in a particular language or IDE.


If you love programming in an environment with new and challenging problems to solve, then Configura is the right place to apply!


We've told you a lot about us. Please, as part of your application, tell us a bit about you. We want to know why you would be a good fit and how you can help us!


Freeform adaption from Sun Tzu – The Art of War



  1. Programming is a matter of vital importance for mankind; the province of life or death; the road to survival or ruin. It is mandatory that it be thoroughly studied.

  2. Therefore, appraise it in terms of 5 fundamental factors and 7 golden rules.

  3. From the furnace of the mind of the skillful programmer, elemental thoughts emerge and are shaped and transformed through the precise language of programming, further feeding the furnace and shaping the flame. Programming is thus emotionally expressive as well as precise.

  4. Without focus and precision thoughts wander aimlessly and the program expressed is confused at best, cryptic, or even dis-informing.

  5. Programs are defined by 5 fundamental factors of algorithm, allocation, parallelism, exception handling, and optimization. Programs quickly overwhelm the mind. This must be countered through simplicity, abstraction, modularity, convention, practices, and speed.

  6. Know yourself and your code and in a hundred releases you will prevail. a. If you know yourself, but not your code, every other release will be in peril. b. If you do not know yourself, nor your code, every release will be in peril.

jobs.content:
Join the team building one of the premier tools used to support human and robotic spaceflight! Team members contribute to future and ongoing NASA missions that utilize FreeFlyer.  These missions include the International Space Station (ISS), James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), Orion, and the Asteroid Redirect Mission, as well as Air Force and commercial space missions. a.i. solutions is seeking focused and ambitious individuals who have a passion for spaceflight, technology, writing quality software, and wish to work on skilled software engineering teams. In addition to primary job roles, a.i. solutions provides the opportunity to perform internal research and development, as well as explore new technologies and potential products for application to future missions. We foster a collaborative, casual, and friendly environment. If you have a passion for space, software, and solving challenging real-world problems, we want you on our team.


(For more information on FreeFlyer click here or here, or see our company profile)


Essential Roles & Responsibilities:



  • Design, implement, and test new features and enhancements for FreeFlyer releases

  • Solve complex technical problems and perform trade-off analyses of feasible options

  • Identify and propose innovative solutions to customer challenges

  • Interact directly with customers in technical demonstrations, training, and meetings

  • Research emerging software technologies in support of analysis, operations, and automation

  • Create and update software systems documentation

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview:


We are looking for a QA Engineer to join a new and growing team working on Arkadium's "next big thing".   In this role, you will be able to work with and test cutting edge technologies including machine learning, cloud based solutions, microservices and many more.  Our goal is to have everything that can be automated, automated, so critical to this role will be your skills in automated testing techniques and tools. Also critical will be your skills writing code that performs testing of the product. The product we're developing is based fully on javascript and consumes restful microservices. This means that the key area of your knowledge should be Web and Web based technologies.


Responsibilities: 



  • Manage the Quality of the services assigned

  • Work with Developers and Product owners to write test cases based on use cases and stories.

  • Write scripts for automated tests

  • Control and setup QA environment, approve builds.

  • Perform load and integration testing.

  • Generate reports based on testing, setup triggers that automatically controls quality on live environment

  • Automate the testing process by using test harnesses and automated test tools. 

  • Ability to carry out all policies and procedures as established by the team, department or company at large. 

  • Mentor entry level Quality Assurance Associates on quality assurance and best practices.


In addition to this unique opportunity, we offer: 



  • An opportunity to work with a company that has the stability and resources of a big player and spirit and flexibility of a start up

  • Competitive base salary with full benefits

  • Strong work-life balance

  • A unique culture of fun, teamwork and did we mention, FUN!

  • A beautiful studio located in Silicon Alley, just blocks away from Union Square, Madison Square Park and so much more!

  • Summer Fridays

jobs.title: Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.


Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:


Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer (f/m)


Responsibilities



  • Ensure our global network infrastructure fulfills our goals of availability, scalability and performance

  • Design, implement, support, maintain and enhance enterprise grade network, Firewall, IPS and monitoring solutions for future growth and projects

  • Proactive monitoring and maintenance of the infrastructure to prevent potential outages (NOC)

  • Analysis and troubleshooting of incidents across the whole stack incl. root cause analysis

  • Automate and improve network configuration deployment and change management

  • Implement robust security measures with well-designed security-concepts

  • Research on new technologies to improve performance and availability of our mission critical infrastructure

  • Create and update network and monitoring documentation


Requirements



  • 5+ years of experience in designing, operating, monitoring and troubleshooting an enterprise grade HA network environment incl. Firewall management (HP, Cisco, WatchGuard)

  • 5+ years of experience in managing monitoring solutions (Nagios, check_MK, OMD)

  • Deep understanding of network protocols, topologies and diagnostics across the whole OSI model

  • Strong experience with VPN protocols and solutions (IPSEC, DMVPN, SSL-VPN, OpenVPN)

  • Hands on experience in managing a Linux server environment

  • Experience with Amazon Web services (esp. VPC, EC2, CloudFormation, CloudWatch) is a plus

  • Proven organization, problem solving, and analytical skills

  • Certifications in Cisco CCNP , Juniper JNCIP/SP , CCISP or other data communication certifications

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, also natural sciences possible


What we offer you



  • High-end computers (tower/laptop) with SSD hard disk, 16G of memory and 4 Xeon 3,X Ghz + 2x 24 inch screens

  • Skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us

  • Opportunities for advancement – independence and the opportunity to take on responsibility

  • A highly motivated team of senior system engineers

  • Openness to new ideas and creativity

  • Benefits as employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and more


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date.


Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: (Senior) Java Engineer
jobs.content:
What you will be responsible for



  • developing and continuously delivering applications for one of the most successful e-commerce platforms in Europe to enable our growing and successful business 

  • working in a Scrum environment and taking part in alle parts of the software life cycle from concept thru coding to testing and maintaining

  • get fascinated by discovering and solving the digital challenges of delivering a full e-commerce stack: Customer Experience, Payment, Supply Chain & Finance

  • strive for mastery in a challenging agile environment using state-of-the-art technologies

  • be part of a multinational team located in the Munich city center

  • work autonomously surrounded in a pleasant working environment


We strongly believe that this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced developer looking for a new challenge. The opportunity to work within the heart of Munich, within the international e-Commerce scene with opportunities arising all the time. Lastly, a great group of colleagues with a genuine passion and interest into what they do, inside and outside of work.

jobs.title: Software Design Engineer I
jobs.content: We are seeking a Software Engineer I who is passionate about building products and can thrive in an Agile/Scrum environment. This is an excellent opportunity for an entry level software developer to further developer their skills within a structured environment.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Laravel Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Kuwait City, Kuwait
URL: www.ajar.com.kw

Who we are
Built by a passionate team of problem-solvers, Ajar Online is a mobile-inspired cloud service built for the real estate market in Kuwait and the GCC that uses technology to offer a quick and efficient online rent collection solution via SMS and email, making life easier for both landlords and tenants. As a growing startup, we are excited to start expanding our team to grow our operations in Kuwait and within the region. 

Ajar Online is an awarding-winning startup. Explore what we do in more detail on our website.

What were looking for
We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer to design, develop and enhance our core business software solution. The successful candidate will be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design. This job is also available for anyone outside of Kuwait as a "Remote Job"

What youd have to do
  • Execute full life-cycle software development in a self-sufficient matter.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code
  • Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software systems
  • Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
  • Develop unit tests for self or others code when necessary.
  • Review code for bugs and defects including security loopholes within the logical structures. 
  • Comply with project plans and industry standards
  • Produce reports using MySQL on an as needed basis.

Skills
  • BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Required ability to swiftly develop software in PHP
  • Experience in developing web applications using at least one popular web framework 
  • Knowledgeable in ORM.
  • Expert in MVC best practices
  • Proficiency in Laravel 4 Framework
  • Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, MySQL using PhpMyAdmin
  • Preferable knowledge in cross-platform mobile development tools
  • Preferable knowledge in one or more of these languages; Java, Objective-C, Swift or C#.
  • Preferable Knowledge in Linux (Ubuntu) Administration

Benefits
Other than the usual benefits;
  • Stock Options.
  • 30 days paid leave.
  • Flexible Hours (with at least 4 hrs overlap with GMT+3).
  • Work remotely from anywhere!

To apply: Use the following link to apply: https://ajaronline.workable.com/j/71257A0749

jobs.title: Crazy Full-Stack Folk for one-time life opportunity in Asia
jobs.content:
SeeChic is looking for full-stack Django developer to build a totally new version of our backend. We are using Magento’s for the moment, but we’ve already reached its limits. Yes, because we are aiming to become the leader in south east asia! (job is based in Singapore, we can work-out a remote work for a time given but not as a long-term solution)


Responsibilities



  • You will report to the CEO and working very closely with me (product manager/django developer/crazy tech visionaire, never take “it’s not possible” for an answer). And yes, this position is a possibility to become a team leader. In SeeChic, we do not give a title to give a title, you have to earn it.

  • Building from scratch the whole infrastructure in collaboration with me : from the product information management system, to the front-end.

  • Nobody will tell you how to do smth, we are looking for an expert willing to learn and find solutions.

jobs.title: Senior Modeling Scientist, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to appropriate audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in modeling scientists with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems.

You will work within a world class modeling group of scientists and engineers that spans multiple product teams and collaborates closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.



RESPONSIBILITIES




    • Design, develop and operate statistical models and algorithms to deliver performance at scale

    • Investigate system issues, identify root causes, and design solutions

    • Prototype solutions and conduct data analyses to solve large-scale inference and control problems

    • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new products to delight our customers

    • Implement algorithms for production systems responsible for real time audience targeting on Real Time Bidding (RTB) exchanges

    • Work cross-functionally with other teams to develop best practices in campaign setup, execution and optimization

    • Be part of on-call rotation (about 4x a year)- we build and operate our own products!

    • Generate and review proposals for further research and development directions

    • Participate in machine learning study group and present findings to stakeholders as needed

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you ever had a dream so real you felt awake?  Where you helped decide how to build an awesome product in a sweet location with smart, cool developers?  Take the red pill and come join the Bluebeam engineering team in our Chicago office.



Our engineers develop intuitive applications that revolutionize how people collaborate and share data in real time. As part of the Bluebeam team, you will use your expertise to design and develop customer centric applications. You will work in a fast-paced environment were product delivery cycles are measured in months rather than years. You won’t ever see a 300-page specification document here.  Instead, we work closely with product managers and customers to extend core functionality as well as design and implement new products and features that make a difference every day for our users.



As part of our engineering team, you’ll work with Xamarin to develop native macOS and iOS applications. You’ll help us solve complicated problems in areas such as code sharing across platforms, graphics performance, and intuitive interface design.  



(At this point, you’re thinking, “What the frak?! C# development on Mac and iOS??” So here’s the deal:  Bluebeam is dedicated to a multi-platform experience. Xamarin lets us share code between native Windows, iOS and macOS applications while maintaining the look and feel of the native UI.  Trust us, it works great!)



So if you are looking for a career where you can develop applications that provide best-in-class functionality and have a direct impact on some of the largest design and engineering projects, Bluebeam is the place for you. 



What you’ll do



  • Collaborate with your team and other stakeholders to produce high quality code

  • Assist in the design, development, testing, and deployment for one of following applications:

    • the Mac version of Revu (our Windows flagship application )

    • iOS applications for iPad and iPhones





What we’d like to see in you



  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • 5+ years of software development experience

  • Proven experience developing end-user software using Windows .NET technologies particularly C#

  • “Agile” software development methodology experience

  • Test-driven development experience

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Xcode and Objective-C familiarity

  • macOS development experience (not a deal breaker, but if you don't have this, we'd like you to enjoy working on a macOS system!) 



If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send us the following:



  • Resume

  • A Cover letter that reflects your personality and your interest in Bluebeam and this role specifically (no generics please!)



Want to see what you might be working on?


http://www.bluebeam.com/us/products/revu/ipad.asp


http://www.bluebeam.com/us/products/revu/mac/



Learn even more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/

jobs.title: PostgreSQL Guru
jobs.content:
Sharada has immediate need for a seasoned PostgreSQL expert to lead a number of key initiatives.

The ideal candidate possesses hands-on, in-depth knowledge and experience in all facets of Postgres including but not limited to day-to-day administration and troubleshooting, performance tuning, query optimization, storage, partitioning, replication, physical design, foreign data wrappers, security and analytics.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer, Ad Reporting
jobs.content:
The Advertising Reporting Team is responsible for building industry-leading reporting solutions for Quantcast’s advertising clients, providing rich insights into their advertising campaigns and audience.


We are looking for a senior full-stack engineer who has significant experience with both client-side and server-side Web technologies. You will be leading the development of brand new, innovative reporting features to deliver an intuitive user experience and service architecture for our large and rapidly growing advertising client base.


The right applicant will be a versatile technical leader, deeply interested in technology and finding the best solution for a problem, as well as redefining the problem to make our software best-in-class.


We currently use AngularJS, d3, SASS, Java, and the Play framework.


Responsibilities




  • Define, code, test, and deploy new features to our reporting suite with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.




  • Utilize latest HTML, CSS, and JS techniques to produce highly-performant, informative, and beautiful user experiences for clients.




  • Work cross-functionally with UX, Product, and other Engineering teams. Contribute to the product definition, UI, and system design processes. 




  • Evaluate feasibilities and effectively manage project scope and time.




  • Continually evaluate and instill best practices into the development process, including automated testing, code organization and style, and application architecture.




  • Provide guidance to other team members and mentorship to junior software developers.




Requirements




  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field




  • 5+ years of web application development experience




  • 2+ years in a senior software development role




  • 2+ years of JavaScript experience in a client-side MVC framework




  • Deep understanding of web technologies and their implications, from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript through to the back-end technologies that support websites




  • Experience building responsive user interfaces for the Web




  • Bonus: Professional experience with AngularJS or d3




  • Bonus: Professional experience with Java or the Play framework




  • Bonus: Open-source project contributions

jobs.title: Senior Web Application Engineer Prospecting
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Prospecting team at AdRoll is seeking a Senior Web Application Engineer to develop a new, innovative data product as a part of AdRoll's marketing platform. You will work closely with a small team of engineers, product managers, and data scientists to implement user-facing features for Prospecting and our library of shared UI components. If building scalable, usable, modern UIs is close to your heart, this is your dream job.


In this role, you will collaborate with our Product and UX teams on designing new features and improving existing products based on usage data. Through this cycle of iteration you will learn what makes great products tick and ultimately make life better for our users.


At AdRoll Engineering, we value the freedom and autonomy we give to our employees and encourage everyone to use a multitude of different technologies based on their interests. As a UI engineer, you have an opportunity to share your knowledge and help other engineers build modern web UIs and shared components.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with other engineers and product managers on building web applications, APIs and data visualizations

  • Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt

  • Perform A/B tests, participate in user interviews and analyze usage data to make informed decisions

  • Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger


Qualifications:



  • 3+ years experience building web user interfaces for B2B or B2C products

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript as a language beyond popular frameworks

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals

  • Experience with (or willingness to master) our stack, in order of importance: React, Redux, ES6, SASS, Python, SQL, Docker, and AWS


Bonus Points:



  • Contributions to the open source community

  • Experience building shared components or libraries

  • Experience with internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n)

  • Experience in visual arts, graphic design, usability research or human-computer interaction


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Real Time Bidding
jobs.content:
About the Role:


As a Real Time Systems Engineer you will need to straddle several of AdRoll’s core technologies: our stack includes Python, Erlang, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, HBase, and our own open-sourced solutions.  


Responsibilities:



  • Improving the intelligence of the bidding systems, converting insights from AdRoll’s data science team into robust, scalable code

  • Make key improvements to our core distributed systems infrastructure, powering over 500 thousand individual bid requests per second

  • Be a part of a team working on a high volume, highly available system, critical to the success of the business. Balance performance and modularity in systems where every millisecond counts

  • Roll up your sleeves and dig into every nook and cranny of AdRoll’s codebase


Qualifications:



  • BS or MS in computer science or related field

  • 5+ years in a functional or object-oriented language

  • You do your best work when you have lots of freedom and can take ownership of your projects from concept to finish


Bonus Points:



  • Erlang, Java and Python experience - programming Polygots welcome!

  • Has a genuine interest in Open Source and has personal projects


About Our Tech Stack:



  • Web applications powered by Flask, Pylons, PostgreSQL, Backbone.js, React, SASS and more

  • Soft realtime systems running in Erlang

  • Big-data backend running Hadoop, HBase, Storm and Thrift

  • We rely heavily on AWS -- AdRoll is one of Amazon’s biggest customers!


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Role:


AdRoll Growth is a cross functional team focussed on driving core business metrics by deploying technical assets across the AdRoll sales and marketing funnel. We have latitude in terms of what problems we solve, what tools we use and how we solve those problems. We are data driven and work in six-week experiments. We have Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Intelligence people that collaborate and sit together. A day in the life of AdRoll Growth can include working on our A/B testing infrastructure, implementing a new onboarding tool, helping other teams become more growth orientated, adding a new feature to our product dashboard or writing an MVP to test out a new idea.


You are:



  • Comfortable working across the stack: including Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, JavaScript (React/JQuery/Backbone) and AWS

  • Biased towards action. You ship quality code quickly and don’t let the perfect be the enemy of the good

  • A voracious learner. You’re excited to learn about new tools and methods and you’re not afraid to ask for help

  • Data driven. You look to the data to drive your decisions and build products with measurability in mind

  • Up-to-date on the most cutting edge developer growth tools. You know when to buy versus when to build

  • Empathetic to the customer. You’re passionate about improving the AdRoll experience

  • Love to work collaboratively with a tight-knit team


Requirements:




  • You have experience building web applications in one or more server-side web frameworks and languages (preferably Python)




Bonus Points:



  • Previous experience in a growth team or early stage startup

  • Any experience in marketing, AdTech or UX


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About the opportunity:


At AdRoll, we prefer the sense of perspective that comes from a diverse group of people and a healthy work-life balance. When we aren't busy making AdRoll a fantastic place and product, you'll likely find us tinkering with hardware projects, going on bike rides around the bay, playing some Street Fighter, and spending time with other Rollers.


We are currently seeking Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our teams in retargeting, native ads, big data and data science to implement and develop products and features that will make a big impact for our external customers and internal stakeholders.


If you think AdRoll is the place for you, then apply today to join our engineering community. If there is a team/role that looks to be a match, a member of our technical recruiting team will follow up.


Responsibilities:



  • Write high quality maintainable code

  • Work with product management and fellow engineers to plan features, create specifications, and estimate effort.

  • Help establish technical standards as the product(s) scales up

  • Create high profile customer facing/internal product(s)

  • Develop novel solutions to the test, interface and stability challenges that arise in SOA environments


Requirements:



  • 5+ years experience building production web applications in a corporate or start-up environment.

  • Strong fundamentals: B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

  • Productive in one or more imperative programming languages.

  • Productive in one or more server-side web frameworks and object-oriented languages.

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and system design

  • Experience in modern web application development and frameworks, e.g. ES6, React, Redux, Sass.


Bonus Points:



  • Interest in deployment automation and scalable infrastructure. (AdRoll is a big user of AWS!)

  • Meaningful contributions to the open source community

  • A good sense of design, direction, and humor


Our Stack:


Python, React, AWS, Redux

jobs.title: Programmer Analyst III
jobs.content:
Information Technology is a life-saving technology at UCLA Health. UCLA is one of the worlds most respected hospitals, and the complex systems and networks we build support patient care, research, medical education, billing, staffing and communication. Our IT needs can be unique, so we frequently develop our own applications. And because everything we do at UCLA Health is to serve the needs of the patient, our IT professionals are engaged in work that ultimately advances human health. We are currently offering telecommuting options for several of our positions.

At the David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA you will part of an internationally recognized leader in education, research and patient care. The medical breakthroughs that occur at this elite institution continue to change the course of medicine, while the students we train will be tomorrow's world leaders in health and science. So consider the unmatched rewards and opportunities of a career with the David Geffen School of Medicine as we work toward greater knowledge and better outcomes in the delivery of patient care.



As the Programmer Analyst III for Pediatrics, you will work with the Director of External Relations, assisting with the creation, maintenance, and administration of the Department(s) Clinical and Research data repositories, SharePoint development, and the project management of software projects. In this role, the Programmer Analyst III will provide lead programmer coordination and supervision for programming activities, ensuring all data repositories remain secure and are meeting HIPAA, Compliance, and Department guidelines.

jobs.title: Mobile Lead
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for a talented iOS developer to join our mobile development team. The successful candidate will be part of a team that is developing a highly visible app in the App Store. More than just an app, Jet.com is leveraging technology and innovating around price to help reduce some of the inefficiencies in the ecommerce market to ultimately help drive down consumer costs. Being a small company with an even smaller mobile development team you will have a chance to work on a new platform from the ground up, helping architect and build new features for the Jet app.



  • Work closely with our product and design teams to customize the Jet experience for the iOS platform

  • Join our collaborative philosophy by being an active member in the Objective-C/Swift/iOS community

  • Architect and build new features for the Jet iOS app and help with development of our iPad specific app


The Person



  • 3+ years of professional software development experience during which you have worked with a team to ship products iteratively

  • Experience working with a disciplined software release, build, and deploy processes

  • Experience building or adding to a published native iOS application

  • 2+ years experience building iOS applications

  • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field preferred

  • Excellent communication and organizational skill

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

jobs.title: FrontEnd Engineer @ Heal
jobs.content:
As a Senior FrontEnd Software Engineer, you will play a central role in the design and development of the Heal product.


As a fast-growing startup, we look for self-starters who like to take the bull by horns and get stuff done – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.
In this role you work with a small, collaborative team of engineers, product manager, and designers – so excellent interpersonal and communication skills are also a must.
And most importantly – we look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.


You must have a valid work authorization in the United States of America. We will sponsor visa transfers.

Visa candidates - we will transfer H1-b visas for highly qualified senior-level and above candidates.  We do not sponsor candidates who reside outside of the USA or post-OPT.

jobs.title: Billing and Accounting Engineer
jobs.content:
About Our Team:


The AdRoll Billing, Payment, Accounting and Finance Engineering team is a (very) small but resourceful group responsible for a critical part of AdRoll’s platform. Building, expanding, and supporting AdRoll's automated billing system and it's many complementary integrations is a complex task that requires strong reasoning skills, a bit of financial acumen, and editorial disciple that is often lost in software development. In addition to core application responsibilities, we also support our finance department and AdRoll's customers directly through automation, reporting, and the creation of user-facing and employee-facing tools.


Together we will take on exciting and challenging areas like automated billing and payments, currencies and conversion, account keeping, billing specific UIs, aggregated reporting from many data sources, complex integrations with payment providers and financial systems, and billing as a service in a multi-product environment.


Who We're Looking For:


You are delighted by the idea that your code will be part of a critical platform component, used by every single customer, with little to no margin for error. You have some experience in the billing and/or finance domain. Quick test: one or more of the phrases 'gateway', 'deferred revenue', and/or 'general ledger' mean something to you. You may have even designed or implemented payment/invoicing integrations or systems in the past.


In a more general sense, you can design and build scalable, fast, fault tolerant systems that minimize customer impact in case of failures and errors. You can architect and build systems that can process a high volume of transactions while maintaining state. Your experience working with systems gives you insight into building APIs and services which can be easily extended. And you understand the fundamentals and importance of building secure systems which protect sensitive data.


Responsibilities:



  • Help make decisions that influence the future of AdRoll's Billing System

  • Design, implement and maintain software responsible for:

    • Keeping accurate and detailed customer accounts

    • Writing invoices

    • Processing payments and refunds

    • Integrating with international payment providers (Braintree, Adyen) as well as complementary systems like Salesforce and Netsuite

    • Provide reporting and analytics to complementary teams like Finance and BI



  • Work with the finance team to formalize and automate processes and improve AdRoll for customers and employees alike

  • Investigate issues and improvement opportunities in the Billing & Finance domain and pursue them with innovative solutions


Qualifications:



  • Self-directed and resourceful

  • You employ careful design methodologies with an emphasis on simplicity, reliability and legibility

  • You have experience with Python, Ruby or similar dynamic programming language and UNIX-like systems

  • Humble -- happy to work on critical-but-sometimes-invisible systems


Bonus Points:



  • Background in finance or accounting

  • Familiar with GAAP


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Cloud Operations Team Lead
jobs.content:
This is not your typical Cloud Operations Team Lead role; and Altus Analytics is not your typical company. Altus Analytics has set the bar high and we are the leaders in technical solutions for the CRE industry on a global scale and we want to stay at the top! At Altus Analytics we support, promote and challenge our team. We are passionate about researching and upgrading our technology and rolling out the best solutions for our clients. Joining Altus Analytics now and working out of their City Centre location in Houston is a smart career move.


We need a Cloud Operations Team Lead who wants to own and drive the next stage. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to take that next step  in their career and who likes to manage a small team while staying hands on and technical. Reporting to the Director of Development Operations, our new Cloud Operations Team Lead will be managing not one, but two SaaS applications: Voyanta and Argus on Demand. Our new products are live and running.


Our tech, our stack.


Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand are Amazon Web Services hosted applications. We build our cloud-based applications using multi-tier architectures, for a SaaS environment. We use both .NET framework and Microsoft technologies as well as Linux based technologies combined with Open Source products and Citrix XenApp.


At Altus Analytics, we have some exciting challenges ahead of us. Here’s just a peek at what you’ll be doing as our new Cloud Operations Team Lead, you will:



  • Own the AWS cloud infrastructure for multiple SaaS applications. (There are currently two, with more in development!)

  • Manage, mentor, lead and coach a team of systems engineers.

  • Drive automation of infrastructure activities as we believe in achieving “Infrastructure as Code”

  • Put in processes to ensure high availability, high security and be compliant to ISO 27001 and SOC 2 Type 1

  • Recommend technologies - from cost estimates to timeline projections - to strengthen our infrastructure, increase security and increase availability.


To that end, we need a Cloud Operations Team Lead who is an AWS expert. Someone who always has their finger on the pulse of infrastructure and networking best practices and technologies. Someone with end-to-end applications experience from cloud builds to implementation; from automation to deployment. We need a Cloud Operations Team Lead with hands-on SaaS expertise, cost optimization focus and the communication style to share that knowledge. Someone obsessed with networking, security and process.


Here’s what our new Cloud Operations Team Lead will do:



  • Own it. You will own and manage all the hardware and software needed to run the Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand SaaS solutions in the cloud.

  • Drive it. You will make technology recommendations to strengthen our infrastructure and drive the adoption of those changes, coordinating estimates and timelines.

  • Do it. You will apply your hands-on expertise to making proactive changes, and maintaining highly reliable infrastructure.

  • Mentor. You will actively mentor, guide and manage a team of (currently) two systems engineers, including a remote UK-based employee.

  • Oversee. You will oversee third-party relationships with consultants we may engage for monitoring, certification and auditing.

  • Collaborate. You will work across teams with architects and developers for both SaaS applications.

  • Manage it. You will focus all activities around making the environment highly available and secure.

  • Deploy. You will plan and oversee the deployments of our software to the infrastructure.

  • Apply certifications. You will manage ongoing certifications for the environments such as ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type 1 & 2.

  • Engineer policies and processes. You will determine, define and enforce all policies and processes required to smoothly run Operations with minimal downtime.

  • Automate. You will drive automation to help run “Infrastructure as code”. You will essentially automate anything that can be automated.

  • Be diligent. You will ensure other Operational parts such as backup, disaster recovery, antivirus, IDS etc. are in place.

  • Report it. You will maintain KPIs for availability and other reporting aspects as required.

  • Solve it. You will ensure timely resolutions to production issues, minimizing downtime. You will be the main point of contact for escalation of issues pertaining to SaaS Operations.

  • Meet it. You will ensure your team meets defined and negotiated SLAs.

jobs.title: Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a seasoned engineer who wants a job that serves a larger purpose? Are you interested in making a meaningful, life-changing difference for millions of students? Would you like an opportunity to manage projects and work directly with end users?


Digication is changing the way students learn from the ground up. Instead of rote learning through lectures and tests, Digication allows students to create online portfolios - collaborative and safe learning spaces - to encourage project based learning. The results have been staggering. According to recent research, retention and pass rate at a community college jumped from 50% to 80%. Digication is now being used by students at over 6,000 K-12 and Higher Education schools.


Position: Integration Engineer


Tech stack & stats



  • We use many different technologies (we’re open minded and consider what’s best for each job).

  • Browser-based interface built around internal services

  • Languages: Node.js, PHP, Java

  • Database: MySQL (RDS)

  • Server: AWS, Ubuntu, nginx, haproxy, chef

  • Digication is a profitable SaaS company serving millions of requests per day to millions of users

  • 6,000+ schools use Digication as a mission-critical tool every day


Company culture



  • We work as a team, with direct access to company founders as well as senior level engineers

  • We love talking to customers

  • We love solving problems for technical as well as non-technical end users

  • We like to be mentors and mentees to our peers

  • We work with a sense of urgency, but we don’t like cutting corners

  • We are self motivated and passionate about learning

  • We hold ourselves accountable for our work and commitments


How will this be different from most other engineering jobs



  • The majority (90%) of your job is an engineer, the rest is to engage in project management for our clients, which includes interactions with customers including calls, emails and webinars.

  • You will work on something that makes a meaningful difference in many students’ lives

  • You value integrity over profitability (Although we are profitable!)

  • You value personal growth and learning over titles and salaries

  • You are creative and different, and you're proud of it

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Backend
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION



We are looking for an experienced Backend engineer to join our development team who has a passion for delivering great mobile user experiences and working through complex problems.  


Candidates should have strong but well-founded opinions on code style, structure, automated processes and product building, and should like to sweat over every little detail while being able to iterate quickly.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Building scalable and distributed back-ends for Max2 applications.

  • Utilizing synchronous and asynchronous design, coding and testing patterns

  • Developing the multi-tier scalable infrastructure for Max2 products, that supports applications operating 24x7 in a reliable fashion

  • Delivering programming commitments on time and produce high quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration.

jobs.title: Scrum Product Owner
jobs.content:
As a member of the Development team, the Scrum Product Owner will use their business savvy and eye for UI/UX design to lead software development projects from concept through completion. The Scrum Product Owner will work with Product Managers and other key stakeholders to gather, refine, and convey requirements to the Development team in order to build the best products possible.


In order to be successful, a candidate must demonstrate an understanding of the market, the customer base, and the business in order to make sound decisions. They must also have exceptional communication skills, be able to work closely with internal and external parties, and be able to communicate appropriate messages about the product at any given time.


Essential Functions



  • Gather ideas and requirements from key stakeholders and refine them into a vision and a set of features for products

  • Create wireframes, define messages, develop and maintain style guides, and specify scenarios to clearly outline what the development team is expected to deliver

  • Develop and maintain the product backlog, ensuring the highest-value features and functions are listed by priority (or are appropriately prioritized)

  • Participate in software release planning

  • Drive multiple products concurrently

  • Develop effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders

  • Maintain a solutions-oriented approach, working quickly to remove obstacles

  • Help the teams to deliver exceptional, timely results

  • Other duties as assigned by management

jobs.title: Sr. Backend Developer for Big Data VR/MR/AR Project
jobs.content:
WE'RE LOOKING FOR A SEASONED BACKEND APPLICATION DEVELOPER!


Magnopus is an experience company founded by a diverse team of Oscar-winning artists and technicians.  We’re combining storytelling, art, and advanced technologies to create Hollywood-caliber augmented reality, virtual reality, and mixed reality experiences in education, entertainment, and more.  


Job Description


We are working on a cutting-edge VR/MR/AR application which allows people to connect deeper to the world around us in order to feel touched, inspired, educated and entertained. To help get the app into people’s hands we are seeking YOU a skilled backend developer to help us bring the experiences to life. The position is full time and is using the latest technology stack in our downtown Los Angeles office


Responsibilities



  • Spike testing and rapid proofing of concepts around emerging technologies

  • Implement service/business/data layer, cross-cutting components, external service integration, client-side offline capabilities and much more

  • End-to-end development of new features from concept through testing to deployment in a CI environment

  • Contribute to driving the application architecture

  • Writing clean, well documented, design pattern oriented and testable code following SOLID principles

  • Meticulous attention to detail and high quality of work


Core Skills and Requirements



  • Excellent knowledge in designing and developing complex multi-tier software applications

  • Minimum of 3+ years experience with C# and .NET Framework

  • Minimum of 2+ years experience with JavaScript

  • Creation and consuming RESTful web services

  • Well versed in the design and usage of SQL and NOSQL databases including ETL

  • Experience using 3rd party APIs to obtain data from internet sources

  • Good understanding of design patterns



Additional Skills Considered a Plus



  • Experience with NodeJS

  • Experience with big data and machine learning algorithms

  • Working in an agile scrum environment

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Stardog is an enterprise data unification platform built on smart graph technology: query, search, inference, and data virtualization. We're looking for talented engineers to help us build Stardog.

  • Conduct and participate in design & code reviews

In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.


We are committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Site Experience
jobs.content:
Software Engineer - Site Experience


The market leader in travel research, is seeking a dynamic, passionate developer for the Site Experience team.  This team is focused on building a rich user interface (UI) and experience (UX)  In addition, the team is responsible for how user content (reviews, photos, videos) is managed and how users efficiently find the information they are looking for (navigation, auto-complete, and site search).  Projects are fast iterated and results are carefully measured, which speaks to the quality of both the engineers and the culture. We are a successful company that moves quickly and takes risks on ideas we believe will yield big wins.



You Have:



  • A sense of ownership and take pride in your role.

  • Experience developing complete Java-based, database-driven applications.

  • Experience developing multi-threaded, object oriented, and high-scale code powering full stack web applications.

  • Extensive experience with JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, UI and UX.

  • Proven success at an Internet startup or early stage company.

  • It would be great if you had in-depth and hands on knowledge of Linux, and related open source technologies such as Apache, Tomcat, Postgres, Memcached and Hadoop. If not, be prepared to learn them all quickly... Very quickly.

  • Strong interpersonal skills, analytical skills, combined with intellectual curiosity, and a desire and ability to "get things done" are essential requirements

  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.


You Will:



  • Design and build tools, services and infrastructure to support the Site Experience Team.

  • Design complex systems and participate in the technical solution of projects

  • Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the website

  • Work closely with our product and teams to define feature specifications.


Do you have a proven track record of delivering high quality results, while thriving in a fast paced environment? If so, please come join us.

jobs.title: Senior Development Manager, Vacation Rentals
jobs.content:
Our client, The Worlds Largest Travel Site is looking for motivated and talented Technical Managers to join their team as they build their next big product.


If you're looking to build something new, are eager to join a team working with trusted payments, social, and mobile, and love being part of a great team that thrives in a fast paced environment - then we'd love to hear from you!


The Technical Manager will be responsible for building and leading a team within Vacation Rentals. You will be leading a wide range of project work, from integrating with vacation rental management platforms, building APIs for third party suppliers to integrate their inventory into our website, working on a PCI compliant payment platform, to delivering rich content and user experience to our travelers researching vacation rentals for their next vacation. In short, your work will encompass the key areas of execution for the Vacation Rentals business.


Can you enable highly iterative agile development by breaking down complex projects into discrete tasks? Are you a leader that can mold bright young developers into seasoned veterans? Are you capable of hands-on development and digging into reports and logs when problems arise along with delegating and prioritizing the work needed across the team? Are you, above all else, passionate about success?


Qualifications:



  • You have a BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • You have at least 6 years of software development experience, with at least 1 year managing a team

  • You show a sense of ownership and pride in your role as a leader, and you can make us believe you'll excel

  • You have consistently exceeded expectations throughout your career, and you can describe specific activities and projects that demonstrate this behavior

  • You can manage a team towards long-term goals while delivering new capability daily

  • You have the ability to work with everyone from engineers to product owners to C-level executives to help communicate, prioritize, influence and inform key product decisions

  • You have successfully hired and built teams including interviewing, on-boarding, and mentoring

  • You find the live operations of your team's code fulfilling and worth getting right

  • It would be great if you had in-depth and hands-on knowledge of Linux, Java, JavaScript and related open source technologies such as Apache, Tomcat, PostgreSQL, and Hadoop

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content: Responsible for design, development, implementation, testing, and documentation for components of software systems that support three or more of the following functions: data collection, flow,  archiving, database interaction, web-based data search and access, interoperability, quality control, formatting, pre-processing, and visualization.

jobs.title: TPM for Hulu's Ad Platform Team
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


As a Technical Program Manager at Hulu, you are expected to be partners in crime with engineers, helping to ensure they have time and information to code from start to finish. You are the front line in separating the wheat from the chaff and making sure critical information is shared, while noise is kept to a minimum. This requires you to be fluent in both technology and the language of product, marketing, and advertising. You will also need to move quickly; we use a wiki, calendar, and whatever agile tools the team discovers work best. For this particular role, you are expected to dive deep into ad serving technology, distributed systems and get your hands dirty with details. This is not a project manager role although that is certainly something that is part of the role. You should be able to run a scrum team and manage backlogs, and prioritize work for the engineers.Above all else, you are expected to manage the inevitable change over the lifecycle of a project; lead with vision, plan with foresight, execute with precision, and handle change with grace.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Own project schedules and drive deliverables to completion

  • Successfully partner with engineers to quickly and efficiently release products

  • Dive into details and do whatever is necessary to keep the show running

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to launch new products and features

  • Manage multiple projects with shifting and competing priorities

  • Distill product requirements into actionable items for engineers

  • Document complex business logic for multiple back-end services

  • Manage complex technical integrations with 3rd party advertising services

  • Act as scrum-master, running sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, tracking burn-downs, etc

  • Communicate clearly and effectively with minimum overhead while being maintaining a One Team approach

jobs.title: Wordpress Developer for Fitness Site
jobs.content:
Hi,

We are looking for 1-2 remote (or NYC) developers to join our engineering team on contract/freelance terms. We are a fitness Ecommerce site building a community of brands and gyms.

If you lift or do any sports, you know how crazy it is that clothing brands, meal prep services, equipment companies are popping out all over the place, we want to build a marketplace for all these dope stuff.

Candidates who are good fit for this job are those who:

 Javascripts all day errday. If you could, youd brush your teeth with it.
 worked on Ecommerce site before, if you worked on big-time. shopping sites, even better

 Has a high affinity for visuals, love dope shit like https://www.equinox.com/,
http://www.tomford.com/
 favors experimenting and fucking shit up over test driven development
 rocks Wordpress, BuddyPress and WC Vendors

You dont need a big ass CV and a long history in computer science. We favor enthusiasm and proficiency in whats important right now as well as a hunger for more. No X-years experience bullshit.

Show us some cool things you threw together; usually experiments and side-projects are more appreciated than previous client work of yours.

If you like what you hear, hit us up.
Best.

Extra tags: Wordpress, Java

jobs.title: Angular.JS - Rails Engineer - Alternative Investment Platform
jobs.content:

We need that perfectionist who will work closely with our designers, UX, and Marketing teams to implement pixel-perfect and engaging front-end experiences within our market-leading Alternative Investment Platform. The technologies  you'll be working with on a daily basis include AngularJS, CSS, Ruby 2, Rails 4, Postgres, Redis,  and AWS, just to name a few.

jobs.title: Principal Engineer / Architect

jobs.title: Web Applications Developer
jobs.content:
Springfield College invites applications for a Web Applications Developer. This position is a member of the Administrative Computing team, within the Information and Technology Services department. This position is tasked with various programming projects designed to facilitate college and customer needs. The primary target platform is the college web portal (PrideNet), which is built upon Jenzabar’s CX/JICS product line. The position also includes development of mobile applications for Apple and Android devices.


The successful candidate will possess an Associate’s degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent certifications and experience. Experience with development tools such as Visual Studio and Xcode is preferred, along with solid programming skills using ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, XML and CSS, accessing Informix or SQL Server databases. Experience with Objective-C, Java, WordPress, PHP/MySQL, C++ and Perl would be considered a plus. Occasional work during non-traditional hours and holidays may be required. Effective oral and written communication skills coupled with excellent customer service is a must.


To apply, please forward by email a resume, cover letter, and the email addresses and phone numbers of three professional references all in one document attached and directed to: Office of Human Resources, hroffice@springfieldcollege.edu.


Springfield College is committed to enhancing diversity and equality in education and employment.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking PHP Software Developers to participate in the implementation of strategic new features for our retail and ecommerce management platform.  This is an exciting position; we are taking a successful platform and expanding upon it with new technologies and third party integrations.  We are also making extensive architectural enhancements to make it better scale to the enterprise.  This is a chance to shine and gain enterprise experience while working with a fantastic team.

jobs.title: Senior Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Senior Performance Engineers proactively look for ways to improve the overall performance of our software products.


As a member of an Agile/scrum project team, performance engineers participate in the application design, requirements and estimation process.   They create master test plans for performance/load and scalability, record/ execute scripts according to plan and record results.


While doing this they are verifying applications are coded according to the non-functional requirements.


Although duties are performed as part of a scrum team structure, you will work independently in accordance with QA procedures and methodologies to insure quality deliverables.


In this truly collaborative environment we welcome your participation in the selection of tools for the QA Team.

jobs.title: Front End / UI Engineer
jobs.content:
Albert.io is accelerating learning outcomes through interactive practice. We are proudly headquartered in Chicago and are looking for frontend / UI engineers to join our quickly-growing team.


ABOUT US



  • We use Javascript everywhere. 

  • Our client application is built with React.js, flux architecture, and a custom framework for achieving isomorphism. We use Sass for styling. 

  • Our API service uses RethinkDB and Hapi.js. 

  • We deploy on Google Cloud using Kubernetes and Docker. 

  • We employ Agile workflows: Weekly sprint planning, daily standups, code reviews for pull requests, and automatic builds and deployments. 

  • We encourage pair programming and frequent collaboration and expose engineers to as much of the code base as possible. 

  • We write tests. 

  • Our native mobile apps are being built with React Native. 

  • Everyone is a passionate learner, down-to-earth, and wicked smart.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Implement web interfaces using HTML5, Sass, React.js, and ES6.

  • Refactor code across the stack. 

  • Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications.
