At Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent.

jobs.title: Sr. JavaScript Web Developer
jobs.content:
Does designing and developing next generation web application products excite you? Then this position is for you. Do you enjoy learning and utilizing cutting edge front-end technologies, are passionate for innovation and looking for an environment that promotes creativity?

Healthfusion is seeking a motivated, energetic and detail-oriented Javascript Web Developer to architect and develop innovative user interface solutions using JavaScript, JSON, Ajax, HTML5 and CSS.  The ideal candidate possesses an expertise in JavaScript and JSON with additional UI/IX design and web development experience.

jobs.title: Frontend Lead Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a senior front-end developer or hands-on development manager to help lead a junior engineering team of 5+ developers as we make the transition to a single-page application via Angular. The title would initially be a technical lead, but the role requires someone who is capable of assuming a manager position after a 2-3 month period. We’re looking for someone with deep JS experience as well as a strong CSC background who can help the team develop more structure around the HTML/CSS/JS code.  This person will also have ownership for custom Sales development, video display and distribution and our mobile web user experience. Any PHP experience would be quite helpful as well since we currently run an nginx/PHP/mySQL stack on AWS, S3 and Akamai. The expectation is that this person would focus on front-end development, but all of our leads are competent full-stack developers and ops savvy.   Furthermore everyone is empowered to explore and implement new ideas and improvements.



Responsibilities:



  •  Lead and mentor a dynamic engineering team of 5+ developers

  •  Design and implement features that wow and excite our users

  •  Help Architect and improve our CSS/HTML/JS framework

  •  Learn about new technologies and share your findings with the team

  •  Take ownership of custom sales solutions, mobile user experience and video playback


Requirement:



  •  5+ years of experience developing complex web applications with pure 

  • JavaScript or a JavaScript framework

  • Deep understand of mobile web technologies and user interface

  • Some operations and full stack (SQL) experience

  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience with Angular or another single page JS framework

  • Mentor other developers to grow and be successful

  • Can create simple and clean solutions to complex problems

  • CSC Degree or equivalent


Nice to have:



  • Experience with PHP frameworks

  • MySQL database

  • AWS operations and deployment

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Our home is our largest purchase and most valuable asset, but it is also the most difficult to buy and sell. Knock is a radical new way to buy or sell a home quickly without risk, stress and uncertainty. We guarantee homeowners that we can sell their home in 6 weeks or less or we buy it for market price. We guarantee buyers that our homes are rock solid with our 200-point home-inspection, certification and extended warranty. Started by founding team members of Trulia.com (acquired by Zillow for $2.5B), Knock is an online home selling platform that uses data science to price homes accurately, technology to sell them quickly and a dedicated team of professionals to guide you every step of the way.

Were looking for a Front End Web Developer to develop and own the consumer facing website and mobile web presence for Knock. We have launched our first version of the site (www.knock.re) and now need a front end expert to take over and ensure we are using the latest frameworks and practices to ensure Knock has a compelling experience. Were looking for someone with strong views who is passionate about creating great products and can drive themselves without lots of supervision.

This is a minimum one month full-time contract experience, but can turn into a continued project for the right person. We are a distributed company with employees in 4 different states, so location is not an issue as long as you have good experience with Slack and Trello.

Responsibilities

  • Building compelling experiences and features for the web client
  • Collaborating with design & product on new interfaces and interactions
  • Implementing product features, releases, and fixes
  • Maintaining build tools, tests, and overall healthy architecture
Requirements

  • Expert in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Expert in Gulp & Webpack built tools. We use a combination of single page app, and static html rendered by the server for SEO purposes
  • Expert plain JS & React.js (we avoid jQuery whenever possible).
  • In depth knowledge of browser workings - history, pop/push-state, localStorage, etc
  • Immutable data structures
  • Experience with various app architectures - flux, redux, om like singleton, etc
  • Knowledge of Express.js (Node.js)
  • Knowledge of Basic HTTP and best web practices
  • Ability to move fluidly between client and Node.js server-side code (server app is minimal)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
Plusses, not required

  • Previous work building universal/isomorphic JavaScript applications
  • Experience with building backend systems - APIs and backend services. Specifically in Node.js or Go
  • Experience with databases & stores - couchDb, MariaDb, dynamoDb & redis
  • Experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

Knock is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

To apply: Apply online here http://knockaway.breezy.hr/p/301205a62288-front-end-web-developer

jobs.title: Senior Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Join an exciting senior team of architects and engineers working on modernizing software engineering at CSOD. You will help build our platform as a service initiative which consists of an entity framework and page layer driven by metadata, glued together by a domain specific language and powered by a service oriented platform. You will take an active role on the team and contribute to the technical design all the way through hands-on development


In this role you will...

jobs.title: Lead Developer in Finance Industry
jobs.content:
This is an exceptional opportunity for an exceptional candidate.  We are seeking a passionate technologist to join us at an inflection point for both our firm and industry as technology is reshaping the investment world.  No experience in finance or investing is required, just a sense of intrigue by all the ways in which technology is disrupting finance, investing, and trading.  You will have a front row seat and take an active part in this transformation.


Technology has always been a central component of our business philosophy.  Technology initiatives are managed by the firm’s Risk and Quantitative Research group, the 3 members of which have deep technical expertise.  The collaborative dynamic of this group is designed to stimulate creativity and provide an environment for each member to maximize personal potential.  There will also be interaction with team members across all groups within the organization – investments, operations, investor relations, and marketing.  We are seeking candidates who have a strong desire and aptitude for learning about all aspects of our business in order to best understand how and where to apply technology most effectively.


Ideal candidates will have demonstrated proficiency in a variety of languages/platforms (preferably C# and/or Python) and have interest in learning new ones.  We believe in utilizing the right tool for the job, so a key part of this role will be ongoing evaluation of new technologies to incorporate into our stack and owning the implementation thereof.  Most of all, the right candidate will have an entrepreneurial attitude, long-term focus, and be excited to grow with the firm.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer - Remote Opportunity within the US
jobs.content:
WHO YOU ARE


Do you enjoy simplifying challenging, technical solutions to solve multiple needs?


Are you a technology evangelist, connecting people who have problems with the right solutions, technology, and knowledge they need to succeed?


Do you possess a skill to effectively educate resources of the technical and non-technical benefits that drive next-generation infrastructure?


WHAT WE DO


Datapipe’s Professional Services engage in next generation cloud solutions for clients and are dedicated to strong success for the client and its customers. As an integral part of the Platform Engineering team, you will work with a talented team of developers responsible for applications that service some of the largest companies in the world utilizing a variety of technologies and framework.


WHAT YOU WILL DO


At Datapipe, our Platform Engineering Team supports our global team of Customer Delivery Engineering, Product Engineering, and Support and Operations to:



  • Eradicate duplicative effort and create consistency in software wherever possible through:

    • Automation design, templating, common library development

    • Process engineering, best practices development

    • Platform evangelism to build up support for a given technology

jobs.title: Director of Software Engineering, Global Network
jobs.content:
Twilio’s Platform Engineering group enables Twilio engineers to rapidly build, deliver, and run global products and services by providing them with compelling, continuously improving platform solutions.  We enable innovation and delight our fellow engineers and customers by providing a low friction, high quality, globally distributed platform at scale.  IaaS, PaaS, build/test/deployment automation, abstraction, access management, and operational insights are some of the solutions we provide across a secure, globally distributed cloud infrastructure.  In short, we are Twilio for Twilio engineers.


About the job:


The Director of Software Engineering, Global Network leads a highly specialized team responsible for designing and operating Twilio’s global network, both physical and software-defined. This leader must possess extensive knowledge of networking hardware, software, and services marketplaces including region-specific solutions.  This role requires comfort and accountability within a fast paced, flexible environment. This leader is a key player in the strategic planning processes for Twilio’s Platform Engineering organization, acting as one of the lead advisors to the Vice President of Engineering.


Areas of emphasis include software-defined networking, network configuration management/automation, team leadership and the execution of engineering activities associated with development, staging, and production environments while ensuring our networks are fully operational, scalable, supportable and sustainable.


The Director of Software Engineering, Global Network is responsible for developing and cultivating relationships with Twilio architects, tech leads, product and engineering managers to determine current and future enterprise network needs and service offerings, ensuring that the organization's needs are met on time and within budget.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and guide a highly technical team of network and software engineers.

  • Develop and deploy network infrastructure plans, both public cloud and O&O.

  • Work with engineering leaders to assure investments in networks are appropriate, compatible with large-scale distributed systems best practices, and can scale and adapt as the business needs evolve.

  • Work with Platform Engineering leadership to develop short and long-term strategic departmental plans that support overall business and technology strategies.

  • Manage a staff of engineers and serve as the team liaison for the hiring process, work allocation, scheduling, training, professional development and performance evaluation.

  • Support projects end-to-end initiated by various clients (internal/external) and business units including new project and client launches, internal technology efforts, and across public cloud and O&O infrastructure.

  • Establish and meet service level agreements for performance, uptime and issue response.

jobs.title: Principal Security Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Principal Product Engineer


Position Overview


The Principal Product Engineer is responsible for continuously protecting our critical information assets, assuring compliance with corporate and regulatory policies & industry best practices, while simplifying, enhancing and enabling business initiatives. This role is responsible for providing technical guidance focused on information security architecture, including all security R&D, analysis and design for all corporate computing systems to prevent unauthorized access from both internal and external perspectives. This role is considered to be a SME in one or more of the information security disciplines supporting the design, implementation and management of the organizations information security architecture.


Key Responsibilities



  • Responsible for the selection, implementation and maintenance of all security tools across the enterprise

  • Partner with Technology teams to implement security solutions and work closely with these teams as alerts and issues are identified and escalated by the MSSP

  • Collaborate with Enterprise Security Architect to design and complete comprehensive security architecture by evaluating existing tools, looking for opportunities to consolidate and/or replace for better coverage and cost efficiencies

  • Serve as the subject matter expert in the tools: (ex. Trend Micro, Beyondtrust, Arcsight, Red Seal, Qualys, Carbon Black, Splunk, Tripwire) and work with the MSSP to ensure optimal efficiencies for their security monitoring

  • Serve as an escalation path for potential alerts from the MSSP

  • Execute and/or coordinate security/vulnerability testing of web-baed applications and associated infrastructure on a regular basis

  • Plan, coordinate and execute incident response activities related to detection, investigation, containment, eradication, recovery, and remediation/mitigation

  • Advise the engineering team about information security threats, technologies and related regulatory requirements

  • Track information security issues to closure by partnering with CISO, communicating solutions, and verifying remediation

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Duties:



  • Work on Fundbox’s newest products from scratch; which will require coming up with prototypes quickly and brainstorming with stakeholders to evolve and drive our upcoming offerings.

  • Develop efficient, reusable, reliable, and scalable software

  • Optimize existing stack and architecture

  • Architect backend, high-concurrency, multithreaded, server-side systems


Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science preferred

  • 4+ years of relevant software engineering experience

  • In-depth experience in Python required

  • Experience with micro-services architecture

  • Experience with relational DBs and Linux environments

  • Experience in AWS

  • Ability to adapt to ongoing iterations and propose solutions quickly

  • Broad architecture and development skills

  • Experience building high-traffic systems

  • Hacker mentality and the ability to work in a fast paced, agile environment

  • Understanding of payment networks and/or payment processing is a plus


Fundbox (https://fundbox.com) is looking for a Backend Engineer to work in our newest group that will focus on brand new initiatives and product development, which is quickly becoming the biggest focus for the business. You’ll be building a product that doesn’t exist in the market. You’ll be dealing with new products to credit SMBs, our current product services sellers but we are now looking to incorporate buyers and expand the credit universe for SMBs.


We believe we’re set up for success because we have the best data in the industry and are extremely well funded. We’ve raised of $100 million from leading Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, finance veterans, and venture capitalists, including: Khosla Ventures, SV Angel, Blumberg Capital, former Citigroup CEO Vikram Pandit and Jeff Bezos.


This will be a full-time position located in our downtown San Francisco office which comes stocked with a full pantry and daily lunch. We are a small, close knit team and enjoy regular team outings and happy hours. If you have a work hard, play hard attitude and love whiskey and hummus you will fit right in; we drink regular whiskey shots to mark company and team milestones.  


We’re experiencing consistent triple-digit quarter-over-quarter growth and are looking for great people to join us in our mission and leave their mark on the company. For more information, visit https://fundbox.com.

jobs.title: Senior Video Streaming Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49552



A lot of companies think they have high streaming traffic but not many can say they stream more than two million videos per day totaling petabytes of data each month. As the Engineering team behind Bloomberg's multimedia operations, we build the back end of the company's multimedia assets on the Web. What we build is used by Bloomberg's multiple TV and radio channels as well as our Video-on-Demand service. With more than 200,000 assets in our library, it's our job to make sure our end users can watch them wherever and whenever they want.

Our team is not just working on the code but also helping with the delivery of the content itself. To do that, we work with the video producers, the front end developers who are building the websites and the delivery networks. Together, we are industry leaders in quality, features and customization. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to learn new technologies and grow your skills. We're constantly learning from each other and always looking for new ways to produce. On our Video team, you will be working with the some of the smartest minds in the industry and helping us stay ahead of the curve.

We'll trust you to:

  • Engineer end-to-end multimedia infrastructure and delivery for web consumption
  • Make improvements to deliver reliable and flexible service for our internal and external users
  • Work independently and as part of a team
  • Own our multimedia generation and delivery


You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience coding in JavaScript
  • Experience with streaming protocols (RTMP, HDS, HLS, DASH)
  • Knowledge of encoding protocols (AAC, H.264, H.265)
  • Experience with a CDN for video streaming
  • Experience working with AWS


We'd love to see:

  • Experience programming in Java
  • Familiarity with Spring Framework
  • Experience using Flash (ActionScript 3 and/or FMS)


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Technology Infrastructure Platform
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49540



Our Team:



Engineering is the cornerstone for on-demand software-defined infrastructure. We are the foundation for all aspects of Hybrid IT for Bloomberg. We are building a next generation Infrastructure-as-a-Service solution that encompasses multiple operating systems, private/public cloud providers and various relational databases.

Our mission is to build a unified self-service platform with flexible APIs to automate all aspects of Infrastructure management. This platform will offer a sophisticated multi-dimensional relationship of resources across our large-scale distributed network. We are adding key features such as continuous integration and deployments to our platform in order to rapidly deliver our services. We need your open source expertise to search our historical configuration snapshots in a responsive and intuitive manner to help us improve our infrastructure.

What's in it for you:



As a senior engineer on the Platform team, you will lead the technical design and development of all aspects of our next generation micro services. You will collaborate with engineers, scrum masters, product owners and program managers across Bloomberg to find innovative solutions for complex problems. You will work with various open source technologies to build creative web UX frameworks, scale DevOps efficiently and implement various RESTful Big Data interfaces for our platform. You will have the opportunity to evolve our core infrastructure and grow to new heights in your career.

You need to have:

  • 4+ years of experience in full stack software engineering
  • Proficiency in C++, Scala, JavaScript, Ruby or Python
  • Familiarity with various database technologies
  • Knowledge of open source DevOps automation tools
  • Exposure to Linux, Windows, Solaris or AIX operating systems
  • The ability to troubleshoot complex and ambiguous problems
  • Experience with high-impact, large-scale backend systems


We'd love to see expertise in:

  • Analysis of various algorithms
  • Development of automation platforms
  • Implementation of web UX frameworks
  • Design of next generation infrastructures
  • Decomposition of large technical problems
  • Operational excellence of hybrid SOA environments
  • Mentorship of technical and non-technical aspects of Engineering


We'll trust you to:

  • Do the right thing
  • Move fast and thoughtfully
  • Collaborate and lead by example
  • Learn from mistakes and be bold
  • Know the customer and work hard


Check out how we're giving back to the open source community:



https://github.com/bloomberg

Apply below and help us build a simple and reliable 'Infrastructure Platform.'

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Hadoop Infrastructure Engineer - Foundational Services
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49874



Many of the most prevalent applications in Bloomberg need real-time data analysis and business intelligence. Instead of using off-the-shelf applications, we use Hadoop and its ecosystem to provide a large-scale data platform with low-latency SLAs and large storage capabilities. This platform has revolutionized the way we manage and analyze data in a distributed environment.

We design software and hardware systems to support low-latency/high volume requests, security, fault tolerance/high availability and easy customization. Our Hadoop Infrastructure Platform is built to fully automate deployment and operations using Chef; developed and open sourced at https://github.com/bloomberg/chef-bach. With hundreds of applications depending on our platform, we are looking to grow our Hadoop Infrastructure team. That's where you come in.

We'll trust you to:

  • Evaluate Hadoop projects across the ecosystem and extend and deploy them to exacting standards (high availability, big data clusters, elastic load tolerance)
  • Develop automation, installation and monitoring of Hadoop ecosystem components in our open source infrastructure stack, specifically HBase, HDFS, Map/Reduce, Yarn, Oozie, Pig, Hive, Tez, Spark and Kafka
  • Dig deep into performance, scalability, capacity and reliability problems to resolve them
  • Create application patterns for integrating internal application teams and external vendors into our infrastructure
  • Troubleshoot and debug Hadoop ecosystem run-time issues
  • Provide developer and operations documentation to educate peer teams


You'll need to have most of the following:

  • Experience building out and scaling a Hadoop-based or UNIX-hosted database infrastructure for an enterprise
  • 2+ years of experience with Hadoop infrastructure or a strong and diverse background of distributed cluster management and operations experience
  • Experience writing software in a continuous build and automated deployment environment


We'd love to see:

  • 2+ years of DevOps or System Administration experience using Chef/Puppet/Ansible for system configuration, or quality shell scripting for systems management (error handling, idempotency, configuration management)
  • In-depth knowledge of low-level Linux, UNIX networking and C system calls for high performance computing
  • Experience with Java, Python or Ruby development (including testing with standard test frameworks and dependency management systems, knowledge of Java garbage collection fundamentals)
  • Experience or exposure to the open source community (a well-curated blog, upstream accepted contribution or community presence)


We want to work with others who are passionate about community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community. If this sounds like you, submit an application, and learn more about the work we do from Clay and Amit's interview at ChefConf2015: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LnMCFxXgDEw

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Cloud Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49658



Our team:



The Platform Engineering team builds infrastructure automation services that focus on configuration management and cloud orchestration. We play an active role in advising other infrastructure engineering teams on the best practices of modern application and infrastructure development.

What's in it for you:



We have a clear roadmap of where we want to be, but we need your expertise in building large-scale distributed systems to develop mission-critical system infrastructure. You will be part of a team that builds the foundation to support a multi-cloud environment. We develop best practices, tools and processes that have a direct impact on how thousands of engineers at Bloomberg interact with infrastructure.

We'll trust you to:

  • Take responsibility for the development and deployment of Bloomberg's platform services
  • Identify and automate manual tasks
  • Implement industry-wide best practices around public and private cloud infrastructure
  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLA for managed infrastructure and systems
  • Help replace legacy systems with modern, Internet-scale design patterns


You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience working on highly available, fault-tolerant distributed systems
  • A strong understanding of operating systems and the nuances of Linux
  • Experience with datacenter network troubleshooting including IP fundamentals, DNS, load balancing, proxies and firewalls
  • Familiarity with configuration management systems such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible
  • Proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Python, Ruby, C/C++, Go or Java
  • A solid understanding of the modern software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes such as Continuous Integration and delivery


We'd love to see:

  • Expertise in analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems
  • A deep understanding of web operations and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, Google)
  • Knowledge of network and application performance analysis using standard UNIX tools
  • Experience with maintaining and managing a community around open source software


Does this sound like you?



Great, apply today! We want to work with others who are passionate about community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community.
Learn more about the work we do using the links below:

https://github.com/bloomberg/collectd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/kafka-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/confd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/kubernetes-cluster-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/zookeeper-cookbook

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content:
You have the unique opportunity to build a technology team from the ground-up for one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in the food delivery space.


SnackNation is a different kind of B2B SaaS – Snacking as a Service that is.  The Company currently delivers a curated, healthy snacking experience to more than 2,000 of the most innovative businesses across America, all on a membership/recurring basis. As the “Snacking Marketplace for Millennials,” SnackNation is connecting the top, emerging CPG brands with previously inaccessible consumers, and is democratizing the CPG landscape.


We are looking for a hands-on VP of Engineering / CTO with experience leading teams and interfacing with stakeholders to solve the complex operational challenges that SnackNation faces today.


Reporting to the COO, you will have the opportunity to build your own team to expand upon our platform to solve the technology challenges of tomorrow: providing insights to brands, product recommendations to customers, and building a direct-to-consumer relationship through eCommerce & mobile.


Skills:



  • You love to code. And you really love to code in Ruby.

  • On every system you work on, you understand the architecture as a whole, and you’re always striving to improve it.

  • You have a firm grasp of the SDLC and Agile methodologies. You can capture functional requirements in meetings with stakeholders and convert them into clear technical specifications, specifically with UML.

  • You know how to plan resources and set a delivery schedule for your team to meet stakeholder requirements and deliver software on time.


Experience:



  • Significant experience with Ruby on Rails in a professional environment.

  • At least 6 years of overall experience writing software in a professional environment, with significant exposure to Ruby on Rails and Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) tools.

  • Experience overseeing other engineers in a formal management role.

  • Hands-on experience in operations in a Linux environment at some point in your career, demonstrating your ability to deploy and debug a running system (outside deploying via Capistrano or Heroku).

  • Experience with AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or other cloud platform.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Production Developer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49896



The Infrastructure Production group in Engineering delivers a wide range of technologies to support Bloomberg's development environment. We build out common services that every engineering team can use to monitor, visualize and diagnose their applications and infrastructure. We implement modern technology ideology in the organization and assist all teams with implementation, automation and design.

We are a new team at Bloomberg and one of the most widely used across the entire company. On our team, you'll be part of a large cultural shift within the company. If you like working with large scale systems and grappling with billions of data points a day, ask us where to sign up.

We'll trust you to:

    • Design, architect, automate and deliver large scale production-ready services
    • Build internal tools to monitor, visualize and diagnose all aspects of Bloomberg applications and hardware
    • Work closely with our product and platform teams on their architecture, design and scaling


challenges
  • Help teams replace legacy software and design patterns with modern technologies
  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLAs for managed infrastructure




You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience building similar systems
  • Experience with large scale data processing and automating and implementing large-scale fault-tolerant distributed systems
  • Knowledge of physical hardware and provisioning processes
  • Familiarity with open source software


Common Tools we use:

  • Ruby/Go/Python/Java
  • Linux
  • Kafka
  • Hadoop/Zookeeper/HBase
  • Mesos
  • Icinga/OpenTSDB
  • Chef
  • Spark


Does this sound like you? Great, apply today! We want to work with people who are passionate about community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community. Learn more about the work we do using the links below:

https://github.com/bloomberg/collectd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/kafka-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/confd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/zookeeper-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/redis-cookbook
https://github.com/acaiafa/mesos

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed desktop computing service in the cloud. Amazon WorkSpaces allows customers to easily provision cloud-based desktops that allow end-users to access the documents, applications and resources they need with the device of their choice, including laptops, iPad, Kindle Fire, Android tablets, and zero clients. With a few clicks in the AWS Management Console, customers can provision a high-quality cloud desktop experience for any number of users at a cost that is highly competitive with traditional desktops and half the cost of most virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solutions.

To If you like to work in massively scalable distributed systems, networking protocols for real time presentation remoting and opportunities to work on multiple client technologies then join our team to help build Amazon's Desktop-As-A-Service offering! We aim to bring a desktop experience to modern form factors (mobile, desktop) with a native experience for end-users, and a simple and cost-effective way to provision and manage these desktops for IT administrators, leveraging world’s largest public cloud!



As a member of Workspace development team, you will have opportunities to work on several technology area from Workspace core service that provisions desktops, provides secure access to the provisioned desktops, develop and optimize network protocols for display and IO remoting and client software on IOS, Android and Windows, on various form factors. You will also build functionality that allows admins to scale their fleet, and manage it effectively. You will work on challenges such as reducing the time it takes to provision virtual desktops, enhance the management capabilities of the console while maintaining its simplicity, building internal and external APIs, and building tools for data collection, analysis and monitoring to improve customer experience and smooth operation. From a customer point of view, it is an opportunity to delight our customers in both experience and simplicity. From an engineering perspective, it is a great opportunity to build distributed systems, using industry leading AWS constructs such as EC2, EBS,


  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

  • 8+ years of industry experience managing large scale software application products.

  • The ability to dive deep to understand all layers of a web services technology stack

  • Work experience with project management tools.



Experience building client applications for mobile and desktop environments.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a talented web developer with a passion for what you do and a desire to own projects start-to-finish?  Do you thrive in small environments and truly enjoy collaboration?   Can you handle the elasticity of goals inherent in start-ups while still being mindful of the big picture?


If you answered an emphatic yes to all of the above, then we need to talk!

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49213



We love a challenge. The Open Software Frameworks team is building a variety of products used by both independent software vendors and in-house developers. Our diverse portfolio of products includes Application Portal (Bloomberg's app store), Geo Spatial Mapping platform and IDE used to build Bloomberg Terminal applications. We are contributing to a number of cutting-edge open source projects.

Based on the breadth of our work, you will need to be a strong full stack developer. You strive to design, implement and support the ideal solution. Balance between elegant design and system performance and reliability is always at the front of your mind. Our clients have tight deadlines, so we do, too. You will have the opportunity to work closely with our users, UX and Product teams.

You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience programming in C/C++
  • 3+ years of experience with HTML5, CSS and JavaScript
  • Strong OOD/OOP skills and experience applying modern design patterns
  • Knowledge of algorithms, standard data structures and multithreading


We would love to see:

  • Experience with C#, .Net internals and WPF
  • Experience developing distributed systems in a Windows or Linux environment
  • Familiarity with and understanding of an Agile methodology


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer for MARS Team
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49176



Bloomberg L.P. revolutionized the financial industry 35 years ago by introducing the power of technology. Now there is a 700 trillion USD derivative industry in need of better tools and automation to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our team is building a one-stop solution to bring transparency, efficiency, and excellence to market professionals.

The Multi Asset Risk System (MARS) team works extensively with groups across the company including trading systems, quantitative teams, pricing and market data teams and business management. You will solve large-scale distributed computation problems by bringing together billions of data points in an efficient and fault-tolerant fashion. You will apply broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop analytics.

What's in it for you:



You will work at the intersection of technology, finance and mathematics. C++ on UNIX is our weapon of choice, but we also dabble in Java, Scala, Python and JavaScript when needed. You will be part of a team that applies unique technical solutions to analytical and algorithmic problems. Finally, you will get exposure to market expertise by collaborating with business managers, financial engineers and quantitative researchers.

We'll trust you to:

  • Design, code, implement and test new features of the MARS and Bloomberg Valuation (BVAL) platforms (mostly C++)
  • Work with product managers to translate and understand product specifications
  • Run projects - including estimation, scheduling, milestone creation, risk management and status reporting


You'll need to have:

  • 2+ years of software engineering experience in object-oriented programming such as C++, Java, C#
  • Strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with or interest in full software development life cycle activities - requirements management, technical design, implementation, testing/release
  • Familiarity with multi-threading
  • Interest in learning finance


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Crest Financial is looking for a new Project Manager. Recently honored as the 2nd FASTEST GROWING COMPANY IN UTAH by Utah Business Magazine, Crest Financial is an industry leader in No Credit Needed financing throughout the U.S., located in Draper, Utah. The role of the Project Manager is to plan, execute and finalize complex technical projects according to deadlines and within budget. This includes, acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultant in order to deliver projects according to plan. The Project Manager will work with Business and Technical representatives to define the projects objectives and oversee quality control throughout the projects lifecycle.


Daily Expectations:

  • Direct and manage project lifecycle from beginning to end.
  • Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
  • Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.
  • Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
  • Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.
  • Work with Business and Technical representatives to estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with required resources in the business.
  • Complete Business Analysis tasks as required to support projects and task.
  • Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders.
  • Delegate tasks and responsibilities to appropriate personnel.
  • Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team.
  • Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.
  • Track project milestones and deliverables.
  • Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
  • Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.
  • Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.
  • Other duties assigned as needed.

Benefits


Benefits and Compensation:

  • Highly Competitive Base Salary
  • Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage
  • 401K, Unlimited Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Casual Dress Code

Founded in 2005, Crest has been able to achieve success due to our awesome employees that believe in our mission statement of "...provide Families with No Credit Needed financing through selected Retail partnerships". We truly believe in helping our customers and retailers nationwide with options that they normally wouldn't have access to! We are looking for individuals that are up for the challenge in helping us not just maintain but exceed our past growth!

A truly Employee-Centered company, Crest Financial believes in hiring the right people, for the right job, and giving them the creative freedom to use their strengths to benefit the team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Business Systems
jobs.content:
Cisco Meraki is looking for a talented and motivated Business Systems Developer to join the Meraki Engineering team based in San Francisco.  Cisco Meraki is data-driven, and you will be on the cutting edge of developing systems that work seamlessly together.


Inthis role you will have a chance to utilize, and learn, a variety of different technologies including Ruby on Rails, PHP, Java and others. You will work closely with operations, sales, and marketing on high visibility projects that impact the entire business unit.


This is an excellent opportunity for someone with 2+ years experience who wants to work on  interesting and challenging engineering problems at a fast-paced San Francisco tech company.  You will learn how business decisions are made, and play an integral role in developing the business processes.

jobs.title: Front End Web Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Why This is a Unique Career Opportunity



  • Fully remote position

  • Fast growing startup with a small team (Thousands of customers in over 120 countries with just 9 employees).  Super rare!

  • Profitable company since 2010 with no outside funding.  This means we answer to customers, not investors :).  It also means that we are financially strong and not waiting for another round of investment.

  • A chance to build the mobile app from the ground up.

  • Chance to be involved in other exciting areas such as API, Integrations, and Native Clients.

  • Build something that thousands of companies will use.  It’s possible that some of your favorite companies are already customers.

  • More work around the world will get done in a better way because of your efforts. 


Overview


TeamGantt is one of the fastest growing project management applications right now.  Adding a new mobile application will be a big part in continuing growth of the product and expanding the use and engagement of current users. Currently there is only a very stripped down mobile site that unfortunately has not received the attention it deserves. You, as the mobile developer will play the very important role of building the TeamGantt mobile app from the ground up.  The idea is to make a companion type app to the full product on www.teamgantt.com.  We are not necessarily looking to recreate the entire gantt/schedule capabilities on a mobile device, as that could be hard to achieve on a smaller screen.  However, the types of features that we are looking to build out include : users being able to open up the app and see what they should be working on that day, update their progress, comment on tasks, view the status of their projects, track their time, etc. We are a small team doing big things.  We are currently just a team of nine people, but making a big dent in the project management space.  If you enjoy avoiding office politics, corporate ladders, and long meetings, then this is the place for you.  TeamGantt is a place for people to focus on their craft and to enjoy their work.  You can work from home or a nearby coffee shop.  Any quiet work environment that allows you to focus for extended periods of time is good with us. Responsibilities



  • First project will be to build out a high quality app that works on both iOS and Android by using React Native or similar technology.

  • Continually improve the mobile app to increase usage metrics and engagement

  • You will be the lead developer and own the mobile experience for TeamGantt

  • Because we are a small team, there are also opportunities to wear multiple hats and work on the marketing site and other areas of TeamGantt application.

  • Other opportunities include, native clients, integrations, and web application work.


Benefits



  • Fully Remote - Work from anywhere

  • $5,000 office setup budget for computer, proper chair, desk, etc..

  • Competitive Pay

  • 401k

  • Bonus

  • Be a part of a small team that makes some big accomplishments

  • Fun, friendly company

  • One or two company wide get togethers per year.  This year included mini-golf and a fishing charter on the Chesapeake Bay.  February was a trip to the Poconos with skiing, snowboarding, snow tubing, laser tag, zip lines, and fun things for families and children that came along.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Title: Software EngineerLocation: Portland, ORReports to: Sr. Manager, Software Engineering


JOB FUNCTION


The Software Engineer delivers solutions to internal and external customers. This includes the design, modification, development and implementation of software programming applications. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected, as well as an understanding of business needs and requirements.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Modifies, writes and documents software programming applications.

  • Consults with clients to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features and input and output requirements.

  • Works with stakeholders to understand problem statements and suggest possible implementations.

  • Demonstrates personal ownership and takes accountability for larger assigned tasks.

  • Designs and codes screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs and interfaces with other systems.

  • Converts designs and specifications into computer code.

  • Compiles code into programs and corrects errors detected in compile process.

  • Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises programs.

  • Consults with client to prototype, refine, test and debug programs to meet needs.

  • Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems or questions about programs.

  • May train end users or technical support staff to use programs.

jobs.title: Backend Developer / System Administrator / DevOps
jobs.content:
(Please note that we are currently only considering candidates who live in North America.)


This is a full time position with a dynamic, education-focused software company.


We make numerous web applications as well as desktop and mobile applications. Our catalog includes: Starry Night (starrynight.com), The Layered Earth (layeredearth.com) and SkySafari (skysafariapp.com).


We are looking for an up-and-coming superstar System Administrator / DevOps Engineer / Backend Developer to manage day-to-day maintenance, development, server restructuring and service upgrades.


The position is available via telecommuting, but a candidate based in the Montreal, QC area or Minneapolis, MN may be preferred.


We're looking for someone who isn't necessarily senior, but probably not looking for a first job either.


As the Systems Administrator / DevOps Engineer you would:


- Manage AWS setups including OpsWorks, EC2, CloudFront, Lambda, RDS and others.


- Take care of DNS and other cloud services that Simulation Curriculum uses
- Build web tools for internal use with PHP/Python/SQL/HTML/CSS/JavaScript
- Help design and improve our server hierarchy by doing research on different technologies and services that we could utilize


- Remotely manage OS X colocated machines.
- Assist in improving our current database structure
- Maintain our existing servers and services
- Improve our logging and problem detection strategies
- Write shell scripts to automate some of the server tasks
- Manage server security and backup


- Assist in testing new software and software updates that rely on back-end services
- Assist in maintaining our websites and web services
- Implement new websites/services and suggest improvements where possible

The Software Engineer delivers solutions to internal and external customers. This may include the design, modification, development and implementation of software programming applications. jobs.title: Software Developer - Excel/VSTO/SQL
jobs.content:
eAlchemy is looking for a smart, curious, and motivated Excel/VBA/VSTO developer to help our clients raise their productivity to new heights. Projects with our clients vary quite a bit, but they nearly always involve a wide array of data sources and types. We typically use a front-end/back-end architecture where the UI is often Excel. Projects are typically small to medium, generally lasting from a week to three months.

Our service mentality sets us apart with our clients, and to be a successful member of our team you have to enjoy helping people. Our ideal candidate loves the challenge of software development, but not as its own end- they're interested in the business challenges as much as the code because that's where the real value is created. The best candidates will have great skills and experiences and be comfortable sharing these with their peers.

We're based in Petaluma, CA, and it will be necessary for you to come to our office a minimum of 2 days/wk (currently Monday and Wednesday). Please make sure you're willing to make that commitment prior to applying. For outstanding non-local candidates, a relocation stipend can be provided.

This position requires relocation within 50 miles of the San Francisco Bay Area.

Finally, we're not looking to work with other tech services companies, so please don't solicit our business.

Please don't email us. Instead, apply here.

Desired Personal Characteristics

  • Smart and Curious- You're very smart, but more importantly, you're driven to understand how things work. You listen well because you want to understand the person and the problem better.
  • Accountable- You always feel personally responsible for the the success of everything you're affiliated with- quality, timelines, and budgets. You own the success and failures because you're passionate about success today and into the future.
  • Constructive- You're focused on positive outcomes for the team above all else. Ego takes a back seat. You project a positive energy and demonstrate awareness and concern for how you and the work you put forward is perceived.
  • Resilient & Flexible- You're very comfortable in an ever-changing and ambiguous world, comfortable admitting when you don't have the answer. Conversely, you should be savvy enough to know when failure is an acceptable outcome of measured risks.
  • Service-minded- You have an innate desire to help others. You want everyone around you to be better, work better and enjoy more.
  • Innovative- Innovation is driven by perceptiveness and creativity. Your curiosity, attention, and ability to cull masses of information enable you to see things that others don't- patterns, anommolies, and pitfalls. And, in really understanding the challenge at hand, you're able to apply creative solutions that address the real issue.

About eAlchemy

We're good people. To some, that doesn't matter much, but to us it's what matters most. It's the source of our growth--good people like to work with good people. We take our jobs, but not ourselves, seriously. We like to have fun, and we love helping other people solve their problems. Though we have high expectations and hire only great people, we're also fair, open, and honest. We'll accept nothing less from you!

Our benefits include medical, HSA, paid time off (20 day/year for FT employees), paid holidays (9 days/yr), bonus program and a flexible schedule.

About Our Business

eAlchemy is a small and soundly profitable technology consultancy based in Petaluma, CA. Founded in 2009, we've seen tremendous growth, and we are hiring in anticipation of sustained growth into the forseeable future. We generally work with medium and large businesses, including several Fortune 500 companies--some of the most recognizable names in the Bay Area and beyond. Our customers span many industries (recruiting, retail clothing, and electronics), and we offer our expertise to help them use technology and data to solve problems and drive operational excellence.

Our team has a diverse set of technology skills, but our expertise is most evident in the practical application of them. Our core focus is building applications for business operations. We typically work with Excel, VBA, .NET, SQL Server, and various other platforms. As necessary, we utilize partnerships we've developed over the years to complement our own skill sets.


Benefits


Our benefits include medical, HSA, paid time off (20 day/year for FT employees), paid holidays (9 days/yr), bonus program and a flexible schedule.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Frontend
jobs.content:
Software Engineers at Minted demonstrate true user empathy and are committed to helping build an online design marketplace as beautiful as the products themselves. We are seeking well-rounded people who have a passion for user experience and a background building rich, scalable, javascript web applications. Your work will push the boundaries of what’s possible with the modern web, using technologies like Node.js, React, SVG, and WebGL. You will help grow our customer base and support a community of independent designers by creating cutting edge, browser-based experiences.


Specific Responsibilities



  • Improve our front-end codebase by developing modular, performant, and maintainable Javascript e-commerce web applications.



  • Participate in front-end architecture design that will help increase developer velocity and drive growth through Minted’s e-commerce platform.



  • Collaborate with a world-class product development team to create a beautiful and highly usable website



  • Provide insight into current best practices for front-end web development and help to drive decisions around framework and tool choices



  • Build efficient and reusable front-end abstractions and systems



  • Monitor, identify, and squash browser performance bottlenecks



  • Work with cutting edge front-end technologies like Node.js, WebGL, Flux, React, SVG, ES6, Gulp, and Webpack

jobs.title: C#, VB.Net, Winforms, WPF Developer
jobs.content:
PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:
The .NET/WINFORMS/WPF developer performs with minimal direction a variety of roles in the creation and maintenance of moderate to highly-complex solutions (including data infrastructure, reporting, and applications) that address the informational and analytical needs of Brokerage and Trading Services group.  These roles stem from all phases of the project lifecycle and include requirements gathering, solution design, application development, and system testing. 
 
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Works closely with Fixed Income Trading Staff to expose informational, analytical, or workflow-optimizing needs. Regularly and independently interacts with business partners of varying associate/management levels to ensure clarity of the problem/opportunity and elicit business requirements. Estimates the size of the effort required to complete complex, moderate to large scale projects.

Analyzes, documents, designs, prototypes, implements, and maintains solutions that address business needs and achieve strategic goals. This may include analyzing, documenting, researching, processing and administering investment data; analyzing, documenting, developing and deploying reports; and/or analyzing, documenting, designing, creating, and testing software applications.

Executes and manages all aspects and phases of testing initiatives for moderate to large-sized system implementations and/or enhancement projects.  Responsibility may include test data setup and coordination of effort and resources/testers throughout unit, system, and user acceptance testing.  Participates in the development of user documentation and manuals, training material, and/or job aids.  Supports initial implementation of significant system changes

Assists in the support of systems, including taking responsibility for the resolution of low to moderately complex on-call issues, monitoring the system, and communicating with the vendors regarding problems, to ensure the system is functioning. Investigates, diagnoses, isolates, and de-bugs issues and performs problem resolution.  Documents resolution appropriately.  Escalates issue to Solutions Consultants, Sr. Solutions Consultants, Project Leads, or Project Managers if a solution cannot be determined.

Mentors and coaches less experienced Solutions Analysts and less experienced associates across the firm.

Continuously seeks to expand knowledge of Investments practice and theory to create efficiencies and/or mitigate risk via people/process/technology changes for the business.

jobs.title: Senior Security Engineer  Incident/Threat Intelligence
jobs.content:
The Sr Security Engineer is responsible for assuring compliance with corporate and regulatory policies/standards & industry best practices, while simplifying, enhancing and enabling business initiatives. The Sr Security Engineer is responsible for developing and utilizing information security threat research sources to collect, store, assemble and evaluate leading edge technology related threats.


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop, utilize and share a wide variety of research sources to create a team wide intelligence base of information, from which to draw inferences and summaries.

  • Assist in the identification and communication of trends, providing recommendations to business counterparts and leadership, regarding OUTR related threats.

  • Responsible for providing technical leadership and expert level consultative services focused on Threat Intelligence. Ensure that all layers of the network and application infrastructure integrate in a secure fashion.

  • Develop and utilize standard processes, techniques, and procedures to collect, review, process, and evaluate intelligence information from a variety of internal and external sources, including Law Enforcement and private/public industry security associations.

  • Use creative methodologies and technologies to develop and communicate trends, patterns, profiles, estimates, and tactical interdiction information as well as to solve unusual problems related to threats with a direct or indirect impact to the brand, business operations, technology infrastructure and client trust.

  • Work with the Enterprise Risk group to conduct company-wide risk analysis assessments to determine/forecast potential risk exposures.

  • Proactively use intelligence information to develop, design, communicate and implement countermeasures and assess the criticality of countermeasures.

  • Prepare reports, assessments, materials for publications, statistical or financial summaries and other material concerning Threat and Intelligence program operations.

  • Lead and execute Information Security projects related to Threat and Intelligence. Develop, execute on and communicate project tasks, timelines, and status information.

  • Stay current with information security trends and provide intelligence in the areas of intrusion techniques, social engineering, technology, and security specific solutions.

  • Participate as a member of the Security Incident Response Team, acting as a security first responder.

jobs.title: Sick of embedded waterfall? Be agile
jobs.content: Are you sick of your company's waterfall SDLC?  Join us and create well-tested embedded C++ code for a PID-feedback-controlled rechargeable jet injector (the Star Trek hypospray, but better).  Do _real_ agile development in an embedded medical-device environment.  We use Google Test & Mock, behave, we can run tests on emulated hardware, and we have a physical test rig running a TeamCity agent.

jobs.title: DevOps Specialist
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer with a passion for problem solving, web frameworks, database design and *NIX. If you love web servers, creative application development and open source platforms, this job may be for you.


Central Responsibilities:


• write back-end code, using TDD
• collaborate with front-end developers, designers and tech profressionals
• resolve complex problems, often unexpected and time-critical, related to web systems
• build and scale user-focused web applications
• design relational databases with SQL (mostly on MySQL)
• help build secure, stable and reliable web environments
• install, configure and maintain all supported LAMP environments

jobs.title: Atlassian Agile Tools Admin
jobs.content:
The Agile Project Tools Admin will focus on enterprise applications used to support our Product teams and our Program Management Office.  This position will play an integral role in improving the way priceline.com employees work on a daily basis.  

This role will engage with internal and external partners to understand how to best utilize Agile tools and increase Agile's business value. 

Responsibilities

  • Maintain and improve the Atlassian suite of products, specifically JIRA, Confluence, and Service Desk, and assorted add-ons and related software
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions consistent with industry best practices: workflows, issues, screens, permissions, roles, notifications
  • Provide application support and advanced troubleshooting
  • Standardize and consolidate application solutions and processes, where feasible, across the organization
  • Develop training materials for JIRA, Confluence, and Agile and deliver training to internal customers
  • Assist internal customers in the adoption of Agile process and help to build cohesion and gain buy-in for in our toolsets
  • Assist users in measuring Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) performance to drive continuous performance

Detailed Qualifications

  • The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Agile PLM technologies.
  • Deep knowledge of managing Atlassian Cloud software (especially JIRA, Confluence, and Service Desk) in a large, Agile organization
  • Experience managing Atlassian Server software (particularly, Bitbucket, Bamboo)
  • Deep knowledge and experience of Agile and best practices for Scrum and Kanban
  • Advanced experience measuring team productivity and report metrics: execution, performance, benefits, and value
  • Experience using Atlassian's toolset to support and teach practices like Iteration Planning, Prototyping, Release Planning, Retrospectives, Writing User Stories and Acceptance Criteria, Velocity-based Planning, Continuous Delivery, Behavior-Driven Development
  • 3+ yrs experience with design, installation, configuration, and support of Atlassian JIRA & Confluence
  • 1 - 2 years of experience with Lean methodologies
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
  • PLUS: Experience helping organizations transition their development processes to Agile, Scrum, or other Lean methodology
  • PLUS: Automated testing technologies in an Agile software development environment

What does success look like?

  • The cycle time of your internal customers will decrease as their quality levels increase.
  • Internal customers will view you as an ally and a center of deep knowledge who they can come to in order to increase their productivity.
  • Better development of a workforce who has the tools and the knowledge to do their jobs with greater efficiency.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


Responsible for maintaining, enhancing and operating Nsight's external web sites and web service platforms. Employee assists in building and improving our software in a timely and prudent manner to support product development and back-office operations.


Responsibilities & Duties:



  1. Provide business analysis to development projects.

  2. Provide detailed system design across multiple hardware and software platforms: Linux, Windows Servers, and Oracle.

  3. Develop business solutions using the following tool set: Java, C#.Net, PHP, JavaScript, JBoss/Wildfly, Hibernate, Ember, RESTful WS, PL-SQL, MySQL, T-SQL, Windows, Linux, and shell scripting.

  4. Support productions system through bug maintenance and on-call duties.

  5. Performs related duties as requested or required.

jobs.title: Mobile Software Developer
jobs.content:
Ubiquisoft Technologies is seeking a full time Mobile Software Developer (iOS and Android) to join our development team.


As a member of our team you will design and build the next generation of software for Ubiquisoft clients and in-house products.  From apps that count chicken eggs up to ones used by commercial pilots, the software you develop will be diverse.  From initial product concept to production support this position encompasses the full development lifecycle.  Each developer works in a private windowed office at our location in Germantown, TN.

jobs.content:
For our office in Munich FidorTecS AG is looking to hire a qualified and highly motivated 


Senior Technical Project Manager (m/f)


in full time. Fidor is a leading innovator for digital financial services and helps to create better banking for a digital world. Furthermore, fidorOS – a digital banking and community middleware solution – is the true enabler of that next generation banking. For its disruptive approach of banking, its FinTech activity and innovative use of social media Fidor has received several international awards.


Your Tasks



  • Own the technical part of complex projects for our international clients independently, and be responsible for project, production, budget and resource allocation planning

  • Create innovative concepts and deliver pitches to prospective clients

  • Be responsible for the end to end delivery of technical solutions, based on our Fidor software products, 

  • in time, in budget and with expected quality

  • Be the interface between clients, business and the engineering & product teams

  • Create effective strategies and develop appropriate recommendations to ensure project success through successful delivery

  • Understand, collaborate and motivate your colleagues

  • Perform effective project risk management and maintain risk transparency

  • Be a key driving force when it comes to ideas, services and products to implement the technical parts for our clients

  • Define, extend and implement the lean and efficient technical project management workflows we will use

  • Actively participate in the development of the company 

  • Participate in the training of junior tram members by sharing knowledge and experience

jobs.title: Programmer
jobs.content:
Programmer


Due to our  expansion, we are searching for a talented forward-looking Programmer. While we don’t expect you to come to work in a suit and tie we do need you to have a ‘can do’ attitude and be a team player. You will work in a highly security-oriented and rapid on-demand development environment.


We need someone who is productive and highly motivated, someone who is flexible and can communicate effectively with fellow programmers and leadership.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As an Engineer at a Rocket company you help launching successful startup companies all over the world. Whatever technologies, languages, or development environments you’ve been using, we expect you have mastered them in depth. 

If scale and speed of execution is exciting to you, if you are passionate about your craft and if you are striving to build systems that matter to millions of people around the world, one of our Rocket Companies will be the right place for you!

Join one of our most exciting projects as a Software Engineer, in order to build the next successful startup across the globe.


What they offer:



  • Highly professional and dynamic IT team



  • Profit from the broad expertise and multiculturality of your team members



  • Core development and optimization of your company's website



  • Autonomous development and implementation of new features to bring the website to the next level



  • Agile, cross-functional team with lots of responsibility on the team level

jobs.title: Software Development Manager - Virtual Systems Team
jobs.content:
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even image yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.


Amazon Robotics is seeking a talented and motivated Software Development Manager to join our Virtual Systems organization. The Virtual Systems team builds high fidelity simulation and emulation environments that are used to qualify software at scale, simulate new Fulfillment Center designs, and enable innovation in Fulfillment Center automation. The manager will provide technical guidance and leadership on the delivery of our Virtual Systems, drive technical programs from architecture to release, and manage, recruit and train software development engineers.

jobs.title: Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
The Systems Administrator will play a critical role in the automation, provisioning, administration and configuration management of Parametric's IT infrastructure. Our goal is to ensure high systems availability, rapid provisioning, and capacity management.


Parametric's suite of software is dynamic which requires continual innovation and rapid provisioning. The Systems Administrator will specifically work within the tooling needed to move Parametric products through staged environments between development and production while supporting full framework throughout each products lifecycle. The Systems Administrator will need to contribute and maintain system standards, research/test new approaches for automation whereby we can leverage new and existing applications for speed and consistency.

Primary Responsibilities



  • Support staff in executing, testing and rolling-out solutions.

  • Transitioning projects from development to production and performing all system operations activities within the projects life-cycle.

  • Responsibilities of system operations management include all phases of SA engineering; provisioning, operation, support, maintenance, research & development and decommissioning.

  • Support deployment infrastructure spanning Windows and Linux systems

  • Configure, deploy, and support third party open source tools such as RabbitMQ, Elastic search/Kibana stack, HAProxy, Logstash, Couchbase, Hortonworks/Hadoop

  • Develop and improve operational practices and procedures

  • Deploy and manage monitoring/alerting platforms

  • Work with the Development, QA, and Operations teams to ensure adequate level of health monitoring for all production systems, including hardware, server components and deployed applications.

jobs.title: Developer Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Hello, I'm Danny Schreiber, the director of marketing at Zapier. We're a fast-growing, fully remote company changing the way people work. More than one million individuals have turned to our tool to integrate their apps  Zapier connects over 600 services, such as Trello, Dropbox and MailChimp  and build automated workflows that help them reclaim their time.

Shortly after our launch in 2012, we unveiled the Zapier Developer Platform to let any app maker integrate with Zapier. Since that time, companies like Slack, Todoist and Typeform have used the platform. By year's end, we'll have more than 1,000 partnersdouble the number we had in January.

Now, we're looking hire a Developer Marketing Manager dedicated to our Developer Platform to help us build an exceptional user experience for our rapidly growing community. This new position will be at the center of improving education and marketing materials for our partners and their user bases.

Here are some things you might do: 

* Create content that reaches new partners and developers
* Build a lifecycle marketing campaign that strengthens partner relationships
* Launch new Developer Platform products and features
* Evangelize the power of Zapier to the broader SaaS community
* Maintain the Developer Platform style guide

jobs.content:
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

As an Amazon Robotics Software Engineer on the Movement Services Team, you will be part of an exciting, diverse team that is responsible for the movement of the robotic drive units in an Amazon fulfillment center. You will own key components of critical, high availability software services as part of the drive movement subsystem. You will collaborate cross-functionally to define clear requirements, deliverables, and test cases in an exciting, highly innovative environment.

jobs.title: Marketing Specialist
jobs.content:
Hello! I'm Danny Schreiber with the marketing team at Zapier. We're looking for someone who's eager to help rapidly grow our user base of 1M+, create content that helps customers succeed, and build meaningful relationships with partners.

We're a 100% remote teamlocated across 10 time zonesand though we each have our own roles, we take time to help each other learn new skills and strategies.

Zapier is just about 50 people today and growing. We get together 2-3 per year for a company retreat (next one is in August in Whistler, British Columbia), and benefits include great healthcare, dental and vision coverage, 401k retirement plan with company match, profit sharing and 14 weeks paid leave for new parents.
