If you are interested in making a big impact on a fast-moving and tight-knit creative team then we'd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a motivated, self-starting full stack senior software developer with a focus on UI, who is interested in working with Big Data.


As a Senior Software Engineer within the Enterprise Technology Platform Group, Data Fusion environment you will be part of a leading edge engineering team that is developing an enterprise integration software helping Thomson Reuters customers integrate their data with the Thomson Reuters Knowledge Graph.

jobs.title: Brooklyn Based Team Lead to Join MIT and NYU Researchers
jobs.content:
Do you like creating and building successful Big Data platforms from scratch? Do you enjoy coaching and leading your team to victory? Are you looking for an ambitious new project to test and grow your skills?


 Come join our brand new, and well-funded, start-up to revolutionize data collection for a wide range of studies extending from health and behavior to education, employment and consumer finances.


We are seeking an experienced and outstanding leader to head our software development team for our Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution for Big Data collection, verification and operations. This PaaS solution will be used in research panels, and it includes mobile apps (Android, iOS) and back-end systems for data ingestion, processing and integration with 3rd party data sets. This solution will be first deployed in the Kavli HUMAN Project (http://kavlihumanproject.org) that is to launch in NYC in early 2017.


 The Human Project, Inc. (HPI) is a brand-new and exciting start-up in Big Data and Predictive Analytics space, called . HPI was founded by world-class researchers from NYU and MIT, and it is developing a revolutionary data collection and analysis platform that will disrupt longitudinal research.


We offer a competitive salary, benefits and equity in this brand new company.


The Software Development Lead will report to Chief Measurement & Technology Officer, and will lead all software development efforts. Key responsibilities include:



  • Create strategy, architecture and roadmap for the PaaS platform and execute on this roadmap,

  • Lead and manage software development and QA teams for mobile apps and back-end systems,

  • Provide technical leadership for the development team,

  • Ensure engineering excellence to deliver robust, secure, scalable and high performance solutions & enhancements in a timely manner,

  • Establish software development lifecycle management best practices,

  • Work closely with operations and data analytics teams to ensure ease-of-use and optimal effectiveness for the platform,

  • Develop key relationships with stakeholders to align platform with both scientific and commercial objectives, and participate in decision making,

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to improve system capabilities and maximize development efficiency.


Company will not offer sponsorship.

jobs.title: WDE II - AWS Website
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Our team builds and runs the suite of systems powering http://aws.amazon.com/. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.


You will find challenges at AWS to keep you interested and growing. You will contribute rich JavaScript, HTML, and CSS components that simplify content authoring and enable rich presentation. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

So, practically, what does it take? What do you need to know?

jobs.title: Amazon Web Services, Marketing, Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Join us as we create the premier website for all users of Amazon Web Services. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail of our site -http://aws.amazon.com - to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.

You will find the challenges at Amazon to keep you interested and growing. You will move seamlessly between writing efficient code that scales (without bugs) and helping stakeholders see what’s possible. You will actively mentor junior engineers through code and design reviews, and by personally modeling the highest standards. You will calmly and quickly create elegant solutions to difficult problems. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

jobs.title: DevOps Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The ideal fit for our team is an inspired and motivated engineer who wants to play a key role in the development of our systems and infrastructure. This role involves building, automating and managing key parts of our runtime environment. You will work in a small team and will be expected to act as an "engineer for the engineers," helping others understand the architectures and platforms underlying their features.


We currently use technologies such as Chef, Nginx, Apache, HAProxy, MySQL, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, Ubuntu Linux and more.

jobs.title: Back-End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
If you are an inspired and motivated back-end engineer who cares and thinks as much about the customer experience as you do about technology and smart solutions, you are the person we are looking for. You will be working in a small team and facing new challenges to improve GetYourGuide’s platform services. We love business oriented engineers with a good sense of humor.


We currently use technologies such as PHP, MySQL, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, vagrant, chef, Thrift, and more.

jobs.title: CMS Engineer
jobs.content: In AWS marketing we do things big. https://aws.amazon.com has thousands of pages being updated by hundreds authors being translated into a dozen languages. Our goal in engineering is to facilitate the creative, iterative, and data driven creation of content. As a CMS engineer, you will be helping to translate the experimental A/B tested HTML, JS, and CSS into the CMS framework so the experiment can be made big. You’ll need to look and think deep to tease out the similarities between multiple requests so you can be the right kind of lazy, write it once, use it often.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. Our web applications are at the forefront of this mission and we are looking for great Engineers to push this technology forward while creating an outstanding customer experience.


You will be working in a small and multi-disciplinary teams solving unique, interesting and challenging problems. You will have significant ownership and responsibility as you work on discovering new ways to make a big impact on our customers and business.

jobs.title: Website Pricing TPM, AWS Marketing
jobs.content:
The AWS Marketing team is responsible for providing a first class web experience for our customers looking to find out more about our services. Every visitor to aws.amazon.com is our customer and it’s our team’s job to build and iterate (and iterate again) on a world-class website that raises the bar. Every member of our team strives to be as innovative and agile in the field of web design and development as AWS products are in the field of cloud computing.


As a Pricing TPM for AWS Marketing, you will be responsible for the overall program of displaying pricing data on our public facing web properties. In this role, you will drive and deliver multiple complex pricing related projects. You will provide project leadership, anticipate bottlenecks, mitigate project risks, quantify the impact of making trade-offs, and balance business needs against technical constraints. You will provide technical leadership that gets software applications built and integrated into the aws.amazon.com ecosystem. You will work closely with stakeholders across various design, software and business teams to identify and drive innovative solutions that achieve business goals and align with long term product roadmaps. You will also work both our internal engineering teams and manage external vendors to build out these solutions with a focus on high operational excellence.


A successful candidate will be well versed in what it takes to take a large scale, high traffic, high impact marketing website to the next level. This role requires having a proven track record in delivering website projects plus excellent problem solving, project management, and communication skills.


Responsibilities:



  • Be a guardian of world-class customer experience for your deliverables: continually raise the bar on functionality, flow, consistency, usability, and simplicity

  • Manage and deliver web marketing projects from inception to launch to maintenance

  • Build and maintain a complete project schedule, make it constantly visible to management and key stakeholders, and drive projects through to completion

  • Act as the technical interface between the business and the software development/web design teams. Understand the product and know the right questions and whom to ask.

  • Run in front of the software development team, helping define user stories, research appropriate technical solutions, and provide guidance to the team regarding architecture, design, and priorities

  • Translate feature requests into technical specifications and influence design and architectural decisions

  • Work with the business to scope technical software projects with an understanding of website operations (maintenance, deployments, analytics)

  • Help make the right feature trade-offs to ship software without compromising customer experience or business relevance

  • Engage with many teams across the company, evangelizing the team and your project, building relationships and helping identify existing components and technologies that can be leveraged to deliver on our goals

  • Represent the technical team and deliverables to senior leadership across the company

technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination.

jobs.title: Powerfront QA Software Tester
jobs.content:
Powerfront is looking for talented software testers to work on our 'Inside' platform.
Please note we are looking for offshore staff and not in US for this position.

Inside is a disruptive online real-time visual engagement platform and is already used in the US for very large global retailers.
See more about our exciting world first product at http://www.powerfront.com


We are a dedicated, passionate and close knit team with technology running through our veins.
We're reinventing the world of eCommerce software; we're not developing small applications.
We have developed software that transforms the way companies run their online business.
You'll use the latest technologies. Every day, you'll be challenged.

EOE/M/F/Disabled/Veteran

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Pathogen Informatics
jobs.content:
The Pathogen Informatics team at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute is looking to recruit an experienced Senior Software Developer

Salary range 31,033 - 39,142 pa plus excellent benefits

We are seeking to recruit a Senior Software Developer to work within the Pathogen Informatics team at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The Pathogen Informatics team develop and maintain software applications and systems to support the research activities of the Pathogen Variation program. The Pathogen Variation programme conducts large-scale next-generation sequencing experiments to understand the origin, transmission and evolution of pathogens, as well as phenotypic experiments to dissect pathogen biology. The Pathogen Informatics team play a key role in the the delivery of many of these large-scale pathogen projects and the successful candidate will be responsible for developing software and systems to manage, analyse, query and visualise the vast amounts of data produced by these projects.

The team is based on the principles of agile development so that the software can be rapidly prototyped, updated regularly and receive rapid feedback from scientists in the Pathogen Variation program. The team employ a test-driven development strategy for all software development projects and strongly promote open source development using Github for all software projects.

This role would suit somebody with well developed programming skills and is looking for a new challenge or a scientific programmer who wishes to gain direct knowledge of next-generation sequencing technologies. The successful candidate will work closely with the lead developers and analysts in the team so previous experience with sequence data is not strictly necessary.


Essential Skills

  • A Ph.D. degree in a scientific or engineering discipline (or equivalent experience)
  • Significant programming experience in one or more programming languages (e.g. Perl, Python, C etc.)
  • Experience of object oriented development
  • Demonstrable experience of using UNIX / LINUX
  • Knowledge of relational database systems and manipulation via SQL
  • Experience of using software version control
  • An ability to learn quickly on the job with excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Must be self-motivated and proactive with ability to manage own workload effectively
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills


Other information



The Sanger Institute is a charitably funded research centre focused on understanding the role of genetics in health and disease. We use state of the art large-scale genomic approaches to drive world-leading projects to uncover the basis of genetic and infectious disease. Our goal is to provide results that can be translated into diagnostics, treatments or therapies that reduce global health burdens.

Our Benefits include: Defined Contribution Pension Scheme, Group Income Protection, Healthcare scheme, Childcare Vouchers, Workplace Nursery and 25 days Annual Leave, increasing by one day per year up to a maximum of 30, plus Bank Holidays. We also have a gym, two cafes, dining facilities, and a free campus bus service. Our thriving Sports and Social Club provides many opportunities to meet with people working across the campus.

Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute welcomes applications from all candidates irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief, or marital or civil partnership status.

Please include a covering letter and CV with your application.

Closing date for applications is 24th July 2016.

jobs.title: Enterprise Process Engineer
jobs.content:
Description/Background


Demands on IT for innovation and reliability have been steadily increasing since technology became a critical success factor for most businesses. IT has always been asked to do more with less, to improve its integration with business goals and to ensure the ongoing quality of IT services. With the rise of mobile technology, the cloud and an "app" mentality, IT is being asked to do all that and more at breakneck speed. While devices and applications are being introduced faster than ever before, it is the service behind the technology that is still most important to the customer. As a result, IT will always need to manage its services and IT Service management (ITSM) practices and processes will always be necessary. The challenge is adapting service management practices to changing times so they can enable IT to go faster and deliver more ongoing value to the customer.


Processes are even more critical than before for the success of our IT organization:



  • They help facilitate a common understanding of the current environment we are working in. Although this may seem superfluous to some, formally documenting the processes currently used within the organization will lead to many interesting conversations about how things should really work and, ultimately, to a shared understanding of exactly what we are engaged in and how we execute our day-to-day work.

  • They help to identify areas of improvement either through targeted automation or wide-scale process reengineering.

  • They help identify problem areas that the organization doesn't yet address or that the organization is very weak in.

  • They provide important information to teams helping them scope their work correctly and in the right direction, in line with the business demands.


Within ING, we have noticed that in time process knowledge, adherence to the process and process performance have been in a downward spiral. This has contributed to less reliable products and systems. With the start of the Reliability programme in March 2015 process owners/engineers have been appointed to work within the processes-stream of the scoped Reliability – initiative. Outcome being the reintroduction of the role Enterprise Process Engineer. The Enterprise Process Engineer will be responsible for  continuously improving the IT Process and test-driven validation of process standards and their utilization. 



Goals



  • Implementing Agile Process Management

  • Implement ITSM Processes in alignment with the DevOps way of working so that teams can make optimal use of it.

  • The EPE is responsible for optimizing, integrating, standardizing and sustainably managing the ING IT processes across domains and geographies.

  • Implementing new Tooling for enabling smarter Process management

  • The Product Owner (PO) should only accept stories from the EPE of the ITSM process - This implies that the Global Community of stakeholders will exist of all EPEs.

  • The EPE is responsible for challenging, discussing and gathering the user stories in alignment with the global collaborative community.

  • The mandate of the EPE exceeds the mandate of the PO for stories on process / data model. The PO still stays responsible for prioritizing and delivering the product.

  • Build an effective operating model, together with the Collaborative Communities

  • Together with Process Experts within the Business Domains the EPE should:


    • Discuss the current implementation of the process

    • Define the target end state

    • Establishing a plan to reach the target end state


  • Ensure transparency in process adherence / compliance via reporting.

  • EPEs must actively monitor all ING business domains, regions to ensure that they are compliant with and adhere the implemented processes. EPEs are responsible for delivering Key Performance metrics to all management layers, DevOps-teams, Chapters and Tribes.



Scope



  • Enterprise wide – Global ING

  • All Global process related tooling



Duties and Responsibilities



  • Review the effectiveness and efficiency of the process

  • Manage process improvements and facilitate process implementation

  • Ensure that the process is defined, documented, maintained & communicated throughout the organization

  • Define and develop Process Key Performance metrics

  • Ensure adequate process training is available

  • Test driven validation of processes within the organization (engineering) to monitor and report on the performance, compliance and adherence of the process

  • Setup and lead the Process Collaborative Community



Mandate



  • Owner of a specific ITSM Process

  • Owner of the implemented ITSM Process for all Service Management tools

  • Owner of the CMDB Datamodel for all CMDB’s (EPE Configuration Management)

  • All Changes on CMDB Datamodel should be approved by the EPE and the Collaborative Community.

  • Responsible for Training on the implemented ITSM Process.

  • Responsible for knowledge management.

  • Responsible and Owner for/of (delivery of) metrics on process / data quality.

  • Responsible for integration/interfacing to other processes.



Organization


As EPE you will be part of the Ops&IT Banking of ING within the COO - Unify IT domain, which is responsible for implementing the Agile way of working at ING across the globe.



Skills



  • Experienced in working in/with DevOps-teams

  • Master in Agile way of working using a Backlog, Epicss, User stories

  • Knowledge of IT strategy and business plan

  • Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures and standards

  • Knowledge of the ITSM process model

  • Develop business process improvements/re-design

  • Implement quality process metrics

  • Experienced in business process management, process measurement and transition/ transformation

  • Stakeholder management

  • Strong verbal / written communication skills



Competencies



  • Persuasiveness

  • Team spirit

  • Organisation sensitivity

  • Stress resistance

  • Innovative thinker

  • Leadership

  • Proactive

  • Independent

  • Visionary

jobs.title: Dev Engineer Java
jobs.content:
BMG is looking for 4 experienced (mid-senior level) Dev Engineers
to strengthen its development teams that deliver solutions to treasurers of multinationals worldwide.



Company profile


Bank Mendes Gans (BMG) is known world-wide as a niche bank for liquidity and information management services, providing integrated customized solutions for corporate companies around the globe. BMG has developed and perfected a full and integrated range of liquidity and information management services required by its corporate clients whom it serves with a high level of professionalism and personal service. BMG is part of the ING Commercial Banking Clients & Network. We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build and how far we are.



Company culture 



  • A customer centric and result driven mentality with professional, high quality standards

  • An organization that values initiative and entrepreneurship

  • A true hands-on mentality



Your main responsibility



  • Delivering innovative, reliable and high quality solution.

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins, peer code reviews, static code analysis, to running automated functional regressions test against the backend APIs (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, Git, Crucible, Jenkins, ….

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.



Profile (desired skills & experience)



  • Bachelor degree

  • Proficient in English and Dutch (verbal and written)

  • At least 5 years of work experience in software development with at least 3 years of hands-on Java programming

  • Strong knowledge of Java development for internet and mobile solutions. You know the difference between the frameworks and know which to apply depending on the requirements

  • Knowledge of continuous Integration tools like: GIT, Sonar, Jmeter, Jenkins, Fortify and able to configure these tools

  • Having an agile mind set, fast to adapt constant changes and feeling comfortable with it

  • Focused on what is most important at all time, realizing when to change the game plan and when to stick to it

  • Good social and communication skills

  • Open, you say what you mean and mean what you say



Just like our colleagues, you aim to be the best in the class. As a team, you are therefore able to take each other to new heights. Your proactive and results-oriented attitude ensures that you always strive for the best results.


What we offer


Working at BMG means working in a dynamic and international setting. Very important is individual development of our employees and that is why BMG offers excellent courses and programs.



In addition we offer:



  • an excellent salary

  • a thirteenth month

  • life-course savings scheme

  • public transport season ticket



Would you like to know more or apply?


Do you recognize yourself in this profile? Apply now and become member of IT at BMG.

jobs.title: Android Mobile Dev Engineer
jobs.content:
ING is looking for an experienced (mid-senior level) Android Mobile Dev Engineer to strengthen its development team that delivers complex mission-critical mobile solutions for the Global digital channels space.


If you want to work at a place where we you have an impact to work on the mobile app that will be available worldwide to the commercial clients of a leading global bank, where we care about scoring high on The Joel Test, where we believe that you can live by the agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary compliance and QA measures, where we find that the problem chooses the language/technology and not the other way around, where we are committed to fostering a proper engineering culture and building a high-productivity team of smart Dev engineers with the getting-things done mentality, please read on.


Job Description


Your main focus will be on building ING’s:



  • Native mobile and tablet applications for Android for our new multi-product and multi-country ING Commercial Banking InsideBusiness portal, which gives clients integrated access to Commercial Banking products and services. The app will be available to our commercial customers world-wide.

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins, peer code reviews, static code analysis, to running automated functional regressions test against the backend APIs (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, Git, Crucible, Jenkins, Gradle, Espresso, …).

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.


Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels.


We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build and how far we are.


Profile (desired skills & experience)



  • Master of Science in Computer Science or an equivalent field.

  • You love technology and naturally stay up-to-date on relevant new developments.

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience, preferably in creating high scalability mission-critical applications.

  • You are able to develop efficient and maintainable code with the right balance between solving the problem at hand and not over-engineering your solution.

  • You have real world OO design experience and knowledge of design patterns, combined with an ability to succinctly convey design information using suitable tools (e.g. the UML, BPMN).

  • Excellent knowledge of Java and Android SDK and a minimum of 3 years of solid experience with the Android platform.

  • Knowledge of other modern OO languages especially Swift, Objective-C and ability to develop for iOS, while not mandatory, will be greatly valued.

  • Good knowledge OS fundamentals with the ability to apply it in the context of modern operating systems (e.g. Linux, OS X, Windows Server 2008/2012).

  • A working knowledge of JavaScript and WEB 2.0 applied in the context of Hybrid mobile development using frameworks such as PhoneGap or Titanium is big nice-to-have.

  • Even though not mandatory, experience with at least one modern scripting language (e.g. python, ruby, etc.)

  • You have sound knowledge of relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MS SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc). Knowledge of NoSQL datastores, while not mandatory, is a strong nice-to-have.

  • Great English communication skills, verbal as well as written.

  • You value a multi-cultured environment where English is the working language and you easily get on with people from different cultural backgrounds.


What do we offer


Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting. Very important is individual development of our employees and that is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. In addition we offer:


• an excellent salary


• a thirteenth month


• life-course savings scheme


• public transport season ticket

Are you an IT Support professional with at least 6 years IT support experience?

Powerfront is looking for talented DevOps / Technical Support Engineer to support our Powerfront CMS platform.


We are a dedicated, passionate and close knit team with technology running through our veins. We're reinventing the world of eCommerce software; we're not developing small applications. We have developed software that transforms the way companies run their online business. You'll use the latest technologies. Every day, you'll be challenged. A career at Powerfront is your opportunity to become a leader in the future of the software industry.


Responsibilities



  • Management of systems ensuring maximum system availability by maintaining a stable, standard and secure technology platform

  • Monitoring, administration and management of server/network infrastructure (internal and hosted)

  • Support server, network and desktop hardware, software and applications

  • Installing patches and security upgrades on server infrastructure

  • Use formal Change Request process for making changes to infrastructure.

  • Provide help desk support to clients and resellers by phone or email using the Help desk Ticket system

  • Stress Testing Sites

  • Client email support

  • Copying Client Sites & Client data

  • Provide dedicated support during system critical & high platform availability incidents as a key member of the 24x7 incident response team

  • Plan Manage and implement authorised infrastructure projects e.g. server optimisation, firewall replacement, setup U.S. hosting services etc.

  • Disaster recovery plan development, implementation and maintenance

  • Documentation of all systems configurations and processes


Values we look for



  • Honesty, Caring, Self-Improvement, Confidence, Fun, Productivity and Toughness.

  • Showing an eagerness to grow and learn more about the business. This includes asking questions, reading, modeling others, and being open and responsive to feedback/areas of improvement.

  • Exhibit professionalism and commitment to role, the company and creation of the product.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer - Pathogen Informatics
jobs.content:
The Pathogen Informatics team at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute is looking to recruit an experienced Java Developer

Salary range 31033 to 39142 pa plus excellent benefits

We are seeking to recruit a Senior Java Developer to work within the Pathogen Informatics team at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The Pathogen Informatics team develop and maintain software applications and systems to support the research activities of the Pathogen Variation program. The candidate will take responsibility for updating and maintaining a set of existing gene annotation and visualisation tools. The main responsibility will be to develop a comprehensive test set and set up a test automation framework for these tools, update them to be compatible with the latest version of Java and package the tools for ease of distribution (e.g. with Homebrew). The candidate will also be expected to address an outstanding set of bug reports and feature requests for these tools. Finally, there will be scope for the successful candidate to propose new functionality and directions for the software.

The ideal candidate will have significant experience in developing software in Java and testing frameworks for Java along with a pragmatic approach to software development. The successful candidate will work closely with the lead developers and analysts in the team so previous experience with bioinformatics/biological data is not strictly necessary. This role would suit somebody who is looking for a new challenge and to gain experience working in the fields of bioinformatics, genome sequencing technologies, and test driven software development.

The team is based on the principles of agile development so that the software can be rapidly prototyped, updated regularly and receive rapid feedback from scientists in the Pathogen Variation program. The team employ a test-driven development strategy for all software development projects and strongly promote open source development using Github for all software projects.


Essential Skills

  • MSc or equivalent experience in Computer Science or Software Engineering discipline
  • Significant programming experience in Java
  • Experience with software testing frameworks
  • Knowledge and experience of relational databases
  • An ability to learn quickly on the job with excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Must be self-motivated and proactive with ability to manage own workload effectively
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills


Other information



The Sanger Institute is a charitably funded research centre focused on understanding the role of genetics in health and disease. We use state of the art large-scale genomic approaches to drive world-leading projects to uncover the basis of genetic and infectious disease. Our goal is to provide results that can be translated into diagnostics, treatments or therapies that reduce global health burdens.

The Institute is located near Cambridge, UK on the stunning Wellcome Genome Campus.

Our Benefits include: Defined Contribution Pension Scheme, Group Income Protection, Healthcare scheme, Childcare Vouchers, Workplace Nursery and 25 days Annual Leave, increasing by one day per year up to a maximum of 30, plus Bank Holidays. We also have a gym, two cafes, dining facilities, and a free campus bus service. Our thriving Sports and Social Club provides many opportunities to meet with people working across the campus.

Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute welcomes applications from all candidates irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief, or marital or civil partnership status.

Please include a covering letter and CV with your application.

This is a fixed-term 2 year position and closing date for applications is 24th July 2016

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
With our steadily growing R&D department the time is now to form a team of DevOps engineers that focus on improving our internal build infrastructure. We have monthly releases and need to optimize the processes for releasing new features.


The tasks are non-customer facing but to support and improve our R&D department. The goal is to make the work of our 70 R&D engineers as frictionless as possible.


Why we like it here:



  • We’re building something new, making stuff up as we go along.

  • All scrum teams have the guiding principle: You build it, you run it.

  • We’re stubborn and like to get to the bottom of things; clear answers are more important than deadlines.

  • We dabble in all sorts of technologies when it takes our fancy. We use Gitlab to manage our repositories. Next to that we use Jenkins to build our product and to run our CI.

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the Full Stack Developer we're looking for?
Are you passionate about creating magical user experiences? Bring that love, and your skillful way of solving users needs to us. We're looking for an experienced full-stack engineer equally comfortable working on greenfield features and refactoring legacy code.

If you love setting others up for success as much as you love stepping up to achieve results, you're probably the type of person we want on our team. We are looking for engineers who can raise the skill level of their teammates and love to give back through tech talks, lightning talks, etc. We would also love it if you were an Open Source contributor.

You will be working closely with our customer success team.  If you love seeing real customers quickly benefiting your work, then this is the role for you.

Please note preference is given to people working within +/- 3hours from our Singapore timezone.

About Us:
Dekeo is a new branded site being spun out of a fast-growing, profitable company. Dekeo is creating a global ecommerce marketplace for promotional products (putting company or team logos on t-shirts, water bottles, and stickers).  While the company is still very much at a growth stage there's a huge number of technical challenges still to solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to be built

How we'd like you to help us:
  • Write clean, maintainable and efficient code
  • Design robust, scalable and secure features
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle

What we'd like to see in the candidate:
  • BS in Computer Science combined with 1+ years of experience working on the web applications at scale
  • Expert understanding of front-end technologies HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
  • Good understanding of server-side templating languages (such as Liquid, Slim, etc depending on your technology stack)
  • Good understanding of server-side CSS preprocessors (such as SCSS, based on project requirements)
  • Experience with Bootstrap
  • A knack for writing clean, readable Ruby code and working knowledge of Ruby on Rails conventions
  • Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (e.g. Git)
  • Possible experience working with large, custom search systems using Solr or ElasticSearch
  • Experience with agile story tool such as Pivotal Tracker

Compensation
  • Competitive Compensation  

To apply: Send your resume together with a cover letter mentioning "We Work Remotely" to: 13F804E05E@jobs.workablemail.com

jobs.title: Creative Director, Experience Design
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Position: Creative Director Experience Design

Location: Philadelphia





The Team:

The Comcast Experience Design (XD) team is transforming how Comcast customers access and enjoy entertainment, communications and home management services across all mediums-online, mobile and TV. By assembling the country's top designers and thinkers, the XD team is rapidly becoming the premier environment for building and launching one-of-a-kind experiences that make everyday life easier and more entertaining for millions of customers.





The Role:

This is an exciting opportunity to revolutionize customer service for the largest multi-media and entertainment company in the U.S. We're looking for a Creative Director to join our team to lead ideation, strategy and concept across various customer experience initiatives. The Creative Director will focus attention on products aimed at helping Comcast achieve our goal of providing the best experience to our customers at every touch-point.





- Provide creative thought leadership and drive visual design by combining industry best practices with your own expertise and insights about human behavior.

- Support the creation and communication of overarching UX strategies.

- Lead UX team in ideation and concept explorations, as well as partner Engineering, Product Management and other internal business units to define the strategy and experience of consumer facing products.

- Ensure consistent, unified user experience across all platforms by basing decisions on industry standard methodologies, user research and adhering to visual language and style guide.

- Engage UX Research team by participating in or consulting throughout research process.

- Ensure design goals align with overarching company goals.

- Manages and leads a team of Designers, Front End Developers, Information Architects, Content Developers, Usability Analysts, and augmented consultants.

- Manages outside vendors, contractors, and related budgets.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Qualifications:



- Design professional with 10 or more years of relevant work experience

- Demonstrated ability to design inspiring new solutions to challenges, often in collaboration with end users, frontline workers and stakeholders.

- Expertly skilled in compiling the results of customer research into insights, service opportunities and design principles.

- Expert ability to deliver solid work in a deadline-driven environment.

- Superior communication and leadership skills.

- Outstanding facilitation, brainstorming and collaboration skills.

- A strong portfolio showcasing UX leadership in developing interactive online and mobile products for large consumer base required; broadcast, print, identity, packaging are a plus.

jobs.title: Director/Technical Platform Owner, VIPER
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Do you want to be part of the revolution that is reshaping television? Can you set the agenda for how leading-edge technology is applied and work with top-flight engineers to deliver innovation in digital media and entertainment services? Are you passionate, motivated, and energized by big challenges?





As a Technical Platform Owner (TPO) on the Alternate Content team at VIPER, you will develop and manage the roadmap that translates business needs into platform releases for a suite of components enabling Dynamic Ad Insertion (DAI), addressable advertising, and blackout in IP Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services. The VIPER team is a new, small and nimble team of world-class experts who are innovating in end-to-end video delivery. Every day, we do things no one has done before, and we thrive on big challenges, results, quality, and agility.





Who does the Technical Platform Owner work with?



VIPER TPOs straddle the boundary between business and technology. We take business requirements from service owners for VIPER's Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services and work with architects and engineering leads to define solutions and align them with our platform roadmap and priorities. Then we work with development leads and delivery owners to drive those solutions through engineering backlogs, sprint plans, QA testing, and release plans, seeing them through into production in collaboration with service delivery and operations engineers. We have overall responsibility for the roadmap, prioritization, and work queue for our platforms, and cradle-to-grave ownership of the components our platform teams produce. TPOs are a unique blend of business savvy and technical affinity, with strong executive, analytical, and organizational skills for planning, prioritizing, and communicating, and exceptional interpersonal skills for leading, influencing, and collaborating, all paired with the ability to comprehend complex technical problems and solutions.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



In your role, you will develop, maintain, and publish a roadmap for the alternate content platform. You will balance how requests for new features and functionality, technical debt, and innovation are mapped into that roadmap. Collaborate with the platform team to translate functional scope to technical solutions for all roadmap items. Write technical requirements (stories) for those solutions. You will have solid knowledge and understanding of all initiatives within your platform whether in analysis, in flight, or in production. You will collaborate with other TPOs for platforms both upstream and downstream of yours to identify dependencies and assess impact of their initiatives on your roadmap, as well as impact of your roadmap on theirs.





Where can you make an impact?



You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in video delivery to create and deploy video services that will reset the bar for what people expect of television in accessibility, ease-of-use, feature richness, and quality. Success in this role is characterized by increased predictability of platform releases in terms of features, functionality, and timing, and increased cadence of releases / compressed release cycle times as a result of better planning, alignment, and execution against the roadmap.





Responsibilities:




  • Align and prioritize the alternate content platform roadmap with inputs from across the VIPER service roadmaps, in collaboration with service owners and service architects

  • Align functional scope for roadmap items with required technical solutions in collaboration with technical platform team

  • Own technical solutions across the alternate content technical platform group, to include:

    • Project scope

    • Production support

    • Technical debt, innovation, experimentation, and lessons learned activity



  • Accountable for supporting technical definition of work across the alternate content platform group, to include technical requirement definition and awareness of dependencies across development, testing, and deployment, and dependencies across other VIPER technical platform groups

  • Work with development leads/backlog managers as needed to prioritize and make decisions within specific component backlogs





Skills & Requirements




  • Experience:

    • 9+ years' experience in software product development, including:

      • Minimum 2 years' as a product owner in an Agile development setting

      • Minimum 2 years' as a software engineer or solution architect





  • Education:

    • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

    • MBA desirable



  • Skills:

    • Exceptional organizational skills ability to breakdown and track complex projects, to integrate input from multiple sources, and to identify and track dependencies across projects

    • Exceptional executive skills ability to set clear objectives and focus and motivate teams to drive execution, to prioritize issues and to discern level of urgency and triage appropriately when necessary

    • Exceptional communication skills ability to create clear and concise messages that are audience-appropriate in level of detail and tone, ability to create and maintain process artifacts as required

    • Exceptional collaboration skills ability to build and maintain relationships, to influence without direct authority

    • High level of accountability takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution

    • High energy thrives in fast-paced, high-rate-of-change setting



  • Tools and Technologies:

    • Subject matter expertise in advanced advertising and/or blackout technology

    • Detailed understanding of relevant industry standards including SCTE-130, SCTE-35, SCTE-224

    • Proficiency in Jira, Microsoft Office (especially PowerPoint)

    • Familiarity with software development comprehension of programming language paradigms, data structures, version control, networks and systems.

    • Relevant technologies include:

      • Go (golang)

      • Python 3

      • C

      • C++

      • Java 8

      • Linux (CentOS)

      • Git

      • Apache httpd and the Apache Portable Runtime

      • Redis

      • MongoDB

      • OpenStack









About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.

jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
ClarityAd’s software protects from bad ads. We run ads in our custom browser environment in the cloud to gather hundreds of data points. We assess security and compliance for billions of ad impressions daily. Our back-end stores this wealth of data in a way that's usable and efficient, allowing publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time.


You will work with our VP of engineering and back-end engineering team and you will be directly involved in:



  • Setting up a robust and highly scalable backend

  • Optimizing database queries and caching as required

  • Optimizing web server configurations

  • And most importantly, participating in the day-to-day improvement and extension of our product functionalities, for all things backend.


We would love to hire someone with ad tech experience, but we’re ready to train newbies and give you a deep understanding of the ad serving stack and Real Time Bidding (RTB). This environment has grown to such a level of complexity and automation that consuming online media has become an exercise of frustration: Latency, invasive ads, privacy issues, malware/malvertising that exposes users to trojans, ransomware, botnets… The rational option for the audience is to rely on ad blockers. Our unique product suite makes it possible for publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time. We have the secret sauce to disrupt this market for good, annihilate the bad actors and restore confidence in publishers.


We are passionate about solving these issues and we want to grow our team with people who share our vision and ambition.


We use: PHP, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis + Lua, Node.js, C++ (browser sandbox). Our infrastructure includes: AWS EC2 (thousands of VMs) / Route53 / ELB / S3 / Bare metal / lots of exotic hardware in exotic places with exotic vendors all playing nice with Puppet.


We value diversity and we’re not looking to hire candidates whose experience is a perfect match to our tech stack. We expect you to bring your own background and experience to the problems we are solving.


Bragging rights:



  • We routinely are the 1st to report on-going live malvertising attacks to ad platforms, including to Google

  • We increased our volumes by 20x last year and keep getting stronger

  • We have have received mentions in Google’s Security Hall of Fame

  • We’re still an “engineer only” startup, even as our monthly revenue passed into six figures less than 3 years in


The position is open to remote candidates in eastern time zone from USA or Canada. Half of our team is working remotely and we meet every 6 weeks in person.


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Health care coverage

  • Health savings account

  • Dependent Care FSA

jobs.title: Senior Architect
jobs.content:
At DISH we invest in innovative IT architecture that fulfills company’s both long term and short term goals. Our software architects are responsible for providing practical solutions to business projects for sales, marketing and customer service and delivering architecture strategies for IT system evolutions.


Primary responsibilities of this position fall into the following categories: 



  • Technical Leadership – provide technical vision, direction and leadership across a wide spectrum of technologies with specific in depth expertise in multiple tier applications, data and integration or infrastructure technologies.

  • Education – provide architectural expertise and direction to Project Managers, Business Liaisons, System Analysts, other Architects and lead Developers.

  • Architecture Governance – engage across project teams, vendors and other stakeholders to ensure business projects and enabling technology are delivered in line with the agreed Enterprise Architecture.

  • Solution – provide architecture and high level designs for web and mobile applications, scalable middleware and third party system integrations.

  • Technology – research new technologies in Cloud Computing, Big Data, Mobile Application and Social Media and validate applicability to current infrastructure by extensive prototyping.

  • System Standards – develop in-depth knowledge and document existing IT system portfolio and future architecture/infrastructure and technology standards.

jobs.title: Sr. Development Engineer - Java
jobs.content:
DISH is looking for software engineers to support its products and services through agile software development in our exciting new downtown DISH IT office.


We are looking for mid-level/senior Java Developers who have or are interested in the following:





Job Duties and Responsibilities:





You Have…



  • Experience leading full-stack agile development teams

  • Experience managing architecture for complex enterprise systems

  • Hands-on experience with full-stack application development

  • Experience writing modular, testable, and documented code

  • Strong communication skills with ability to provide explanation to others on complex issues

  • Self motivated to work in a fast paced agile and ambiguous environment with min guidance


You Like...



  • To coordinate work between analysts, developers, & QA

  • To work cross-functionally with product and other teams on requirements and possible solutions

  • To negotiate & prioritize projects along with complex production issues

jobs.title: Senior Software Analyst
jobs.content:
Supports business-requirements solicitation and develops system requirements and models, as necessary, for development and testing of new applications and/or enhancements to existing applications. Understands and addresses ‘as-is’ and ‘to be’ processes for projects to address end-to-end solutions. Supports level-of-effort project estimations and execution of tasks for the full project lifecycle. Assists in resolving ad-hoc production support questions/issues for applications and data analysis.

Essential Duties



  • Develops test scenarios and assists with data loading for User Acceptance Testing

  • Works with customers to detail business and system requirements

  • Works with development teams and other systems analysts to update/enhance enterprise-level functional architectures

  • Estimates levels of effort (LOEs) for work requests: analysis, design, development and testing

  • Works as part of a team with business users such as network operations, softswitch deployment, product managers, as well as project engineers, software development leads and software developers

  • Facilitates project scoping and determination of solution approaches

  • Generates use cases, detailed systems requirements and logical/object data models

  • Participates in and/or consults on Integrated Application and Regression Testing

  • Produces system user guides, when appropriate

jobs.title: Developer for Wireless Lighting System
jobs.content:
We're hiring a developer for a wireless lighting controls platform we're building. We're still early on with the product, so there is plenty of room for the right person to have a big impact. The role spans the gamut on HTML/JS, JSON APIs, databases, backend RPC, data aggregation, and interactions with mobile applications (just to name a few). We launched earlier this year and are gaining some pretty exciting customers.


If you're interested in joining a small dev team to help drive the product development, we'd love to chat more.

jobs.title: IT Production Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibility for assuring that computer systems in the data center and/or network systems are running according to normal processes. Translates the client's complex production issues into an executable course of action. Escalates urgent problems requiring more in-depth knowledge to appropriate development resources.


Essential Duties



  • Analyzes trends to improve customer experience and reduce costs, develops creative solutions to chronic issues.

  • Coordinates with resolver groups, GTO, third party service providers or development teams for problem resolution.

  • Critical Incident Management - Provides leadership to drive issues to resolution in the most efficient manner, communicate timely status on critical incidents during and after events.

  • Develops and manages projects to drive down ticket volume, increase stability, decrease resolution time and improve customer satisfaction.

  • Drives SIPs (Service Improvement Plans) cross-team, follow through to resolution.

  • Interacts and partners with development teams and end user group management to represent and advocate for resolution of production concerns.

  • Problem Management - Reviews ticket data for pattern identification, root cause analysis, drives out system and process changes to avoid repetition of incidents/problems.

  • Provides 24x7 on-call support on a rotating basis.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The internet is experiencing a transformation – ad blindness and blocking are forcing media companies and advertisers to rethink the way they connect with consumers. This evolution is changing the way we consume content and how we interact with brands. Nativo is enabling this shift by developing the media and advertising platform of the future enabling brands and media companies to engage consumer with content rather than interrupt them with ads.


For brands, Nativo provides the ultimate technology for distributing content into native placements and measuring its impact across premium publications. For media companies, Nativo is the platform of choice for automating the workflows around native ad serving. From the hands and minds of an amazing team, Nativo has engineered a platform that is recognized as the best in market. Nativo is respected, well-funded, and growing rapidly. Nativo is playing a vital role forging the path of media and advertising’s evolution.


We believe in being smart, innovative, pragmatic, polished, and efficient and are looking for remarkable people that identify and fit with those values. The DevOps Engineer will be an integral part of the effort to develop our next generation platform. We want team members who have a passion for leveraging technology and software to solve problems and maximize productivity and efficiency.


WHAT YOU WILL DO



  • Work as part of a small DevOps team to build and manage a resilient and secure infrastructure for application platform.

  • Collaborate with development team to fulfill each other's requirement, create scripts, modify source codes if needed or workarounds (requires solid knowledge of programming)

  • Scale infrastructure to meet rapidly increasing demand

  • Improve automated deployments, monitoring, management and incident response

  • Monitor site stability and performance and troubleshoot site issues

  • Conduct stress, high availability and proof of concept tests

  • Get up to speed and understand our technology stack

jobs.title: IT Project Manager
jobs.content:
This is a virtual, work-from-home position. Must be a U.S. resident


We are growing! Join a department of developers, business analysts, QA, and support specialists who support an entrepreneurial company of over 80 people with industry-leading web applications in areas of subscription-based continuing education, simulation and training, eCommerce, content management, and more. (www.audiologyonline.com | www.speechpathology.com | www.physicaltherapy.com | www.occupationaltherapy.com | www.simucase.com | www.audiologydesign.com )


ABOUT THE COMPANY


We build start-ups and nurture them into mature, successful companies. We are fast-paced, structured, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions and we’re looking for another person to join our cause.


ABOUT THE TEAM


Though we are virtual, we communicate a lot and have a tight-knit group. Our meetings are filled with sarcasm, laughter, and movie quotes. We meet face-to-face several times a year but work primarily on Skype. Everyone works hard, we contribute directly to the success of the company, and we have an excellent work/life balance.


ABOUT THE POSITION


We are seeking an experienced and engaged IT PROJECT MANAGER who is motivated, creative, and fun to extend our current project management capabilities.



  • Full-Time, 8a-5p in your time zone

  • Work from your home office

  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, Internet stipend, etc

  • Must be located in the United States and be legally eligible to work for us without visa sponsorship.

  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once or twice per year for team or project meetings.


 Responsibilities



  • Manage major and minor web application projects from kickoff through development and QA.

  • Produce, organize, and update necessary project plans, documentation, and project asset documents as required by each project.

  • Develop and execute communication plans on a project-by-project basis.

  • Organize and oversee bug and feature request tracking.

  • Work directly with the IT Business Analyst to assist stakeholders in developing project specifications and keeping functional site documentation up to date.

  • Guide projects through effective change control processes.

  • Write and archive final project reports that summarize project successes, challenges, regression analysis and lessons learned.

  • Along with the PMO, help to refine our internal project management process and best practices, meeting the needs of both the start-up and mature business.


TO APPLY


Submit a cover letter with your resume that includes 1) a project you managed that you are particularly proud of and why; 2) a link to a favorite movie clip on YouTube; and 3) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
With 400+ customers in 60+countries, CounterPath’s innovative software technology is changing the way people communicate around the globe. Named one of Vancouver’s fastest growing companies in 2015, we’re growing and have an immediate need for an iOS Developer to join our team.


We’re looking for a talented and energetic iOS Developer to join our Global Engineering team. In this role you’ll work with some of the biggest telecommunications providers in the world and design, develop, and deploy cutting edge mobile communication applications. Some of our clients include AT&T, British Telecomm, and Google. We’re looking for someone who’s highly collaborative, self-motivated, and obsessed with learning.


This is a full time opportunity for employment. This person must be willing to work out of one of five North American offices: Victoria, Vancouver, Kanata, Boston, or Chicago.

jobs.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer in Santa Barbara, CA
jobs.content: You will work closely with other Ruby on Rails developers in a small team to develop the frontend and backend software used in our analytics product. Key technologies include: Javascript (front end), Ruby apps used for setup, management and presentation of analytics findings, ETL app for processing and loading incoming data from buildings, and PostgreSQL for storing data from buildings. Additionally we use Java and Groovy for some of the algorithm implementations so familiarity with either is a bonus. We use TDD methodologies and practice lightweight Agile development processes.

jobs.title: Linux DevOps Engineer
jobs.company: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
jobs.content: As directed by the Chief Technology Officer, the Linux DevOps Engineer will be responsible for implementing, managing and supporting a growing Linux, OSX, and iOS environments. The Linux DevOps Engineer will also work closely with the museum's Facilities and Content Strategy departments to support Linux-based AV and digital signage systems. The Linux DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the installation, and maintenance of software development and testing environments and be willing to take on a DevOps role when needed. Familiarity with GitHub, Puppet, Chef, Elk, JIRA/ Confluence, and Continuous Integration for AWS will help to get the job done. The Linux DevOps Engineer should also be familiar with Windows; SFMOMA's network is predominantly Windows, but the need for Linux is growing.

jobs.title: Tools & Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
Activision Central Technology (CT) is a group of engineers that collaborate with Activision studios to provide expertise in tools, graphics, systems engineering, and optimization.


The CT tools engineers at times support all parts of the asset creation, build pipelines, and automation across the studios. For example, we provide a centralized server farm, with bespoke systems for continuous integration and testing. We offer expertise in devops-style automation.


Our work also takes us into studio-specific tools, where we help with robustness, optimization, and occasional feature development.


We thrive on finding root causes of instability and slowdowns. We obsess about details and quality.


Today we are looking for engineers at all levels of seniority to help drive these efforts forward. If you are passionate about helping others, excited about unlocking team productivity, and overall love to solve problems, we want to talk with you!



Responsibilities:



  • Assist in designing, developing and maintaining tools, testing frameworks, and build services and infrastructure

  • Maintain a solid understanding of the production pipelines at our studios

  • Write clear, maintainable, well-commented, and highly functional code

  • Profile, analyze, and optimize tools, processes, and pipelines

  • Work on run time engine tasks as needed to support specific project requirements

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Naked Apartments, a Zillow Group Company, is looking for an exceptional Full Stack Engineer to conceive, plan and build extraordinary features and products.

We're committed to providing fulfilling, challenging and interesting positions, while maintaining a healthy work/life balance. And we're committed to making a difference for tens of thousands of renters, everyday. Sound like fun? Read on...

When you work for Naked Apartments, you'll work in one of our satellite offices your living room. We enjoy the benefits of working from home, and plan to continue doing so even as the team grows. Say goodbye to traffic, to subway crowds, to office distractions and to endless meetings, but be prepared for aggressive goals, challenging deadlines and the satisfaction of quickly deploying beautiful products to customers.

Responsibilities:
  • Plan, build and launch features and products
  • Software design, architecture and research
  • Collaborate to craft elegant and engaging user experiences
  • Challenge, mentor and learn from your peers
  • Continually broaden and refine your own skills

What we're looking for:
  • Expert knowledge of Rails and Ruby
  • Experience with authoring and maintaining gems
  • Solid understanding of object oriented programming, CS fundamentals, relational databases, and scaling
  • Advanced testing ability
  • Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git preferred)
  • Not afraid to code on the front-end (HTML, SASS, jQuery, and ES6)
  • Stand up for what you believe in and ability to argue your opinions succinctly
  • Direct participation in the decision making process
  • A passion for owning a project from conception to deployment into production

Bonus points for experience with:
  • Elastic Search
  • MongoDB
  • Chef
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Large datasets

Personal traits:
  • Highly productive, passionate, self motivated, and a fast learner
  • A scrappy, entrepreneurial attitude
  • Clear and candid communication
  • You're smart, humble and don't take yourself too seriously
  • Equal willingness to both learn and to teach

About Naked Apartments, Inc.

When you join the Naked Apartments team, you become part of a smart, entrepreneurial group that loves thinking big, moving fast, while working together and having fun. We pride ourselves on our scrappy, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude, and our belief in full product ownership.

Our team is provided with incredible resources to further our careers, plus competitive compensation and exceptional benefits. Our parent company, Zillow Group (Nasdaq: Z), houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. The Zillow Group opportunity is unlimited.

Join the team and apply today. Help us solve big problems through innovation and incredible technology.

Benefits:
  • Competitive compensation
  • 100% covered insurance premiums (medical, prescription, vision, dental and life)
  • 80% covered dependents premiums (medical, prescription, vision, dental and life)
  • Stock options
  • 401k match
  • FSAs
  • Generous vacation days
  • Gym membership credits, plus free Fitbits
  • Citi Bike memberships
  • 16 weeks fully paid maternity leave and 8 weeks fully paid parental leave.
  • Help with emergency backup childcare
  • $5,000 adoption fee assistance

To apply: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=o31e3fw5&s=weworkremotely

jobs.title: Cross Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Bungie is seeking a relentless code warrior, devoted to the pursuit of programming excellence and furthering our ongoing quest for world domination. When you play games do you find yourself wondering how the code functions under the hood? Why that load took so long? Are you obsessed with evaluating your programs for efficiency and performance? Do you dream in x64 assembly and write poems in VMX. Are you the person that others come to when they can’t debug their code?


Bring your thirst for knowledge, your HW expertise and your ability to draw blood from stones and fuse it with our talented team; together we shall forge a dread Engine that will quake lands (of many architectures) underfoot.


As a Platform Engineer at Bungie, you will participate in the design of future generations of our engine technology. You will learn our engine’s capabilities and then help us expand them by building a structure and framework that enables new heights of flexibility and performance. Most importantly you will work with an exciting and energetic team devoted to creating the best and most technically impressive games in the world.

As an Engineering Lead at Bungie, you will work closely with team leads and production to plan and execute on our vision of creating the best and most technically impressive games in the world.

jobs.title: SDET Lead
jobs.content:
Do you enjoy trying to figure out how to break the games you’re playing? Are you obsessed with finding clever ways to combine items and abilities just to see what will happen? Do you like unraveling how things work, sharing that knowledge with others, and then putting it back together - better, faster, stronger? If so, read on, brave soul.


Bungie is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) Lead who wants to help us push the boundaries of testing software in games. We need someone who shares our passion for automation and tools that: save time, improve workflows, and allow a large test team to be selective in the areas they focus their time. 


An SDET Lead will learn Destiny inside and out; you will gather the deep knowledge of our systems' internals and apply to solve hard test problems. You'll be expected to understand how code and content changes may result in bugs that impact functionality and the player experience. You'll leverage your desire to be the best and push our testing methodologies to new heights.


As an SDET Lead you will coach, grow and develop SDETs that are developing automation to test and improve test workflow for Destiny gameplay, activities and sandbox. You will leverage your ability to mentor and motivate SDETs nearly every day.


If you believe you have the technical and leadership capability to deliver outstanding code, drive quality and help SDETs achieve their potential, we'd love to talk to you.


Responsibilities



  • Lead and manage a team of SDETs delivering test automation and workflow improvement in Destiny gameplay, activities and sandbox

  • Coach, mentor and grow SDETs. Help SDETs grow their career

  • Work with internal “customers” to understand their needs and help craft user stories. Participate in backlog grooming and prioritization of work

  • Feature area risk analysis and mitigation

    • Converse with engineering peers and test allies to generate effective test collateral

    • Set team standards for efficient yet thorough targeted testing

    • Identify and guide authoring of high return on investment automated tests



  • Develop and update tools and processes that allow our test teams to be more efficient

    • Understand multiple technology stacks and engineering workflows

    • Identify workflow pain points/inefficiencies and propose process and engineering solutions

    • Sets team standards for code reviews, authoring and code maintenance according to our development requirements

jobs.title: Senior Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you spend your free time trying to figure out how to break the games you’re playing? Do you see those bugs in games that none of your friends notice until you point them out? Are you obsessed with finding clever ways to combine items and abilities to become the most powerful? Do you like breaking things and letting people know how you did it? We may have a job for you.


Testers at Bungie are grouped into teams, responsible for ensuring that an area of the game is ready to ship. This involves ad-hoc testing, flawlessly executing test passes, rigorous attention to detail, and amazing communication skills. You will work with your lead on a day-to-day basis to determine how to most effectively use your skills.


Senior Test Engineers understand Destiny inside and outside, they have deep knowledge of the internals of the game. They coordinate or lead small test teams responsible for entire systems. They understand how internal changes result in bugs that impact functionality and the player experience. They represent the risks and costs involved in those changes and work collaboratively with their peers to release high quality player experiences within reasonable timeframes. Senior Test Engineers focus on leveraging their technical knowledge to find and prevent bugs from leaking out and educate their peers on the best methods to implement for long term success. They champion automation as part of their team’s daily workflow and identify ways to improve overall team efficiency.


Teams: Bootflow, Graphics, Build Verification Tests, Automation, Platforms, Live, Bungie.net

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content: In addition to making awesome robots that can create almost anything, MakerBot runs Thingiverse, the largest 3D printing repository and social network.  Users have shared over 700,000 projects for things you can 3D print and Thingiverse generates over 1 million downloads a week.  We’ve also built an amazing platform and 3D printing ecosystem built on web technologies.  Our printers are Internet connected to an ecosystem built on Thingiverse using a web REST API providing services such as a cloud storage library and remote monitoring.  We’re looking for a Full Stack Developer to contribute to the new user applications that connect our printers, mobile apps, and desktop app together to provide the best, most user friendly, 3D printing experience.
